reviews:
['Great', "Did this hike on September 11th. First off, Alltrails is not up to date. The hike is now a loop as they've added an entire new section along the other side of the Cape. You can still do it as an out and back if you like but the new part has several new look offs added so I would recommend doing the loop. The loop itself is about 13k but with the added treks to the look offs it's probably more like 14-14.5k if you do the loop and look offs.

When we arrived the parking lot was jam packed so be aware that if you're going there on the weekend and the weather is nice, it will be packed...and I mean packed.

We went to the point on the old trail and returned on the new trail. The old trail was extremely muddy so if you go after a rain, waterproof footwear is recommended. The trail was the same as the parking lot...busy. I'm not a fan of crowded hiking trails so I don't find that very enjoyable.

When we reached the point it was crazy windy...like difficult to stand up windy. The views from the point are nothing short of spectacular.

We returned on the new trail which is slightly longer than the old trail to the point. Part of the reason for this is the trail is extremely curvy, winding through the woods. To the point that at times it actually seems unnecessary. But it is a nice trail with less mud then in the way in, but muddy non the less.

The look offs are a nice addition but are a bit disappointing when you get to them given the extra distance to reach them (3 in total although one was not completed when we were there). ", 'Great', "The new loop makes the hike definitely longer, but it's nice to have a change in scenery and the new lookoff spots. I went after the rain, and the new path was almost as muddy as the old path. There was a lot of people on the trails too - never seen it so busy in the past.", "Lovely views at the point, however the majority of the hike is forested without views. The trail was also very busy (Saturday). With the new loop the trail is 13.3km plus going to the viewpoint at the middle makes it more like 14km. If you don't want that long of hike, you can definitely find similar views on shorter hikes. ", 'Love the new addition to make this a loop with some great lookoffs.  The new/lower trail was extremely mucky and made it a little trickier but 10/10 recommend this trail!', 'Very muddy on lower trail/ upper not too bad', 'Love the loop. Great look offs. Really nice trail experience improvements!', 'Beautiful trail. Walked it today after a downpour and it was very muddy and slick the majority of the way. The new loop was much less muddy, so would recommend that route.', 'Nice trail, very hot today, so turned around after 3km in.', 'Beautiful drive to the trail. The trail was somewhat hilly and rooty but fairly easy. Several muddy sections even after a dry August. The top is amazing and there are a few other pretty look offs as well. It took me 3 hours to go out and back.', 'Beautiful trail, largely shaded until you get to the tip. Main trail is muddy in several places, as noted by several reviewers, so be prepared! New “loop” much less muddy and has several look off points which are beautiful and worth stepping of the trail to see! Bring lots of water!! Definitely worth the effort and would do it again in a heartbeat!', 'Amazing views. A few muddy spots but well worth it. ', 'The trail is in good condition. 13km total round trip. The first 2km are the elevation, the rest is fairly flat. The views are very rewarding. Would advise going early in the morning as the traffic seemed to increase at around noon.  We were on the trail at 7 am, no one else out there. ', 'Excellent trail.  New section is very nice addition.  ', 'New trail is great. Muddy in areas, but trail is new. Great lookoff spots along the way.', 'Big rain the day before but great sunny day for our hike the day after. Trail was muddy in many places from the rain. Worth the walk once you get to see the view!', 'Super muddy conditions this weekend. But overall a great trail. Very busy on the weekends, start early to get a parking spot. ', 'Beautiful day out there! VERY muddy trail conditions right now - make sure to dress for it :)', 'The ending makes this trail totally worth it! We went for sunset and the trail is clear enough easily manage with headlamps or flashlights. ', 'Great hike.  Took a little under 4 hours. Better in hiking boots than shoes.', 'Muddy in some spots. Bring a backpack with a picnic lunch and water and you’re all set. Definitely worth it! We did it in just under 4 hours in and back ', 'Super busy on a long weekend. But v lovely.', 'WELL worth it! It’s a bit taxing early on, as you’ll do most of the incline within the first 2 km or so. From there, muddy puddles regularly occur, most of which are easy to walk around via an outer edge, others requiring a bit more fun, careful planning (be careful - it can be slick if you attempt to hop over any portion, and you may take a “banana peel” spill). I found it quite fun, kinda of like a video game in dodging these little obstacles (felt like playing Crash Bandicoot to be specific. Anyhow, the view from the top is one of the most vast, amazing panoramas I’ve ever seen in my life!! It was so windy up there that you could almost lean forward and have it hold you upright. The walk back is much easier, as all of that ascension early on is downhill on the way out. This one is an absolute must-do!

Also - I didn’t encounter a single bug. Hiked it early August on a sunny morning 9:00-12:30.', 'Excellent trek through the woods. It was raining H.A.R.D. the day we went but that didn’t take away from the hike… great views at the end with one other look-off to the right as you go in.  Well worth the walk.', 'Nice moderate trail. Not too steep but there is some muddy stretches at the beginning (even on a sunny, dry day. View at the end of the cape makes for a satisfying midpoint but perhaps doesn’t justify the hike on its own.', 'Great views from the lookout midway to the end of the point', 'Superbe randonnée
', 'Trail is very wet in some places. Nice easy hike.', 'It was pretty muddy so wear proper  shoes.  Spectacular view for a picnic at the end', 'Heavily treed, creeks running through paths, mucky and challenging at times with hills. Worth the view. Waterproof boots recommended. 9/10', 'Awesome', "Great hike, the trail was quite wet so wear appropriate footwear.  The new path isn't open as of July 15, I would be very surprised if it is open by the end of the summer.  Great views on the top.", 'Great hike…not overly difficult (just long), easy to follow, trail goes through woods until it opens to a beautiful vista at the end. New loop trail still not open. Some muddy areas but fairly easy to navigate around them.', 'well marked along the trail with how far you are. ', 'Really really lovely. Warm in the trees but the view at the end is well worth it', 'I admit, this ranks first on my list of hikes to date. This is one of Nova Scotia’s majestic gems, overlooking the Bay of Fundy. The tidal action here is impressive. The trail is 12.1 km out and back, between 3 - 5 hours. We spent most of our time admiring the view and had a mini picnic with a beautiful view.', 'Trail is mostly dry with very few bugs but many hikers! New look off deck is lovely. The trails for new loop are not open and are taped off.   Sunny most of the way but unfortunately foggy at the point. Will try again another time but a wonderful trail nonetheless. ', 'great hike. super foggy at the end. ', 'A long hike! Trail is covered in shade￼. Great workout the first 20 minutes is rocky and a lot of up hill. Definitely worth it yeah ', "Great! frist time won't be the last! went with my brother and Luna. trail was in great shape 2 hrs in at an easy going pace. 3 hours out. massive amount of people. nice day. We went in early and coming out tge cars were lined down the road with tge parking lot cramed. traffic the only reason not 5/5 views and hike are spot on fir a day hike. and dine by noon ", 'Spectacular dramatic exhausting', 'A bit muddy and be for quite a long trek up hill. Well worth it though. Beautiful!', 'Hard pack with some wet spots. A blast of a trail to run. Some nice speedy sections. Absolutely stunning view at the turn around. ', 'Amazing.', 'great easy to follow trail. bit muddy in spots, and good boots are definitely a plus.

 ', 'The new loop is still rough and closed. Adds 3K and lots of rollers!', 'Great trail for a late morning hike. Pack a lunch to eat when you’re at the top! Perfect picnic spot, although it can be windy.', 'Excellent trail conditions today, almost all dry, very few mucky spots. The new trail on the Scots Bay side is not yet opened; park staff told us the projected opening is not until August.', 'The trail was in great condition after the winter. A little bit muddy today, but only near the front end of the trail. I was happy to see new offshoots from the main trail (official, not footpaths) including a new look off!', 'A beautiful trail at any hour of any season. The trail is hard-packed dirt, so even if it might get a bit muddy, it’s never too deep or unnavigable.

The seagulls roosting on the furthest outcropping are a beautiful sight when they wake up and start to stretch their wings.', 'Really well signposted, but also well trodden so you can’t go wrong. A great hike on a lovely sunny day!', 'Great hike. Beautiful view. The first km or a bit more is wet still this spring. Otherwise perfect!', 'Nice hike, a bit muddy as the snow has just melted.￼ we only did the 1st part.', 'Super muddy trail but completely worth it to make it to the end.', 'Beautiful views and awesome place to bring your furry friend! Was pretty icy during the hike, so would definitely recommend as a summer/late fall adventure! ', 'Really great trail.  A little icy this time of year so some sort of traction for your shoes is a good idea.', 'We hiked on Jan 16 and the trail was in great condition! Only 1 section about 1-2k in that was icy, the rest was just nicely packed snow, great traction.  Awesome day! ', 'The trail was quite icy in places, and wet and muddy in others, but this didn’t seem to deter anyone as there was a fair amount of traffic on this beautiful winter day.', 'Minimal ice, great day out!', 'Lovely trail with an absolutely stunning view at the end of the peninsula. Well worth it. 

Very touristy and busy on weekends. If you want a quieter hike, weekday mornings are best for this one. ', "It's a long walk, took me about 3 hours one way, but well worth it!  The trail itself was in good condition with roots and rocks exposed but a good mix between uphill and level with 2 look out points before arriving at the end. One bathroom due to Covid.
", 'Only mucky in a couple spots. They are building some new lookoffs. Perfect temperature: 15c.', 'Great hike! Had a beautiful day!', 'Great spot', 'Breathtaking.', 'Great! Slow and steady until the end', 'Mind breaker', 'A bit muddy on some parts but it was to be expected after heavy rains the day before.  Beautiful scenery from the top not much to see on the way up. Worth bring a snack to sit and take in the view.', 'Great hike. Very busy spot today as its a long weekend but people were very curious and kept distance as much as possible. Will be back. ', 'Fantastic', 'Highly recommend this trail! Easy to moderate hiking. 
', 'Easy hike. Only scenery was at the end', 'Moderate trail, the view at the end of the trail is breathtaking. ', 'Well kept trail! Beautiful views! ', 'Perfect hike with beautiful view at the end. Lots of inclines to get a good burn going. ', 'great trail!! we took both our dogs (collie & chi) and they loved it. couple must spots but easily walked around. the lookout was busy but stunning views! ', 'Great hike day today. Trail is in great shape - the few mucky spots from recent rain are all passable by going around the puddles. No damage or impassable spots to report. ', 'Recommend the trek up and back. Don’t go do the loop. Too bushwacky so difficult for what it’s worth.', "Very nice trail! Fairly busy, but well kept. Entire trail is forested, so it's nicely shaded and keeps the wind out. After an hour or so, we made it to the end and BOOM! Gale force winds when we reached the opening to the Split. Probably so windy that it limited our stay to about 15 minutes, so we hiked 'er back. All in all, took around 2h15m to complete at a pretty decent pace. Definitely recommend this trail, though! Surrounding area of Wolfville is always a nice stay, as well. Terrific area.", 'Amazing hike. Busier than I expected but lovely. Tough in places. The view at the point is breathtaking!', 'I did this trail in June 2020, it was excellent! Took my 2 dogs, lots of water. the trail was beautiful and the view at the end was spectacular. would definately recommend this trail. ', 'Great trail, amazing views. Some steep inclines and a long trek but in the end, it’s worth it', 'Great trail well maintained.  Not too difficult terrain.  Took us 3 hours round trip ', 'Beautiful view. Clear trail, not too busy when we went and didn’t run into any bugs', 'Well maintained', "First time doing a hike. Went with my nieces and a friend. First of all, I have lower back issues, being a person that loves a challenge. I decided to wear my 10lb vest. Thought it was a 2.5 hr walk in and out! NO!  Realized we were in for a very long hike. I was hurting so bad by the time we got to the split. It was definitely worth every bit of pain that I encountered! We sat and ate lunch. Took beautiful pictures. It was difficult going  back. Feet were feeling pain. But I wouldn't change a thing.....now I'm in love with hiking!!", 'Nice easy walk. Mostly up grade to the end, wide path, some roots and rocks to stumble over. Lots of parking and bathrooms at the beginning and half way point.', 'Whew! Hiked Cape Split in May and it was a great adventure. The forest is beautiful, lots of plants and flowers, and you get little peeks of the ocean through the trees. Very peaceful and dreamy. And then the end!! Super climactic, especially on a windy day. I came through the trees and then BAM blasted by wind. My cheeks were flappin! So fun! 

Also! I encourage you to look up the Indigenous histories and presents of the land you’re hiking on. Think about what it means as settlers to use this unceded Mi’kmaq land for pleasure. ', 'Great hike. Watch the weather as it can be windy and foggy at the split while being sunny in the parking lot', 'Great view at the end. It was a little muddy in places but overall really well kept.', 'Amazing. It was an easy trail.', 'Beautiful trail. The hike is mainly in the woods and there are some very steep inclines. None of the 12km has a view of the basin or Bay of Fundy, but the view at the end is spectacular. The actual hiking trail is beautiful but is 100% forest. The paths are narrow so passing people doesn’t allow for the ‘Covid 6ft’. There are some washrooms at the start of the trail and half way up. The half way up ones are in the shade so smelt slightly better on a hot day! :) ', 'Great day on the trail. Lots of hills and a beautiful view. 
Should have benches for people to stop and rest and snack.  ', 'Challenging but well maintained and marked path. Definitely worth the view!', 'Took 4.5 hours (including exploring the cape, and having a snack) with a 9 year old that does not hike. Worth it, amazing view!', 'It was a great to do this trail again although it felt a bit longer than I remember. Very quiet, went on a Wednesday afternoon.  ', 'Great Hike... Easy to hike... well maintained! view at the end is just amazing!', 'Beautiful reward at the end. Mostly wooded and hilly trail to get there but well maintained. Loop at the end is not a part of the official trail and is overgrown in parts. Try going on a clear day. ', 'what a great trail. busy but lots to look at.', 'Awesome hike today but watch out for the tree you have to duck under... I wasn’t so fortunate and ended up hitting my head', 'Wonderful hike, slightly busy. Beautiful view at the top and lots of grass to sit for some food.
A bit of a rocky climb at the beginning but overall not too hard of a hike.
My phone died when we were at the top eating so this record is half the hike.', 'Awesome Hike. More on the easier side of moderate. Worth doing the loop at the end. Nice and isolated from the wind and sun. 

Windy at the cape split look off. Bring a jacket. 

You can take a little trail down to the water by holding on to a sketchy rope. 

Took about 3hrs of moving time including the dip down to the waterfront from the loop. 

Would Love to come back and trail run the out and back. ', 'Foggy today but still a fantastic hike. Took about 3.5 hrs ', 'One of our favorite hikes in Nova Scotia.  Hiked it today, including the little loop along the south side.  Lots of blowdown from last fall on that little stretch.  Beautiful!', "Nice trail, ran about half of it, I'm sure it's a nice view at the end, unfortunately it was really foggy for us.", 'Super nice trail!! Took us 2 hours and a bit to complete the whole trail and return to the parking lot. We ran the last couple kilometres which made the return trip take about 45 minutes and the trip up to the peak was about 1.15 hours. The trees provide some shade but sunscreen and bug spray is a must! A bit muddy at the beginning of the trail but dry after he first 2 k', 'awesome trail! it’s a pretty easy one, just straight up and then straight down. trail was very wide and well maintained. it was windy but it was great because it kept the bugs off! dogs loved it even on the leash. 12k felt like nothing, took us about 3.5 hours to do it not including the lunch break we took at the top, and a few water breaks. ', 'We hiked this trail yesterday and the flowers were beautiful! Loads of trillium. The downside was it was a busy day on the trail. 50 cars in the lot when arrived at noon. Because of the pandemic and social distancing it was not a good experience. Most of the hikers were collage age adults and were hiking in groups and walking abreast making it hard to pass at a 6 foot distance , so we were forced to step off the trail when we met them. They did not offer to step off for us. The older hikers that we met did step off the trail when meeting us. We counted 118 people while we were hiking. Also garbage has been left to pile up beside the garbage bins even though parks have stated they are not doing garbage collection there at this time. A great hike but not worth the risk at this time ', 'Very windy once you’re at the top, the view is amazing at the end! Definitely one of the longer hikes I’ve been on in awhile but already can’t wait to go again, all around great trail', 'Completed this one in 2014 and is one of my all-time favourites. The 12km is pretty steady and not too difficult terrain-wise. The view at the end is inxredible; definitely bring your cameras! ', 'Awesome trail with incredible views. There is a decent climb over the first 2km or so but otherwise the trail is moderate to easy. 

We completed the loop at the end of the trail - and that I would not recommend for the less experienced hiker. There are a couple bonus views, but the trail is very overgrown and has a lot of trees down, making it hard to keep on trail in places. It’s best done as an out and back trail unless you’re looking for a challenge.', 'Went on a cloudy day , the trail was not so hard and the view at the end was definitely worth it. But the wind was wild, have felt wind this strong in my life. Be extra careful while at the edge of the cliff.', 'Nice easy trail. I did it when it was a bit cold on 19th March 2020 so the mud was frozen. very nice view at the end. ', 'Every time of year has its perks. Every time of day has its perks. A busy area, but a classic. ', 'Snow over ice on the trail made it easy to hike. Lots of water views through the bare trees. Windy and frigid at the point so couldn’t stay there long. A beautiful trail any season.', 'a friend and I hiked this a few yrs ago..its was a blast we geocached in so took us a bit longer..alday adventure..we loved it', 'Very muddy, adds time to your estimate because some areas are slow to get through with slippery spots. Leave enough time to get out before dark. We will be back again', 'Hiked 11/3/19. Epic overlook, but relatively boring and crowded hike to get to it. Hiked early, and saw no one on the hike out, but there were a handful of people at the overlook and many heading in as we hiked out. There were currently some muddy sections and downed trees in the trail, but all are easily navigable. The view at the end makes this hike worth it. 
I’m confused by the reviews saying it took an hour or 2. It is over 8 miles (4 each way). ', 'Lovely trail. With a great reward at the end of a wonderful view but there may be crowds including dogs. Oct 20th the  outhouses part way along were locked down that is not noted on the sign at the trailhead.', 'Great trail. Only one tree left on the trail from the hurricane. Very unhappy about all the tissue and toilet paper along the trail. PLEASE walk off the trail to do your business and bag your tissue to take out. Think of the other users.', 'Nice trail with amazing seaside view', 'love cape split, one of my favourites! i’ve done it a few times and loved every minute. last time it took just over and hour to walk, can’t wait to go back.', 'It’s an ok hike...I probably wouldn’t repeat it.', 'Decent Saturday afternoon outing, took my partner and I 2 and a bit hours including a short stop at the point. Very busy and very mild trail. ', 'We did the entire trail (minus the loop) in three hours. Quite easy getting around the muddy spots. View at the tip worth the hike.', 'muddy. only complaint.', "Typically a very busy trail - but there is lots of room at the end to look around. Bring a sweater if you intend on staying for a bit at the look off part, it's always windy and little cooler there compared to the hike in from the parking lot", "I am happy to have done this hike. The view at the end is amazing and I'm happy I got to get out there to enjoy it in person. I am very impressed with how quick the storm damage (Dorion 2019) was cleared off the trail I would say right up to the 5 km mark there were obvious signs of work that had been done to remove giant trees and logs Dorian left in the way. Navigation and Terrain wise I would put this on the easier end of hikes, length and a couple of heart rate raising hills do definitely push it to the moderate rating it but for my self I guess you could say I was slightly underwhelmed with it as far as a challenge goes but everything else was fantastic. Probably wouldn't drive the hour and a half to make this a regular hike but again happy to have done and will likely do again if in the area or the opportunity came up. ", 'Fantastic hike any time of day you start it. Trail is easy to follow. Expect mud, roots and rocks. I hiked solo and with 20 mins at the top I clocked 2.5hours. I was able to do this hike in trail running shoes. There’s elevation gain in the beginning then  flat and rolling and back to very flat along the ridge. Great day! Started at 2pm out by 4:30pm 9/20/19. Love it!!!', 'went the day after hurricane dorian.', 'Lots of roots, watch your footing!', 'The loop trail was very overgrown. Wear appropriate clothing and footwear. The beach is well worth a visit though', 'wear good shoes and be prepared for mud! But so worth it! Bring a picnic and enjoy the views!', 'Great trail with good elevation change, fantastic view at the end. Hiked in August and was busy, on and off leash dogs and a bit of mud but navigable.', 'Hiking, rock climbing, and walking the beach, all within one hours hike.', "just over 6km to the viewpoint, we got there at sunset and the sights were amazing. The loop at the end is possible to travel however it's not really maintained (overgrown , fallen trees, etc..) its much easier to go out the way you came in. there was a little bit of mud in some spots but there always seems to be an alternate route to get around it.", 'what a view! the trail is amazing, it took us about 4 hours to complete. 6kms each way and a break to take in the stunning views at the end. proper footwear is necessary; we went ealier in the summer and there was quite a bit of mud & water in spots. bring a camera :)', 'Well maintained trail- great out and back with incredible views at the end! Enjoyed it very much.', 'The trail is a little over 6km in each direction, so over 12km total. I was walking a very brisk pace and was able to get to the end in a little over an hour. Stayed at the end for about a half hour and took me about an hour and 15 mins to walk back. So overall I clocked in at less than 3 hours. The path is pretty much boring woods the entire way until the end, but the end is pretty fabulous!  I would not recommend this trail for small kids, or at least be prepared for it to take quite a while. Weather was perfect the day I went and it hadn’t rained for a few days before, so there wasn’t much mud at all. I really recommend for anyone willing to commit to a long hike...Although if you’re fit and keep a decent pace, under 3 hours is possible!', 'my 3 year old made it to the end. i only had to carry him for the last 3km on the way back.
i would call this pretty easy.', 'Absolutely amazing trail. Definitely don’t need to worry about getting lost, trail is very well kept, big and there’s always many people on it. Definitely a sight to see at the end as well!!!', 'Literally almost the whole hike you’re in the woods until you come to the end. But it is 110% worth it. 
I recommend good hiking shoes as the way there is almost all uphill. Some muddy spaces that you are able to go around. 

If the view doesn’t knock your socks off. I don’t know what will. 

The only downside is the loop you see in the map seems to be quite overgrown. ', 'Hike was easy and flat for the most part with a few gentle inclines. Definitely worth it for the view!', 'Wauw, wat a nice trail! ☀️', 'Super muddy with all the rain lately but very manageable. A couple steep bits but my Alberta lungs has no trouble with any of it. Yay for sea level hiking!  Amazing views at the end and we had the perfect sunny day to capture them. ', 'Great trail, it was super clear and there is a great open area at the end to picnic. Some mud from rain 1.5 days ago. 
The extra loop at the end does exist, but it is very overgrown, you’ll get scratches from bushes ect, but it a fun adventure! No steep incline like shown in the elevation map, but still more difficult than mail trail. Views not as good either.', 'A good long hike that features a pleasant forest walk along a well-maintained trail and spectacular views at the end of the cape. We took a deliberate but unhurried two hours to reach the end of the cape, an hour for lunch and to enjoy the sights, and two hours to walk back. Well worth the effort. Contrary to what is shown on the map there is no loop trail at the end of the cape (mid-way through the walk) — it’s out and back along the same trail. ', 'Very fun to do with friends, the end is so worth it!! ', 'well marked foot path leading to sloped cliffs. occasional muddy sections', "Pretty easy going trail. Not too steep and a very well maintained path. The only struggle point was to get the path down and back up. I couldn't find it as it was pretty much overgrown. 99% of the trail you're in the forest, only the last part is open. 1 restroom along the way.", 'Great trail.  Recording started part way in.', 'Trail was lovely, no garbage and not many people when we arrived (approx 1030am). We hiked the whole trail to the lookout, unfortunately it was incredibly foggy so we didn’t get to see much but it was breathtaking nonetheless. The trail itself was in good condition minus the mud but hey, that’s Mother Nature for you. Being a very active individual I found the start much more strenuous than the end.. lots of up hill and rocks. Take your time and take breaks if needed :) I definitely recommend this trail. ', 'Trail was lovely, no garbage and not many people when we arrived (approx 1030am). We hiked the whole trail to the lookout, unfortunately it was incredibly foggy so we didn’t get to see much but it was breathtaking nonetheless. The trail itself was in good condition minus the mud but hey, that’s Mother Nature for you. Being a very active individual I found the start much more strenuous than the end.. lots of up hill and rocks. Take your time and take breaks if needed :) I definitely recommend this trail. ', 'Completed this hike on June 5/19, the path was extremely wet and muddy. Always a good hike! ', 'This starts with a bit of a hill to walk up. It isn’t wide so if you want to take your time let the crowd go ahead. I felt the pressure of being in the way. Not many view points until you get to the end but the end is beautiful. ', 'Great hike.  A bit muddy at the start of the trail and some steep hills but so worth it.  Bring lots of water and a light lunch cause the view at the end of the trail is Spectacular !!!!  ', 'Probably my favourite ever hiking trail. Views at the end are incredible! This is very popular trail so it’s easy to find your way. It can be busy at times. Leave yourself plenty of time to make the round trip. There is LOTS of parking and a washroom at the start of the trail. ', 'Go early or go later to avoid the crowds, especially on a long weekend! Should be a great show of purple trilliums, ferns (fiddleheads right now), and other wildflowers soon. And maybe less muddy too!', 'Great trail. Nice elevation. Make sure you time it to see the tides.  Only downfall is it’s high traffic. But it’s a must see.', 'amazing,  but muddy.  the view is worth it!!!
', 'It’s a great hike, but make sure don’t do the loop. After getting your view, just turn back the way you were from. I did the loop with my husband, the other side of the loop was overgrown and hard to keep track. Wasted a lot of time in the woods...', 'Great day hike with a fantastic view at the end. A bit muddy in spots and lots of furry dog friends in tow. Beautiful scenic drive and a side trip to Wolfville make for a perfect day trip!', 'Good trail. It was nice and private feeling with it being a really bad weather day. However in the shelter of the trees it was wonderful. The mud was bad. At one point my feet ceased being feet and became mud deposits. However I wouldn’t want to go on a nicer day due to the surprising amount of traffic I encountered even on a horrible rainy day like today.', 'Great hike but trail is still pretty muddy.', "Beautiful hike! I did trailrun it this Tuesday, my 2 friends hiked it. We were the only 3 people on the trail. There was a mix of snow and ice on the trail but easy enough for us to run/hike. At the end, the snow was almost gone; we had extreme wind, though.  I'll definitely run it again!", "I did it twice. Once in July 2018 and the second time was in October 2018. It was much more enjoyable in October because I was essentially the only one climbing up and didn't see anyone else on my way down. It was also much cooler and the trees were so pretty. I took so many pictures. It took me about 2h30 there and back and I was going at a normal pace. I am not an experienced hiker and I was able to do it ", 'Love the view!', 'Great hike, quite windy and rugged at the point made for a bit of a thrill looking over the cliffs!', 'The view is totally worth the hike. The lookout at the end makes you feel like you are on the edge of the world. Make sure to take your time and soak in the views.', 'Amazing views!! A must see, beautiful trail.', 'Excellent hike,  not too hard and awesome view at the end. Also opportunity to take side trail to little split and do some rick hunting in beach or just enjoy walking on a beach where later 40-45 feet of water is.', 'The complete hike is in the woods with little to no view until you reach the end, which the view at the end is overrated. Also, be prepared for crowds.', 'Great view well worth the Hike !!!', 'I run this spring and fall each year. Fantastic trail with an iconic NS review. For trail runners, it’s generally moderate difficulty with a few more technical spots and lots of exposed rocks and roots-broke my toe on the way in a few years ago. A moderate effort will get you there and back in 1.5 hrs. You can really fly on the way back to the trailhead!', 'Hiked the Split with friends who were visiting NS. Trail was in good condition although some mud and water in places. Hard packed with roots and rocks. In the trees for most of the hike and then arrive in the meadow overlooking Cape Split. Awesome view when you arrive particularly if the tide is flowing hard in one direction. We do this hike every year. Total hiking time approx 2;45 at a moderate pace.', 'Nice easy hike on a foggy day. The entire hike is through the trees until the very end.', 'Great hike for those of us who r not true hikers! Some hills for sure but lots of flats as well.  Just wooded views on entire trail ending with wonderful views.', 'Beautiful vistas at end of the trail!', 'First hike in decades! It was great! We plan to do it again in the Fall.', 'This trail has enough challenging parts to make it worthwhile. I actually completed it twice in one day, back to back in 5 hours and 5 minutes.', 'A nice walk through the woods. I took my 9  and 11 year old boys. They were tired at the end but enjoyed the walk. Went on a Sunday and there were quite a few fellow hikers. I’d recommend going during the week if you enjoy solitude. Of the 12+ km’s i’d say half was uphill. Lots of stones and roots to be mindful of. A bit muddy in spots. Nice view at the end.', 'Walked this trail yesterday with a couple of my friends. None of us are hikers by any means. The moderate difficulty is definitely reasonable— my non-hiker body is quite tired and sore the day after, and my friends and I took several breaks throughout. We took about four hours total. We’re from Halifax, so it was about an hour and a half drive to get there— fun little roadtrip if you’re from the city! The first half of the hike is quite hilly, but it flattens out during the latter half. View at the end is well worth the hike, in my opinion! I’d highly suggest bug repellant of some sort, especially during this time of year. All in all, I would wholeheartedly recommend it!', 'This is a nice undulating hike thru natural forest. The actual Cape Split was well worth the hike. 
It took us 3hrs round trip and enjoyed the plentiful greenery and the beautiful vista at the point.', 'Your average Canadian Forest hike for the most part, but it ends on an amazing view.  The local Chipmunks were also super friendly, allowing me to get some great shots of them.', 'This trail has been on my “hikes to do” list for years, but I always kept putting it off. The views at the end always intrigued me, but the descriptions/review of the actual hike always sounded less than exciting. I envisioned it to be too easy, I prefer a more challenging hike, but in the end, the hike was good, it had a couple good inclines and lots of roots and rocks to avoid. It’s a long trek though,  we moved fairly quickly and it took us 2.5 hrs, but it probably takes most people 3-4 hrs. Bring a sweater for the end, it’s damn cold out there! It was 30 degrees in Wolfville, 19 in the parking lot, but it felt like maybe 4 degrees at the end with that wind whipping at us. All in all, it wasn’t my favourite hike, I’m glad I did it, finally, but I probably won’t do it again.', 'A little underwhelming after all of the stellar reviews. The clearing is lovely and offers a nice view, however it’s a bit of a trot for such little payoff. It took us an hour and 45 mins to do the first half and and an hour and 15 back at a moderate pace.', 'Hiked several times while at university. Great in spring, summer and fall', 'My wife and I where here in February, great hike! Super well kept and clean. Washrooms located at the entrance were open. Spectacular views!!', 'Big payoff!', 'Simply Beautiful.', "Trail is mostly in the woods the entire time. Not alot of trail markers, but it's easy enough to follow. No viewpoints till you reach Cape Split. Can get really icy if you're there really early in the year, and because of the ice build up, it'll remain muddy later than you would think. 
I'd recommend doing it to say you've done it, due to the popularity of it, ", "A great 3 hour workout with a great prize view over parts of the Bay Of Fundy at the very end.  At times, it feels like it's uphill both ways.  Very popular.  Wonderful time.", 'The hike took 2.5 hours one way. Some steep areas and glimpses of the water as you approach the end. Beautiful view at the end. Pack a snack and sit down and enjoy the beautiful view!', 'Great hike with amazing coastal views!!', "Went on a Saturday morning and it was definitely crowded. It's not a hard hike but there isn't too much to see on the way up. The view at the end was better than expected!", "great hike, beautiful view ! wear boots it's muddy folks!", 'A great hike, moderately challenging, well maintained trail. Only upset was how cloudy and misty it was, was unable to see the whole view at the end, but it added a mysterious vibe to the hike! Still worth it!', 'Great trail with an amazing view at the end!', 'You have to go to the beach :D Best part of this trail!', 'Amazing for us and our dog!', 'nice run ending with spectacular view', 'Loved this hike! The wooded area and forest was enchanting; old growth, trilliums, carpet of May flowers, moss and cool towering trees were a highlight. The end was magnificent, especially in the waining light.', 'This hike was more than I ever imagined
It took approximately one hour to hike up the trail with no break. When you get to the top of the trail and see the view, you are in awe. I would recommend anyone to do it. Take your time and be prepared, bring a snack and something to drink.
You are definitely going to want to stay for a while ', 'Very popular now and suggest going early. Also, walk in is about 2hrs through woods. only the end has views.', 'Great trail. Give 4 to 5 hours for return. Stay away from the cliff edge at the end.. Awesome views.', 'Amazing trail. Not too hard. Amazing view from the top', 'Fantastic trail. Did this multiple times. Even once with infant carriers front and back. The view is always better then expected. Could be super dangerous at the end if not careful. Just stay clear from the edge and enjoy. Easy hike', 'The five stars are for the view you are rewarded during this hike/walk. The view was spectacular! The hike there was more of a nice and easy walk, would make for a great jog/trail run.', "Nice easy trek with a spectacular view at the end.  More of a nature walk than a hike, with a wide, well cleared and groomed trail from start to finish. If you have time it's worth following the smaller, more rugged trail down the hill from the look off. It eventually leads to a lovely rocky beach that's often pretty empty, even on nice days when the rest of the trail is packed.", "easy hike on the main path with a fantastic view at the end. there is a large grassy look off at the end perfect for a picnic. I haven't looked for the 2nd path yet, where does it start?", 'One of the great hikes in Nova Scotia, amazing view out at cape split. The trip is one everyone should make at least once in their lifetime. For a more advanced hike check out the amethyst Cove hike which vears off of the cape split trail. Always check tide times when exploring the bay of fundy before exploring the beach. Cape split is always a great hike and very much worth the long walk.', 'Awesome hike! There is a choice of trails to get to the split one takes you through the woods along an up and down footpath of on even ground with roots, rocks and tree branches everywhere. The other trail takes you along the shore and is not easy. It takes you along some very narrow footpaths that are near the edge of a very steep drop to a certain death!! Once you reach the end at Cape Split you will be amazed!! Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful views!! This is a must joke for all hikers in Nova Scotia. Make a day of it and be safe!!', "Great Winter Hike, beware lot's of tree roots and rocks on the trail. Great views across to Parsboro and  the Bay. Well worth the hike to see the view at the end. Spectacular as the tide is going out. Must be beautiful in summer."]

['Awesome', '50mins up with +400m elevation gain. On the trail. We have a quick pace. Moderate to hard difficulty. 55min down via the “old road”. Easy down. It’s a loop. Hard up, easy down. Or you can take the “road” up and back down for a more leisurely trip.', 'Hiked this is a few times in the summer and fall, both wonderful times of year to do so! Beautiful look-offs, steep in some sections but completely worth it. One of my favourite trails in the highlands!', 'The view is awesome!', 'Steep up hill, but nice windy view at the top.', 'Started at 9 am, not many there. Easy, well maintained. People before us saw a bear. Amazing view!!! ', 'Great view at the tippy top.
', 'Great hike! A challenge for sure ￼and incredible views!!! Came from Ottawa and this really made the trip!!', 'Moderate for the descent but hard and steep for the ascent. Tough hike, but the views from the top are definitely worth it.', 'Steep trail up and steep service road down. View at the top is spectacular!', 'My boy 28 and myself 61 did Franey on Sunday the 29th. No bugs very warm. It took us 1.5 hours up and 45 minutes to get down we did run down half the time she’s a definite work out!!', 'not a medium trail.
', 'Most definitely on the difficult side of moderate.  Pretty intense incline after about 1.5K   Beauty at the top though.  Windy day so no bugs.  Watch your footing on the way down the counter clockwise side.  Lots of loose rocks.  Super happy to have visited this one.  I do want to meet whoever is running this trail as the main description mentions. ', 'Incredible hike and quite challenging and I would def rate it on the difficult side of moderate. Views at the top were spectacular, like many other reviews, the bugs were relentless at the summit!! Recommend going clockwise, would be very difficult and not enjoyable going down the steep side.', 'Steep and challenging for my parents in their late 70’s/early 80’s. Took them 2 hours to get to the top. 3.5 hours for the entire loop. The second lookout at the top is spectacular and worth the extra few minutes. Watch your kids at the second lookout!', 'Great, well maintained trail. Not heavily trafficked in the morning. Only complaint is that we didn’t bring bug spray and that was a mistake — we couldn’t really enjoy the view because we were being eaten alive by mutant mosquitos. Nonetheless, the view is spectacular.', 'We did the loop in a clockwise direction, it’s probably a little easier this way as you can step up the big rock ledges. The view from the top is awesome. Coming back down, you travel on an old access road, which makes it relatively easy. Overall a great time!', 'Breathtaking views but Jesus the mozzies… serious type 2 fun.', 'Great trail! Very steep climb but 100% worth the view at the top! There is an easier way up (access road). ', 'Started on the left side entrance (harder way up) before sunrise, was at the top with the great view and sun rise at 6am, what a view. Jogged the easier way back.
', 'Great trail. Going up is demanding and steep. Definitely a good workout!  Views at the top are amazing!!', "Franey is the most rewarding day hike in the Highlands. I say this because other trails may have near equal views (Skyline), this has a much more authentic hiking and mountaintop feel. If you were to ask me which one I prefer between Franey and Skyline, it is Franey by far. This is a true Hiker's afternoon/day Trail with multiple amazing views. It won't hold your hand like Skyline does. ", 'If you start to the left it is a very scenic route but more challenging. The right loop is very easy but not as scenic. Nice view at top! There is 2 viewing spots up top and both are great! Dog friendly', "Great challenging ascent to the top. It was empty as I was climbing mid-afternoon and got the views at the top all to myself. The rain started coming in not long after as I made my way down the easier part of the loop. Unfortunately that was a very boring forest road and had no cover from the elements. I'd recommend doing this as an out-and-back hike and skip the forest road.", 'Fantastic trail for myself, partner & eleven year old. As others have said, the ascent is quite steep at points, but I am a very novice hiker and handled it with a few rest stops along the way. Stairs are provided but can be slippery. We did the whole trail, with stops at each look off, in a little over three hours. Breathtaking views and a satisfying feeling to have completed it!', 'Great climb and view from the top makes it more than worth it! Trekking poles may be helpful if you have short legs like me - even some of the sets of stairs are need a stretch to reach. Hike through a bog area - makes for opportunity for good wildlife.', 'Did this clockwise.  Added an extra 900m at the start and end because trailers cannot go up the hill. 

Solid climb and totally worth it.  Spectacular views.', 'It was a challenge for us 60+ but we enjoyed the hike immensely! Will do it again! ', 'Very steep and quite a challenge. But a must do… at least once.', 'Steep climb in but the loop out is a breeze. Bring bear spray. ']

['Gorgeous views, back loop a bit boring but worth it to extend the hike ', "Well groomed and easy trail. We did the loop for the sake of it as it only adds about 40 mins to the hike; however in terms of views and enjoyment there really isn't too much to it. so I would recommend that you just head straight to the main viewpoint area. Viewpoint area is beautiful and well worth it considering the easy difficulty and short duration. Took us 2 hours to do the full hike (loop included) with plenty of photo breaks.", "Lovely, very well-walked and easy trail with amazing views over the ocean. Ran the loop, as there's not much elevation change. It was extremely windy and even got pushed over at the top. ", 'Great walk, kid and elderly friendly! ', 'Very basic trail terrain wise. A moose did cross our path on the trail so that was exciting. The view from the Main Lookout point is spectacular!!  It was extremely windy out there.  The view is definitely worth the hike', 'Amazing views, but the hike is very basic, more of a walking path.', 'did the loop. nothing to see in the wooded area. couple look off points toward the end of the loop. u hike this one for the view at the end. truly amazing', 'Excellent trail, very well groomed, quite flat until the descent at the platforms. Navigation cut out at some point…did the loop and it was almost 9 km. Hiked in the remnants of Hurricane Ida so views not as fabulous as on a sunnier day but impressive nonetheless. Wind gusts were also impressive!! Will return on a better weather day in the future!', 'SIMPLY AMAZING 10/10', 'Honestly, the trail is surprisingly boring. The views at the end of the trail are spectacular, but you get views just as good from various parts of the Cabot Trail. The trail is extremely easy, which means it is very busy. A nice trail for beginners or elderly to complete.
', 'Good to see the tourists back. Very dramatic views.', 'Belle randonnée et belle vue sur le belvédère ', 'Amazing for sunset', "Hiked this many times, one of the few trails I haven't seen wildlife on, yet everyone I know has seen a moose here.  The loop does not offer a lot extra over the main trail, but it changes things up if you've hiked the out and back before.  Bring binoculars for better odds of seeing wildlife across the valley.", 'Easy hike with minimal incline.  Great views at the end of the trail!', 'Just. Incredible.', 'Beautiful solid surface trail! It was hot on this day!', 'Super easy trail. Very maintained. Do not bring your dog, as pet owners were being turned away. I found it quite busy, but with the views you are faced with, I can see why. I recommend for all ages. "It's a walk in the park". ', "Very easy, well maintained, toilets available, shade. Honestly a great hike with amazing ocean views but very busy which made it more difficult to stop at all the lookouts. Wild blueberries and rasberries along the way. Overall I'd recommand. ", "rando mis comme modérée mais c'est en raison du km je pense car vraiment facile, pas un gros dénivelé. aussi prendre la boucle a droite ou faire aller retour juste a gch selon expertise. toilette a l'arrivée et en chemin. bcp trop de monde , très poulaire. chemin plus qu'aménager cependant belle vie panoramique", 'The trail is well maintained and clean facilities available at the parking ling and midway through the trail. The views were incredible and we saw a momma moose with her calf just passed the first fork!', 'Super busy but so so so well maintained. The views are incredible. Lots of construction noise from the road at the moment. No wildlife sightings. ', 'Stunning views of the ocean at the end of the loop, plenty of small wildlife along the way. Mostly well maintained loose gravel trail. We loved it ! God bless the folks who built the boardwalk in an ecologically sensitive area.', 'A long haul, but a beautiful reward. The boardwalk at the end is amazing.', "The long flat trail was a bit boring to get through, but once we arrived to the lookout it was well worth it. Stunning vistas of the Cabot trail, ocean and the lovely meandering boardwalk with sitting areas to take it all in. We got there earlier in the morning so there weren't many people around.", 'Such a great trail, kids did the whole thing (9 & 11) - it was CRAZY windy so we didn’t venture out onto the boardwalk but we saw a moose next to the trail a 1st for us. Highly recommend', 'Lovely trail; if you want ocean views do the fork to the left and back. If you’re looking for a long walk, do the full loop. ', 'Beautiful scenery, best views ', 'It was so humbling to see the progress of the ongoing Saint Mary’s University trail restoration project that I was a part of in 2019. The views on the Skyline trail are absolutely stunning! The boardwalk and stairs are easy to walk on. Bring a jacket, as it can get quite windy due to the open ocean water! It’s best to go in the peak of Summer to enjoy that nice and warm weather, or in the Fall as the leaves turn then. You might spot a whale or two depending on how attentive you are!', 'The most amazing views that just keep going!', 'Trail was nice and easy. Beautiful scenery.', 'Amazing views on the edge of the trail. Nothing difficult and hard. ', 'Breathtaking views ', 'So beautiful! Definitely worth it, not that tough', 'Went Thursday Oct 15. Trail awesome. ', 'Absolutely fantastic day. Perfect weather and views. ', 'This was a tad disappointing. 
So the end view on the boardwalk is gorgeous and there is a wooded area with nice trees that felt magical. I got to see some whales from the main view which was nice. 
The walk itself took me 2.5 hours to do the entire loop. The trail isn’t particularly challenging I suppose, it’s well groomed and mostly level other than those stairs you have to climb. I wasn’t too enthused about most of the trail scenery. I felt it was kind of boring to be honest and have definitely hiked some nicer bush trails in NS. 
Worth it to say I did it and for the scenery. However I think I’m super out of shape clearly. ', 'Beautiful in every way', 'A must do for all Nova Scotians. Very easy and out back for all, a tad more challenging for the full loop. Always a fav of mine in my younger years. Most recent CB trip My s/o and I and his 9 year old jogged the loop. It was extremely foggy for the run in so we were not expecting much. We walked to the look off to have the fog roll out just before sunset. It was magical. ', 'Loved this trail. ', 'Beautiful,easy walking.Not alot of shade.View of the ocean was worth the wait.', 'You can’t beat the scene at the primary look out! Ocean, mountains. I’m sure it’s gorgeous in the fall when leaves change! Go on a clear day. It was lovely Sept 4th when we were there; clear, cool. Little shade and potential for big winds. It’s an easy 9.2 km walk around. Wide, well maintained trail. Pretty open for  good views. We saw a mama moose and her new calf, and understand it’s a big moose area. ', 'Easy trail with a great view', 'One of our favourite hikes in Nova Scotia. Often see moose especially early in the morning. Drop dead gorgeous views at end. ', 'One of the best views in all of Canada!!', 'Great views, easy stroll,  too populated.', 'Nice', 'Absolutely stunning!! Can not recommend this hike more to people!', 'Great, well-groomed hike! It was my partners first hike ever and we had no problems. The boardwalk to the edge was a bit windy and scary but, just take your time. It’s definitely worth it! ', 'Great for hiking.', 'Great trail. Well maintained. Took two hours that’s including a break at the look off. Will definitely do again.', 'Super easy trail for anyone! The views were beautiful. Was really hoping to see a moose, but no luck', 'Beautiful trail along the ocean with spectacular views. Took the right side of the trail to the stairway and saw a moose right beside us.... absolutely amazing!! Made my whole trip! Well worth the hike ', 'Well-maintained federal trail with great forest views and overlooking the Gulf of St. Lawrence.', 'Trail was in perfect condition. It is an easy loop or shorter in and out. Well groomed with some well maintained boardwalks. 

Highly recommended. ', 'Easy hike. Lots of people. Great views at the very end. Nothing much else to see until then. Family friendly.', 'Easy hike, brought my 7 and 8 year old, only complained on the way back but survived:) was not busy at 9 am on Sunday when we went in but full around 1130 when we came out.  the views are amazing for a low effort hike! Camping at near by Corney Brook is closed for this season but Cheticamp park (15 min) is open.', 'Nice and easy trail is well maintained and has great view at the end ', 'The loop is a great addition to the boardwalk and to take in some extra views. Flat and easy for all skill levels.', "The famous Cabot trail view. On a sunny day, bring a hat. There is very little shade. The loop is only a touch hillier than the flatter there-and-back trail and is quieter. There's a look out point with a bench under a tree along the loop which is nice to sit at (and where you might see my lost blue hat!)", 'This trail was absolutely beautiful! Definitely a family friendly trail. some difficult parts but the views are absolutely worth it. A great place to take in the beauty of the ocean. Highly recommend putting this on your bucket list!', 'Absolutely beautiful trail and look out points. If traveling the Cabot Trail this is your #1 stop. Theres really no shade throughout so prepare for that if its hot outside.', 'This is an iconic trail. Before you get to where the boardwalk starts you get a nice easy flat hike through moose habitat. There is a nice man made wooden lookout you can go up in. The scenery at this points is woodsy. Once you get to the fork you can decide to take the long way (right) or go left and go straight for the epic views. We turned left for sake of time. Once the boardwalk portion starts get the camera ready. The views are incredible. There are quite a few stairs to go down so just remember you have to get back up but it’s so worth it. We loved it so much we bought the T-shirt. This is a great way to see the highlands and ocean majestically collide. ', 'All I can say, if it’s the first visit at cape breton, make sure you don’t go back without this hike! Absolutely Spectacular...

If you’re elementary level hiker, it can be a bit long for you.', "Awesome trail - just don't get your hopes up for views if there is a even a little bit of fog or rain!", 'June 2019. Well kept trail and easy terrain with combination of crushed gravel and beaten grass, last portion is wooden boardwalk and many stairs (fragile vegetation signs to stay on boardwalk), showcasing scenic views of Cabot Trail and ocean. Return trail is shaded and popular, this loop is less crowded but very exposed to the sun. This loop offers some viewing areas, but not as astonishing as the main ocean view, would suggest doing the loop on the way in. ', 'easy stroll with beautiful views', 'When there is fog there is little to see. This makes it a nice walk. Nothing special. 

When it is clear, the view is spectacular!

Unless you can see the end of the trail from the road as you approach from the Chéticamp side, it isn’t clear enough and not really worth it. ', 'Very pretty. No challenge at all. Beautiful stroll. ', 'A very easy trail to walk !  Gorgeous lookout!  Very windy when we’ve visited - have walked it three times so far. On a sunset visit, we saw two moose - one quite close. ', 'great hike 
well maintained path and boardwalk 
spectacular views 
a top hike ', 'Ok so the full loop is loooonnnnngggg and the scenery is the best for a short period of time

EXTREMELY windy on the boardwalk look off point (bring windbreaker just incase!). Also lucky enough to see a moose! Very crowded ', 'The most touristic, iconic hike of Cape Breton is great. If you don’t mind a ton of people, this is a super easy hike to check off the list. ', 'Skill level: Intro/Beginner
Difficulty: 2.5/10 Quite Easy
If you just fast walk it can be done in an hr and half. The views are glorious. We did it twice on our short stay at Cape Breton. Saw some moose :) and a quick glimpse of a black bear. Sunsets are truely breathtaking. Always a crowd. Very popular trail esp given its ease. Must do! Strong winds at the top!!', 'Easy walking trail - always busy. would definitely recommend going early in the am to avoid the droves of people. 
nice and scenic  - but still didnt see a moose.', 'We did this one at the end of the day yesterday, August 28, and it was worth it. The trails are very busy, but never seemed too crowded. We also observed an a abundance of pilot whales at the bottom of the cliffs. It was our third trail of the day and one we hope to return to. ', 'An amazing trail on an amazing drive through the Cape Breton Highlands national park. Yes it’s busy but the views at the end are spectacular! An almost nothing until you reach the freedom you wish you had. I can only imagine Mecca feels this good. Peace be onto you brothers and sisters.

Tourists: we hate you as much as we need you - as you keep those Cabot Trail roads smooth and crackless.', 'Did the full loop, counterclockwise. Amazing views. Animal sightings. Started at 8:30am and we were one of the only ones there. By the time we were leaving the parking lot was full and the trail was busy. Glad we got the early start. ', 'breathtaking views.  the trail is easy,  except for the the several steps near the main look out. we also spotted a moose on our visit :-)', "It's a must see, trail is a beautiful walk, there are approximately 12 benches so you can rest and enjoy the Lord's beauty. ", 'Belle randonnées avec points de vue magnifiques.  La portion sur palissade vaut vraiment la peine', 'The views were a definite 5, however the trail was very crowded. We hit the trail at about 9 am with maybe 20 cars in the parking lot when we arrived, and well over 100 when we left around 11:30. People did not seem to respect the signs that indicated vegetation rehabilitation. We did see 2 whales while looking out over the ocean. ', 'This is the casual-outdoors-tourist-favorite trail in the park. As someone else posted, it is a walk, not a hike. The path is well maintained with crushed rock and an extensive boardwalk at the end of the main lookout. The views are nice and all but the trek is way too crowded for my taste. There are equally good views with better hiking all throughout the park. That being said this is a 5 star trail for families with young children that are just getting their hiking legs.', 'Good view. Very easy. Very crowded.', 'Wasnt a hike it was a walk. Very accessible. Nice views of the cabot trail and sunset. Saw a moose the loop past the large lookout. Was interesting to learn why the forest is turning into a dry land but not pretty to look at. ', 'Beautiful views on an easy trail, not a moderate at all. You can decide whether or not to climb up and down the 300 plus very easy steps as you approach the view. Even if you decide not to, you’ll get the same view.', 'Absolutely stunning.  The trail is a loop. If you do the short side of the loop in and back, you will miss some of the most beautiful scenery I have ever seen. To do the entire loop is only about half a mile longer. 

To miss the crowds, go early. When we arrived at the trail at 9:00 AM, there were five cars in the parking lot. When we left around noon there were about 100. ', 'Very easy trail. Great views got some parts closed ( plants vegetation) so you can’t do a full loop. Great photo opportunity. Well maintained. Good viewing platforms and benches. ', 'Awsome!!!', 'Views are amazing from up above the clouds! With lots of signage along the tail and access to outhouses, the trail really is great for the whole family!', 'great trail. really pushed my limits as a beginner at hiking. so so so many people, it is not an exaggeration.  ', 'Super busy trail, families and people everywhere. The back side of the trail is a bit longer but not strenuous and much less people. Beautiful landscape will not bore hikers.', 'Stunning but lots of people on the trail - we saw some moose but watch out for the amount of poop on the trail. If you don’t have a lot of time, loop part is skippable. Just go to the point and back. ', 'I just give 3 stars because they are way too many people! Hike is ok, like a highway. The view is pretty but not the best i had in the park! And i was out of season so i dont wanna see this trail when you have 100 car parked.', 'Took fantastic picture of bull moose!', 'Great views and beautiful sunsets', 'Enjoyable hike with amazing views. Saw a cow moose too. It is a must do if you are on Cape Breton Island', 'Hiked here on a gorgeous September morning. Top tip - even in September, arrive early. Just after 8 we had the boardwalk to ourselves to watch the porpoises and pilot whales have breakfast. Bring your binoculars!', 'Hiked here on a gorgeous September morning. Top tip - even in September, arrive early. Just after 8 we had the boardwalk to ourselves to watch the porpoises have breakfast. Bring your binoculars!', 'Easy trek. Beautiful views. Unable to get to the very end due to high winds. Loved every step.', 'Easy hike, wonderful view from the ridge.  Go early if you prefer solitude.', 'This is a walking trail, not hiking. It’s a beautiful walk. GO EARLY! Gets very crowded. We were there by 8:00 and there were only 3 other cars. When we finished at 10:30 the parking lot was full. Please pick your trash up, especially cigarette butts! Gees!!', 'Beautiful! Great loop. Love the board walk down.', 'unbelievable', 'Amazing! Sad to see visitors trespassing on the areas clearly marked as no go zones. Pleased to see authorities tracking down violators. Remember it’s not all about you, it’s about appreciating and preserving nature.', 'The lookout is unbelievable. Trail is very accessible to all.', 'The fork was open to both directions on Monday morning and was able to do the loop. Saw a mother and baby moose about a km into the walk, roughly 100 feet from the trail, and another larger female moose on the way back to the lot from the Skyline look-off - she was much closer, maybe 20 feet from the boardwalk. Amazing trail, and relatively easy - I’d call it a walking trail as opposed to a hiking one. Very well groomed and wide.', 'Great for a first visit. Have been multiple times; the easy terrain and well maintained trails make it great for any activity level on the loop or the out|back. But after a couple visits you are ready to move on to more exciting hikes, with better views, and less foot traffic. Definitely should be rated EASY though, and not MOD. ', 'Excellent views of the sea and the Cabot trail from on top of a cliff. There were strong winds when we were there. Taking the right fork will bring you to the loop, and the left fork takes you to the boardwalk. We took the loop, and saw views of the sea on the way to the boardwalk', 'The loop is closed but u can still hike the trail. I feel this trail is a bit overrated. I can see better sunset at various locations in Chéticamp area without having to walk ie drive up and watch.', 'Loved the trail. Views were fabulous. Beat the crowds and go at sunrise. Part of trail is closed for maintenance, but can still complete the full trial.', 'Gave it 5 stars for the views but disappointed half was closed. Repairs should be done earlier in the year.', 'One of the most beautiful hikes I’ve ever done, did this is the fall which was gorgeous!', 'Breathtaking vistas of the Gulf of St-Lawrence and the Atlantic as well as the mountains of Cape Breton. Saw a moose and her calf, some rabbits and possibly a small whale breaching the water.', 'This is a beautiful trail', 'Go early to avoid people. The first bit is not at all exciting but the end is worth every step.', "Gorgeous views await you on the Skyline Trail, but so do a lot of people. Very heavily trafficked trail, but the lack solitude is worth the views you get on this trail. The loop is a great option and many people just stick to the out-and-back version of the trail (taking a left at the fork). 

If you do the loop, you may get lucky enough to see a moose or two (like me) on the more woodsy section. PROTIP: if you're here in the summer, do this trail right after a rain storm. The first part of the loop is boardwalk, so your shoes won't even get wet. And the crowd will be a quarter of what it would be on a perfect day.", 'This is not a hike - an easy stroll is the pace but the end view is what people come for. Note that it is wheelchair accessible', 'This trail was just ok, honestly. With so many beautiful views throughout this entire area, we had a hard time finding this crowded trail worth it. We prefer the lesser traveled trails in this park.', 'Good hike despite the rain and fog, Ran into two Bull Moose on the trail.', "Beautiful, well maintained trail with gorgeous views of the ocean and Cape Breton Highlands. It's the views that make this a 5 Star trail for me. Even the Loop trail is pretty easy and manageable even for hikers that are not in great shape; there are no steep or exposed sections. Let biggest draw of the Loop trail is that it's less crowded than the out-and-back trail.", 'Did the hike in June and it's worth the views. If you're in the area and have the time, you must do it. We took the "woodsie" side out, saw the views and took the other path back. The way back was very easy and not really a hike per se. Didn't see any wildlife other than a few small birds :(', 'Great hilltop trail without having to climb the mountain. Beautiful panoramic views of the mountain tops and ocean. Its a place where you are left feeling wide open to the sky. There are a lot of moose on this trail, which is why dogs are not allowed (the moose were consistently charging at dogs on the trail). It is very heavily tracfficed as it is probably the most popular trail in the Cabot Trail Park.', 'Awesome trail in crystal clear, crisp, fresh air. Spectacular views, beautiful vegetation. Highlight of the Cabot Trail.', 'Nice, easy and family trail. Very exposed so be advised; under the sun today it was cooking!', 'Easy trail, not much to look at in between lookouts but definitely gives you a sense of being out in the middle of nowhere.', 'Easy and short. Saw whales from the cliff edge :)', 'A must do trail.  The western part of the trail overlooks the Cabot Trail Road .  spectacular views.   The winds increase as you go down the steps but there are areas to sit and take it all in .  No dogs allowed so leave Fido home .', "Très beau sentier facile d'accès qui nous donne une magnifique vue sur les falaises et la mer. Nous avons rencontré 6 orignaux dès le début du sentier. wow!"]

['Great Trail. Very Advanced.', 'So we underestimated the intensity and duration. So beautiful, kudos to all of us who respect nature and keeping natural. Loved the view and the journey but note to everyone... wear your hikers, bring water and some high calorie protien snacks like nuts. Will do it many times again!', 'Well maintained and marked. Not too muddy. Beautiful views and biodiversity
', 'Was a bit wet today but was fun! No bugs!', 'Was too hot and I started too fast', 'Great trail…lots of rocks and roots, some nice lake views, dry today, good shade through the wooded areas. Not too easy, not too hard!', 'Nice trail in a hot day. Lots of shade.', 'Great view. Hungry mosquitoes.', 'Lovely day on the trail! Wildflowers in full bloom. First time seeing trilliums in Nova Scotia!', 'Close to home and a nice middle of the road hike on the family of Bluff Trails.  Prefer to hike it spring and fall as it can get quite busy during the summer (even on week days).  Nice mix of rock face and forest.  The signage that differentiates the 3 trails that start at the same spot can be a bit confusing once in the woods so note the colour of your trail ticket (you will see these along the routes).  Great views along the hike.  The lake it runs along is swimmable (watch for leeches- bring salt if you plan to take a dip- the just lake entrance is a bit further down the walking trail past the mouth of the Bluff trail system.  There are “keep dogs on leash sings” but tbh many people let the puppers off once the hike starts which does not seem to bother most people (in my experience).
Enjoy it’s worth the time.
Happy Hiking ', 'Younger folks seemed to skip along. Lots of roots and rocks to clambake over. Mid point overlooking valley is a windy spectacle. Our dog loved it. Good hike just seemed more demanding than other times. ', 'A good, close to Halifax hike. Took me around 2 hours from my car around the loop, and back to my car. The trail was in good condition, with lots of good spots to take a rest or stop for a sip of water. Only ran into a handful of people on the trail.', 'Beautiful day to get out - trail was in great shape, not too busy, and was good to get some sun before all the blackflies are out.', 'The last loop is a heat trap but other than that absolutely amazing', 'Beautiful wilderness especially once you get far enough in that you don’t hear the highway.', 'Always a great trail! It was drier than I expected but there was a lot of mud and some very icy patches. Icy areas were very obvious, so take it slow mainly around the canoe portages and around the brook crossing.', 'It was very cool to listen to the icy lake cracking and groaning as the temperature rose. The trail itself is bare in some spots, muddy in a couple of spots but mostly icy. If you have cleats, definitely wear them today and probably for the next couple days as well.', "This was our first time on this trail and we really enjoyed it, had some great views, good exposed rock sections and some nice areas for taking a break or a picnic if we so chose. The dog was tired at the end, so that's a win, always love a loop and nice that you can continue on to further loops if you have the time. We will definitely be back to do the longer loops - but maybe in the summer. It was verrrrry icy today, some really tight slick spots on some of the hills and both my husband and I took a couple spills, despite being fairly experienced hikers. Definitely took longer than it normally would, having to take a good chunk of time navigating the plentiful icy sections. But it was a fun adventure anyways and a beautiful day otherwise! ", 'what a beautiful place. ice grippers are highly recommend right now. ', 'Love this trail. It’s a great hike, lots of variation in the terrain and lots of up and down. Look offs are stunning. Lots of ice today and some muddy spots but overall great! ', 'Great trail! It’s a great length for a hike, it takes about 2 hours to complete the loop. It’s heavily used- lots of people and dogs share the trail, so it’s well worn and easy to keep on trail. ', 'Icy but nice ', 'Great trail. Multiple trails in the area. For the Pot Lake Loop do the right side of the trail first for the pretty view points. Takes 2.5hrs. ', 'beautiful winter hike, clean trail, solid footwear is necessary as there are some slippery bots on the exposed rocks. ', "Out of the 12 or so dogs we saw today, about 3 of them were leashed, not counting the people who called their dog and clipped a leash on when they saw us coming. If you are uncomfortable with dogs, this is not a good trail for you when it's busy. Despite signs, the majority of dog owners are not respecting them.", 'Absolutely beautiful! So many views and super colorful tree trunks.
Lots of small hills and rocks to climb over. Plan on going back to do the other trails soon!', 'Very nice in the snow.  We started with snow shoes, but took them off part way through.', 'Fantastic day out there.  Just a little muddy. Lots of company.', 'Very busy day, a little muddy on some parts of the trail', 'Well traveled and easy to follow trail.  Enough company to make me comfortable doing the loop alone, but not too many to make it annoying.  It is a lot of up and down and makes for a good workout.', 'Fantastic trail, well marked and beautiful trees in late October￼￼', 'Enjoyable as always for a quick lunchtime run. A bit wet in places from the rain. But not a major issue.', 'Was here at 8am. Only car in the lot. 2 hours later there are no parking spots. Get here early if you come on the weekend.', 'If you like rocks this one is for you.', 'Great hike! Not overly challenging but enough to make it feel like a hike with some nice views.', 'Not as wet as a couple days ago after the hurricane.', 'Lots of wet spots and fresh running water after Teddy. Creeks that weren’t there last week are raging full on. Amazing site to see.', 'Good trail.  Busy today with lots of families.', 'Fall is close by. It was chilly this morning. Very beautiful for sure. Great trail.', 'Great trail, well maintained and marked.', 'Great run even though it rained last night. Was not to slippery.', 'Love this route. It’s not much longer than the second loop. Cramped calf muscle slowed me towards the end but other than that all good.', 'Did this trail with a couple day 1s for my birthday. The weather wasn’t great but neither were the views. Not saying the views weren’t nice but it didn’t need to be nice out in order to get the full effect. Lots of exposed roots and rocks but it made it that much more entertaining and exciting. Wear the proper footwear, my friend didn’t and it almost resulted in a broken face. Took us around 1H 45M give or take but we also ran off and on. The perfect birthday trail if you ask me. ', 'Nice trail with some wonderful views of Cranberry Lake.  Took us about  3 hours. Lots of exposed roots and rocks ', 'Never disappoints!', 'Ran the bluff loop. First time. A bit hit in some areas. Definitely need water if you do this.', 'This was a nice diversion along the Bluff Trail. In 2019, we did the large loop outside of Pot Lake and it needed a little prep work (drink and snacks) on a hot day. Only thing folks need to be aware of on this one is good shoes... it’s pretty rooty and rocky, so good soles are a must to avoid those achy feet/knees.', 'Great loop! Took just over 2 hours with 15 mins of breaks included. ', 'Excellent hike. Paths are well indicated. The loop itself is about 7.5 km but from and to the parking it’s a little over 8 km. AllTrails app says to plan for 2 hours, but once you get there the signs says to plan between 2 to 3 hours. In our case it took closer to three hours.', 'Just did the length of Cranberry Lake and back on the Pot Lake Loop, aprox 7.5km. Pretty straightforward, lots of exposed roots and low rocks to hop over and through. no high elevations but a few areas where you could get a breeze. moderately busy this weekday, all dogs (maybe 5 or 6) were leashed. excellent signage.', "This is one of the best hikes near Halifax.  Parking is a bit limited at the trail head so best to go before 11am on weekends.  It's a bring in pack out trail so make sure to have a backpack with you.  The trail offers fantastic views throughout and at the furthest point you'll be rewarded with expansive views of the lakes.  Nice flat rocks atop for lunch or snacks.  We went mid June and the bugs were not noticeable at all.", 'Did this trail with my partner and four year old son. We had a great time! A few falls by our little guy but he plowed through. GORGEOUS views and scenery, a few flat Ricky areas to stop for snacks or breaks. we took lots. recommend for sure!', 'Great trail. A little muddy in spots after being dry for a few days but easily avoidable. The trail was pretty busy on Tuesday and I chose to do it counter clockwise so we met lots of groups. I was alone for the first half though which was awesome. ', 'Really enjoyed the landscape. Went on a weekday and found the traffic to be light (encountered 4 other groups). There had been sun the few days prior and the mud was not a problem - a couple of small, soft areas that were easy to walk around. Not buggy, maybe thanks to the light wind. ', 'beautiful and fun hiking spot', 'Really enjoyed this trail, looking forward to going back and giving the second loop a try. Something to be aware of- in the opening of the trail there are several small “bridges” and the wood is fairly rotten so watch your step! Muddy in spots but as someone else mentioned, nothing a good pair of hiking boots can’t handle! Be prepared for a fair amount of uphill climbing :)', 'First time and it was great. Would do it again for sure. A couple spots that could use markers but didn’t take long to get back on track!!', "Very busy trail, we saw dozens of people, mostly in the first and last kilometre or two. The people thin out the further you get in. Very nice trails, well marked, well maintained and hard to lose yourself for the most part. It had some wet muddy spots, but nothing that a half decent pair of hiking boots won't just cruise through, no problem. We will be going back to do the second, longer loop soon. ", "As a new hiker going solo I tried the first and smallest loop of this trail. I quite enjoyed it and found it to be very busy, but that might have something to do with the virus being out. As for time I managed to finish it in under 2 hours, with some photo taking in there. Very fun trail overall and I'm interested in the other loops!", "Feb 23 - We only managed to get about a third of the way through before turning back because we were on a timeline. It's quite icy today with very slippery spots. I'd like to try it again when it's a bit warmer and the ice is no longer a danger. ", 'the trail is still very icy but to be expected for February. went with my 2 daughters and we had fun. did not do the loop part of the trail because we didnt have enough time before the sun went down but we are definately coming back when we have more time so we can complete the whole trail. ', 'My go-to trail. Perfect for running, great views, clear trails and well-kept signage/maps.', 'not very scenic and very busy with bikes and joggers, not ideal for dog walking lol', 'Trail was easy to follow and well marked!', "really nice hike! Rocky and lots of roots which make it interesting. it was easy to follow an well marked. Some very beautiful views would be great for a picnic.
