', 'Challenging and varied hike with lots of up and down and beautiful views.', 'blackflies are out!  leaves are popping!  trail in good shape with just a few muddy spots.', 'Amazing trail! Great trail markers too. ', 'Beautiful trail, took 2.5/3 hours with breaks to complete, not the 4-5 hours the sign recommends. This is coming from a moderately/average fit person. 

Very up hill hike but with stunning views. Went in a chilly and kind of rainy day without issue. Can’t imagine it in the sunlight! ', 'Amazing trail.. well marked which I 
love especially when flying solo. 
views were spectacular. I chose to head up at the 1.7 km on the rail trail heading in. Glad I did. It was easier going down the softer terrian at the other end by Jessies dinner than it would have been going down all the boulders at the first. 
heading back over the next few weeks to tackle the North and South Granite trails.
', "Beautiful lookouts...we started this from the opposite end from what most do and challenged ourselves to alot of incline. Been lots of rain in the last 24 hours and this trail surprizingly drained well!  ...not alot of mud.  There's lots of rock and root...so it was slippery. I wouldn't rate this difficult but it wasn't easy either. Loved it!
", 'Dry route. Nice weather. Great view.', 'wet!!  definitely wear boots after wet weather. ', 'Not for beginners.bring good shoes', 'Well marked and easy to follow. This trail is well maintained and offers some great views. ', 'conditions are great.
a little wet in a few small spots.', 'What a great trail, no ice today at all. Very easy to navigate, many trail markers and easy to spot. From the parking lot and back at Park rd we went 11 kms, and was over 4 hours (with some stops). Check out all the lookouts, so worth it! ', 'Beautiful trail, ugly conditions.

Had to give up on Admirals Lake due to ice, and the railbed was a mix of slush and ice, but the area is beautiful and, under any other conditions, would easily be a 5-star hike.', 'such a beautiful day on one of my favorite trails!  pretty chilly, still a few icy snow patches left but easily passable with a little care.', 'absolutely beautiful! no complaints! *(other than my phone dying at the very end making it seem like an 8.3k walk.. but its definitely 9.3k!)* highly suggested!', 'Icy but ok with cramp ons, beautiful day and fantastic views. Saw no one on the trail, very quiet', 'Amazing views ! Must do again in 6 months', 'Great! Lots of ups and downs. Snow was a bit slippery.', 'lots of snow but fairly packed down path.
', 'Love this trail! The trail is challenging and the views are beautiful. Packed snow, some icy parts. Lots of ups and downs. Well marked. I was able to do it without spikes, but enjoyed it more once I put them on. It took us a little over 3 hours with a few stops at all the look offs. Will definitely do it again!', 'Beautiful! Trail is mainly packed snow with a few slippery and icy patches but I did fine in boots without spikes. Trees keep you out of the wind which is perfect. Really fun trail', 'Beautiful trail. Highly recommend', 'Amazing trek.. well worth it', 'Loved this trail.  It’s well marked.  The lookout points were stunning. My legs are feeling the burn as it’s not an easy one, but it’s a great workout and just a beautiful hike overall', 'Icy but beautiful.', 'Great hike. Great views from various look offs. ', 'great trail.
one of my faves.
perfect balance of moderate and challenging terrain.', 'It was awesome!  Great workout and beautiful scenery. Definitely a do again!', 'Amazing! Beautiful views! ', 'great hike... you will deal with traffic as this is well known trail system.', 'Many awesome views but trail should be rated difficult! Worth it, though.
', 'Did the trail in early November. It was 8 degrees out and nice and dry despite being overcast. Not a trail I would recommend if it was wet out, between the leaves and roots it would border on being dangerous. However, it was a nice dry trail. If you start on the Southern end, the hardest part of the entire trail is the first 1km. It’s quite steep on the other end as well, but the southern end has a lot of rocks and roots to traverse. I looked forward to doing this trail for a while now. There are some amazing views from the top of the trail, but the highlight of my hike was Eunice Lake. There wasn’t a breath of wind the entire hike so when I arrived at Eunice Lake, it looked like a mirror!  What a spectacular view. The trail head says to allow 5 hours and the maps provided on the trail say 4-5 hours. The main trail is 5.5km long and took me just under 2 hours hiking by myself. I ran into some others that said it took 2.5 hours.  All in all, a really nice hike. Take lots of water and some snacks for energy. ', 'Great condition, the parking on Bayers Mill is a good idea, take out a couple km of rail trail.', "This is the second year in a row doing this hike! It's not an easy one, but not too difficult either, lots of rock climbing so wear proper footwear, a few look offs which had really nice views! Trail is marked the whole way, but there was one part where  the trees over gown down by the lake, where we missed the marker, and didn't realize we did a circle, so took us probably 15 mins longer this time, you have to go down right to the lake and go to the right! Took us just under 5 hours to complete, including a a stop for lunch and a few other stops .
", 'It was a bit difficult for my second hike but felt pretty good that I completed the trail.', 'Awesome but difficult 
', 'Could be cut back in some spots but great hike', 'Trail is a bit over grown in some sections. But someone has cleared a bunch recently. Great views', "Great trail. Dog friendly. I've jogged it in an hour so take the 4-5 hour rating with a grain of salt if you're able bodied and not stopping for breaks. ", "Really great trail! the woods were beautiful and I saw a very friendly deer. I went a day after it rained so there were mosquitoes but as long as I kept at a steady pace they didnt bother me (I wasn't wearing bug spray). Also didnt find any ticks on me or my dog so that's a plus. The signage was very good, lots of little yellow reminders that you're on the right trail. The rocks were a bit slippery at some parts so definitely make sure you're wearing hiking shoes. Also, park at the end of Bayer Mill road, otherwise you're going to be walking on flat boring trail for 2km.", "Great trial if you're looking for more of a challenge due to the rocky terrain. Elevation gain is steady with some steep sections but beautiful payoff at the top. The sign says 4 to 5 hours at 45km per hour but it only took me 3 hours going at a moderate pace. After you get to the lookout point you can choose to do a small look that goes by Admiral Lake or you can just turn back the way you've come because the trail is really just an out and back with a loop attached and the view at Admiral Lake was not totally worth it. ", 'We did this hike for Canada Day, and it was hot! Lots of mozzies and flies out, and humid. The terrain is difficult with lots of rocks and roots that were slippery. Moderate elevation. Really great look outs and views! My favorite part was squeezing through a boulder structure. Great hike, but maybe not for 25+ days', "Did this trail on Saturday June 20th and would of loved it if it wasn't for the heat. This is a difficult trail with amazing views and look off points. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a challenge. I brought alot of water and would recommend others do the same. ", 'Did this trail yesterday, and it was quite difficult! Well marked trail full of up and downs. Lots of cool look offs, but there was no stopping because the bugs were so bad! ', 'Great trail - I would rate it as moderate to difficult as there are some steep hills, slippery spots and a little climbing required. Took about 3 hours from start to end. Very well marked and well maintained. Will definitely be returning to try the other hikes within the system. ', 'What a great loop! Definitely accurately rated as difficult with steep inclines and declines, lots of large rock on the trail. An excellent challenge. Perfect evening loop to see the sun setting. Would recommend starting by 5. At a decent pace it is easily done in under 3 hours. Very little mud and only encountered one other person on the loop trail. Definitely going to go back!  A must do, in the fall, as the views will be amazing.', 'Well marked and a very scenic walk through the forest with several look-off points. Lots of inclining trail which was a great challenge. Light traffic on a weekday midday - we encountered 4 other groups and a few others along the main path leading to the trail loops. Will hope to get out again in Fall to experience the views.', 'awesome trail, but pretty challenging! dogs loved it and we didn’t run into too many other people.  will be back for sure!', "Great trail for a Thursday afternoon hike.  The rail trail at the beginning was very busy, however we quickly lost the crowds once getting on the trail.  When walking down the rail trail from the parking lot, the entrance to the Admiral Lake Loop is an unmarked off shoot into the woods with red and yellow markers nailed to the trees (Admiral Lake Loop is the yellow markers).  We accidentally missed the entrance and ended up doing the loop backwards.

Make sure you take the ~20m side trail labeled 'Janet's Diner' - great spot for lunch!

It took our group of 2 + dog (on leash) approximately 3 hours to complete the loop including the 5km of rail trail with a half hour lunch in the middle.  Icy sections on a lot of the ascents and descents, but plenty of snow and rock exposed enough to avoid needing to use microspikes.", 'This was an awesome hike! Did it in the middle of the winter so it was quite icy. Lots of steep hills but was rewarded with great views. I did the admiral lake loop, and the skull rock lookoff.  Was about 11 km and took me and my golden retriever just over 2 hours to complete although we were moving quick and only stopped to look at the views. The signage for admiral lake loop recommends 4-5 hours for the trail which I thought was a bit much ', 'challanging trail, lots of steep climbing,  beautiful look offs make all the climbing well worth it. Well marked trail, a little muddy in spots.', 'Started too late to do entire loop. Made it to Harbour View, then headed back.', 'Great trail, nice views on some of the smaller trails to look-offs. 
Was a fair bit of people using it, lots of up and down, but nothing too challenging if you are in good shape. 
We did the loop itself in 2.5 hours with just one stop on a brisk pace', 'Started from the Bayers Mill Rd entrance to avoid the large trailhead. Hiked this with my 3 month old strapped to me, my frenchie and my friend and her 2 pups. Kept a moderately fast pace. I consider myself to be in great shape but some of the up hill parts will have your heartrate jacked and breathing heavy! Definitely will be doing this one again. Recommend it if you want a good workout. ', 'Amazing trail, had such a nice hike. Perfect in this season to see all of the colours. Definitely in the intermediate/advanced category, not a hike for unfit people. We powered through the entire thing and was well worth it. So many stops along the way for stunning scenery and overlooking the forests and lakes. ', 'Loved it!  After a heavy rain overnight the trail was magical.  Rich moss, lichen and. ferns in full force.  Blueberry treats along the way, great overlooks.  Not for the less than fit hiker.  Lots of rocks and roots and long sections of dense bushes to get through.  ', 'Love this hike. Steep inclines and declines. Lots of rock climbing. Stunning views. Over grown sections but still very easy to follow the trail. The cave is awesome and very unique. Took us 2.5 hours but sign estimates 45min a km. ', 'It was a cool trail but hard on the knees.', 'A little bit hard, but the view is definitely worth it.', 'Excellent afternoon trail that gives too a little taste of everything. I’ve only ever walked flyers trail and salt marsh every other day so this was the first trail that I pictured as a “hiking trail”. The sign says 4-5 hours but I hiked it in 90 mins. I’ll definitely bring my wife and daughter out to experience this one. The trail seems well kept, marked with yellow indications every few meters and that makes it nearly impossible to step off the trail and get lost. ', 'It’s amazing trail. I would recommend it as it is really moderate compared to most of the moderate trails in Nova Scotia. Most of the time you walk into forest but several amazing views make the trail really beautiful.
Bring bug spray.', 'Very nice trail. Bring bug spray tho. 

Would recommend. :)', 'In the past I’ve completed this trail but the other day two of us tried to do it and a fallen tree caused us to go around and we weren’t able to find the trail again and we’re forced to turn around. Would love it if someone could either add more trail markers or make the path more obvious so people don’t get lost. Also, there’s private property which is easy to accidentally venture into. Trail was hard to find', 'Beautiful hikes with lots of great surprises along the way!', 'Great hike with my dog. Beautiful elevation and views with lakeside spots as well. One of my new favorites around the city!', 'Such a good little hike that’s all up hill to the look off aka skull rock and then a nice way back all the way down!', 'We went at a steady pace and completed the loop in 3 hours. It would be easy to spend a lot longer at all the look offs. Great views.', 'Super, lots of views and a good workout with ups and downs. Come prepared with boots, food and water. Did it on 7 October.', "The sign isn't joking when it says to budget 45min/km. Worth every minute, absolutely stunning views.", "Great spot! Trail is clearly marked and easy to follow. Took about 3 hours to complete and says it's only 5.5 km", 'Fantastic! Strenuous climb worth it for the spectacular views. The trails are well signed and marked clearly with flags.', 'great hike, love the terrain :)', 'lovely trail, challenging in places with spectacular views.  still snow in the forests in the vallies so be prepared for that.  The "Cave" pass through was a pleasant surprise.', "Not long,  but not an easy hike, along a rock-strewn path (the Admiral Lake loop), up and down a ridge.  The path to and from the loop is wide,  flat and gravelled; pleasant enough if you have children or aren't in the best of shape.", "Great hike, not far from the city. Once on the trail it's well marked. However there comes a point in the beginning with a fork in the road that isn't well marked.", "Rail Trail is quite level and well defined. The Admiral's Loop is also relatively easy to follow, at least the trail with the yellow markers. The views are spectacular and well worth the effort to get there. It is however a rigorous hike not meant for anyone not in decent shape. Take plenty of water and pictures. Took approximately 5.5 hours including walk from parking lot and back.", "The Admiral Lake Loop was a great hike, it's very rough natural terrain, every vista was beautiful. Took us about  4 hours to complete it, I cannot wait to go again.", "This trail is amazing I hike it once every year since I was just a kid there is a loop that takes you the hole day to complete and there is another one that it for overnight campers love love love this trail and can't get enough of it", 'great trail, with beautiful look offs. there is a main path that connects 3 different loop trails. the main path is great for biking and has spots to lock you bike up in front of the trails. as someone said before this trail is not for beginners or kids.', 'Really nice trail with great views. Nice spot to picnic with tables and bench near a lake. May not want to take really young kids to the look-offs! Great trail!!', 'Great hike. Not for beginners.  ']

['Wet but pretty', 'the new trail into the cove is very very muddy. Also not well marked if at all.



', 'Great coastal hike, very easy once you get onto the main trail some of the leading up to it can be a bit tricky. 

We went up to the first bunkers that are further in the back of the trail, but amazing art done up!

would recommend trying out on both low and high tide ', 'We started at the trail head pretty easy going as to nice dry ground, then it gets mucky and wet in some spots. Recommend hiking boots. We went stopped at the bunker pretty cool, just before the bunker though there was a trench/stream not sure what you would call it, but it’s wet LOL we hoped over it. Had a great time. The only think I found as down fall is the sound of traffic at certain points, mind you we just did the Nine mile trail in the woods so two totally different hikes. Wear hiking boots, bring water and sit in the rocks to watch for the seals and hopefully you will see them beach ', 'Only did part of this trail as we had a dog with us and she was nervous on the rocks. However, it was absolutely beautiful and we will return', 'Beautiful trail, stunning views. Muddy in some places, but totally worth it. ', 'Great trail, lovely hike along the atlantic ocean!!', 'Very beautiful. Within about 10 min, you’re out in the open and overlooking the Atlantic. Look for seals on the rock island formations you’ll see when you’re first able to see the ocean (they can be very hard to see unless you look very carefully, or have binoculars). The hike gradually ascends along the cliffside until you’re truly way up there. There are plateaus that can act as great lookouts / photo ops. 

The one knock on this one is the very unclear start point. We were lucky to have been able to ask a hiker who had just finished, and was able to explain what to do (the private property / no tresspassing signs make it hard to know what to do). We parked on the side of the road at the turn-around on Duncan’s Cove rd, before the pylons blocking access to the residential area. From there, you just walk down Gannet Ln, hop over the car barricade, and turn right into the bush when you see the sign that says “trail”. Without the advice of that hiker, I’m not sure we would have figured out where to walk. ', 'Access from Chebucto is a horrible overgrown muddy trail. When you have the old viewpoint in sight, it disappears into a bog. ', 'Amazing trail. Absolutely beautiful view of the ocean. The first part is boggy and boring, but worth it to get to the coast and not walk on private property. ', "the trail was amazing and we'll marked
", 'Great trail. Very muddy at parts, glad I wore my hiking boots and not my walking sneakers. Quite overgrown in some areas so I did a good Tick check on me and my dog. Will be back.', 'Was a great hike ', 'very muddy
', 'Beautiful trail. A bit muddy at some parts.  A warning for dog owners - saw a porcupine very close to the costal trail. Not sure if they’re a regular occurrence there, but may be good to be cautious if you’re bringing your pup.', 'Great hike, super muddy in the first ~1.5km though. First time using this entrance and it was nice, though I prefer the coastal entrance (which is shorter)', 'Can be wet but a nice view for sunrise. However the entrance to the trail can be miss leading due to all the private property and do not trespass signs. The trail that i went for was actually before a house and you will meet a red gate continue there until you reach a beautiful house the trail is before the house on the right', 'Great!', 'i have been hiking here for 15 years. in the last year it’s been the busiest i have ever seen it and the amount of dog poop bags left behind is positively atrocious. dog owners should be ashamed .', 'MUDDY', 'Lovely trail. Take a right instead of left when you see the house in front if you and follow the path and it’ll take you to the rocks. Lots of people out there ', 'Rocky and wet in some places but can walk around most wet spots. Beautiful scenery.', "Great trails! No markers but there's enough carved out that you will find your way one way or another. Beautiful spots to stop and rest on the rocks and look out over the ocean! Lots of different terrains so be prepared for anything and you'll be good! Muddy in some spots today but to be expected this time of year. ", "Hiked about 3km to the bunker, round trip was just over 6km. muddy in some spots but it was sunny and beautiful. watched some fishing boats bring in lobster traps. First time on this trail it was pretty busy! amazing views we'll definitely do it again.", 'It was the perfect combination of what you’d like in a hike. Decent climb, by the water, we seen some seals and when you get to the top there’s  a bunker to hang out in ! ', 'Beautiful views. Cold along the coastline. Great to see the bunkers. It was tricky to stay on the path. I wish there were markers. ', 'I had a ton of fun climbing on the rocks and watching nature. Worth the trip!', 'Me and my homie said screw it let’s go sunset chasing together. It was a bit cold and windy off the water so it was hard to light the joint but a lot of cool rocks for chilling out. Overall Duncan’s Cove was incredible views of the water and someone’s mansion, I’d recommend checking out for sure. ', 'Absolutely beautiful views!! So stunning. Trail was quite icy in sections, at times micro spikes were a good idea. Icy wind but worth it! ', 'If you’re bushwhacking, you’ve missed the trail and, since some of this is protected, you should turn back and find the trail. 

Beautiful coastal views, funky ww2 bunkers, not marked but easy to follow trail so long as you get the actual trailhead. 

BE RESPECTFUL OF PRIVATE PROPERTY. This little community has dealt with a lot of BS from hikers trespassing and, if we all want to be allowed on the trail at all, we all must be respectful. ', 'I’m actually super disappointed, and I was really looking forward to this hike for quite some time. The end views are incredible, but the hike in is horrendous. 

As others have mentioned, Google maps marks the trailhead at Gannet Lane which is on private property. So the All Trails trailhead is where we started (which is also a challenge to find as there is no signage). I only had a “trail” for about 1km in, the rest is marsh and bushes. I followed the All Trails map as there are 0 signs on the hike, and it was knee deep swamp for more than half of the hike today. Maybe I went off the actual trail somehow? If that’s the case then the All Trails map is grossly wrong. Or maybe we’ve just had a ton of rain lately. 

What should have been a 2 hour hike took about 3 1/2 with very limited time on the rocks as we knew we had a big journey back to the car. ', 'Excellent condition, amazing views. A classic walk! Plus, we got the news that Biden won while on our walk. Big￼ celebration!!!!', 'It’s a beautiful coastal trail with old historic bunkers and breathtaking views of the ocean! Some bushwhacking, many wet spots, and some parts of the trail are along the cliffs so be prepared. Such an inspiring hike. Terry Sheppard(a review just below mine) gave the best directions for finding the trail head.', 'beautiful views, fun trail, lots to see', 'Beautiful trail. Beautiful scenery along the ocean', 'This is probably one of the best coastal trails we have in NS, and that is saying something. The trail is not maintained but easy to follow. Once you get to the coast, you just follow along it until you reach the abandoned bunker. 

The real challenge is finding the trail entrance. The app will take you to a trail head no one uses. Everyone goes in off Gannet Lane although it is a private road. 

You go along Ketch Harbour Rd. to Chebucto Head Rd. And then turn on Duncan’s Cove Road. If it is a nice day on the weekend, there will likely be line of cars parked along the side of the road. There is a house at the end with a “private property” sign up. Gannet Lane is a dirt road off to the right. There is another house at the end of that lane with a “private property” sign up. Here is where it is tricky to find the trail head. It is right by a power pole. I’ve posted a picture. There are a couple little trails that all merge together eventually. 

There is very little bushwhacking on the trail. You are out in the open for the vast majority of the hike, so sun screen and hats in the summer. You are right along the coast so it is windy. 

The hike ends at an old army bunker. Well, there is a long rock wall about 5 - 10 minutes away that you can see from the bunker. There is a huge private home behind the rock wall. 

This is definitely a moderate hike with lots of ups and down. We did see some dogs and children along the way. They can do it with some help. There are a number of spots that you are right by the cliff so keep a careful eye. 

Took us 1 hour and 22 minutes on the way in, stopping for pictures and enjoying the scenery. 1 hour and 4 minutes on the way out without many stops. It’s about 6 kilometres. 

', "Such a beautiful area. The sea breeze, the sounds of the waves, just so nice. 

it's a pretty easy hike", 'Love this trail. Have done many times to enjoy the view.', 'Great hike! Not very strenuous and amazing views! WW2 bunkers were very neat!', 'The trail itself is clear but prone to muddiness after bad weather. There are various routes you can take (either scrambling over rocks closer to the shore or heading through trodden paths in the trees and bushes). 

If you start on Gannet Lane then there is quite a steep climb down at the start of the trail. The start of the trail is clearly marked by a wooden sign on a power line just before the private house. 

The views are beautiful in all weather. Due to the up-and-down over the rocks, I would agree that this trail is moderate and you should come prepared with sturdy footwear and water. 

This trail is not maintained. ', 'Grown over and neglected. Very wet after weeks of no rain. Did not even bother to complete the trail it was so sub par to other trails around.', 'A little over grown  hard to find trails', 'So much mud! ', "Amazing view. It's a little mucky at the start and once you're through to the water you can avoid most wet spots by using the rocks.  It can occasionally get slippery but we had a great time. My kids loved the climb. ", 'One of my favourites! Can be wet in the spring so bring good boots. ', 'Super nice. Bring pants and extra socks for swampy areas.', 'Today was my first time at this trail and I absolutely loved it. very clean and most of the dogs I have seen were on leashes.  
in some areas around the trail it was very muddy, so make sure you wear proper shoes for your hike :)', 'Beautiful view, I would definitely go again. It was kind of confusing to find at first.', "We parked at the turnaround near Duncan's Cove and Chebucto Head Roads and walked back to the trailhead on the oceanside marked by yellow nature preserve signs. Mid-March we ran into flooded sections every 5 min and only made it 2km in. On the way home we saw lots of cars parked at the lighthouse turnoff and Duncan's Cove Rd at Gannet Ln, mind the no parking signs, it would must be an easy walk from there to the oceanside. Will try that next time!", "Although it is hard to find and I did a different trail since I could not find the actual trail through all the private property signs I did find it by mistake. The easiest way to get to it is to park by the gate to the lighthouse and walk up the road to the lighthouse. On your right you will see one of the old Bunkers, follow the trail down to them and it continues around. I parked at a small turning spot where the Duncan's cove road and the Chebucto Head Heads intersect. There is a trail there that is about 2km of wooded/marsh trail and then becomes coastal taking you to the Lighthouse where you can continue to the Duncan's Cove trail and then just take the road back to your vehicle", 'Great views, neat old buildings.  Many different ways to go as the trail is not marked so I went 2 different ways.  Awesome hike!', 'Beautiful views of the coastal barrens. Found the trails further from the coast quite muddy. Need good shoes for navigating the rock near shore. I would definitely go back again.', 'Beautiful! Took about 3 hours spent total, 2 there because we were exploring and enjoying the view and 1 hour back because we were hungry. 
Bring water and snacks! Easy walking on the trail and easy enough to follow but better to stay in the main trail. Wear good shoes for hiking and bring layers since the wind can make it cold. Worth the trip!
The first bay is Duncan’s cove and then there is duck reef and Eastern Cove which is the biggest, the end is Gill’s Cove where you can see the lighthouse and get some shield from the wind behind the bunker.', 'Beautiful views.  Can be very busy', 'Amazing view, nice hike. The old forts are neat. Watch your step.', 'Really beautiful hike along the water. Rocky terrain, just a couple of muddy spots. Saw a large group of seals on Duncan Reef. Trail is not marked, but quite easy to follow. Well populated hiking route. ', 'ocean view hike, absolutely beautiful on a sunny day ', 'Beautiful trail with amazing ocean views the entire hike. Got to pass 2 sea caves (could hear them only, not really see them) comparable to the Thunder Hole in Maine. No parts of the trail were muddy and was easy to find the way to the look out station as you could see it a few km ahead in the distance. This a trail we decided to leave our dog home for and I’m glad we did. My opinion: this trail is not suitable for dogs - extremely sharp rocks/rough terrain, thorn bushes, and steep drop offs. An accident could easily occur, however people seem to think this is an off-leash free for all. Could be a bad situation if an on or off leash dog approached another as the trail is extremely narrow in places, often on the edge of a drop off.

Aside from that this is the most beautiful and enjoyable hike we’ve done in NS to date. There was beautiful scenery at all times. My opinion: this is a much better and more diverse trail than Cape Split. The hike took us under 3 hours to complete (including two 10-min breaks, and a 25-min break for lunch at the end). 

Note: parts of the trail require a bit of maneuvering/slight rock climbing. ', 'This trail is beautiful. Can be very tricky to follow as the trail is mainly human made but definitely my favourite in Nova Scotia!! 
', 'Forced to turn back halfway through (before the reportedly spectacular ocean views) as the trail disappeared into a bog interspersed with pools. Prior to that there were multiple boggy/muddy sections that made for very slow going. Overall, a miserable aborted hike. If you care about preserving the environment do not attempt this trail for the foreseeable future.', 'Depending on how you go about it (I’ve done a couple different routes now) - parts can be a bit overgrown and you can lose track of the path when really wet (I most recently went in spring after a LOT of rain)... so also be prepared for your feet to get wet if you aren’t wearing waterproof hikers. I wouldn’t recommend doing this in sandals or flip flops. Great visits overlooking the Atlantic out at the mouth of the harbour.', 'All swamp and bogey ', '*THIS IS A NATURE RESERVE - NOT A PARK*
The trail is NOT managed. There are no facilities and no signage.
It is protected under Nova Scotia’s Special Places Protection Act.
This means that the habitats and species are vulnerable to disturbance and damage; recreation is restricted. 
Dogs must be kept on leash and stay on trail at all times.  
All fires, camping, hunting, trapping, motorized AND non-motorized vehicle access are prohibited (that means no ATVs, motorcycles, or mountain bikes, or strollers).
Hikers should stay on the main trail and follow LEAVE NO TRACE principles.
And beware of Black-legged ticks!', 'A gorgeous coastline hike with seals and tides.', 'Stunning ocean and tide views on a partly cloudy and breezy Sunday. For a NW wind, waves and tides were still eye-catching and loud. Highly recommend for semi-agile people and dogs, the further you go the more tougher the terrain. Overall, a great active hike along a gorgeous coast line.', 'I enjoyed this trail, was absolutely beautiful. A little tricky is places due to rough terrain and mud but that’s a part of hiking and part of the adventure. I’ve never done this hike before so I’m not sure if it’s always quite wet or if it’s just because it’s spring and wet anyway but I’d recommend extra socks and shoes for after. Also, if you’re someone you needs to use washroom regularly it’s not a great spot. No outhouses (which is noted) but also no trees to hind behind. Lol', 'I did the trail on a foggy day. Hands down one of the best hikes I have done in Nova Scotia. The entire trail hugs the rugged coastline making for incredible views. Will definitely do it again', "great hike, and amazing views. the trail was very boggy and muddy. But it's a time of year issue I'm guessing.", 'Great walk out to army shack and back . January 27 2019 plus 4!', 'Went in mid- November. Trail still good but a bit muddy. Definitely need sturdy boots- lots of rocks and uneven terrain. Coastline views are spectacular. Well worth it.', 'A gorgeous hike right on the ocean - highly recommended!', "Very busy trail and easy to walk past the trailhead. Aside from that this is an easy trail for anyone to walk and the views are absolutely amazing. We saw seals wading in the surf the day we were there. There's lots to explore here so make sure you have a lot of time!", 'definitely my favorite coastal trail with lots of elements, you will never get bored aha!', 'This is one of our favorite hikes.Views are amazing and variety of terrain just right', "Easy, heavily used trail with great views of the rugged coastline.  We were lucky enough to see 10 to 12 seals playing in the surf breaking around several rocky islands just offshore.  Private property so be respectful.  It's also a nature preserve so minimize your impact!", 'My favourite hike. Beautiful views and lots of opportunity for adventure.', 'Great hike! Beautiful views all the way, gorgeous fauna and lots of places to stop and let the dogs have some water. Loved the variation of trail from open flat rocks to short steep stints to deep forest and windy trails through lush plant life. Our dogs had no problem with this hike, just took it slow to allow for breaks and water. 3 hrs round trip with our breaks.', 'Great views along the entire trail. Some boggy areas, but managed not to ruin my boots. Some steep climbs and ascents. Be sure to wear appropriate footwear. Entrance to trail can be confusing. Weathered  sign says ‘Private Property’ and there is a low gate to hop over.', 'Great views all along the trail. Just about 20-30 mins from Halifax. The first bit in the north part of the trail goes through some private property where no vehicles are allowed, but it looks like many people go through it to get onto the trail anyways', 'We saw sea lions just off the shore. Trail is quite muddy in parts!', 'Very scenic.', 'Really enjoyed this trail. Not overly challenging and beautiful views of Nova Scotia’s rugged coastline. Will definitely be back to do this hike over, and over again.', 'Amazing trail, with a wide verity of scenery it has something for everybody, and depending on how brave you are, many small rock beaches to explore', 'Beautiful hike with stunning views!!! Terrain can be a bit muddy/soggy so make sure to have good footwear!', 'Absolutely beautiful hike.  You will see waves crashing on the shore, rolling hills, woods, cliffs and even bunkers that were built for WWII.  The scenery is breath-taking.  Use a little caution and be sure to wear proper hiking shoes as there are a few areas of difficult terrain.', 'This was a spectacular hike! The view!', "Once you get to the abandoned ww2 observation station, you must turn around. There is a 1000 foot long boulder wall beyond, with a number of No Trespass signs. If you stray, you will be on  private property and damaging vulnerable flora and interfering with wild life that the owners are feeding and encouraging. Please respect the flora and fauna and turn back to Duncan's Cove. Yuu'll be surprised at the new things you see on the trip back to where you started!", 'Very nice trail, a good work out !', 'Beautiful views and great terrain...definitely one of my favorites! :-)']

['good stuff. a little rough through the ash lake trail, but overall a solid hike! more of a workout which I enjoy.', 'great trail, well marked with maps - lookout is awesome, lake is totally swimmable !', 'Awesome trail. ', 'Was good. Mosquitoes are starting.', 'great trail enjoyed it very much with Ashley...did a bit of bush waking and went around Charlie lake and back to the can was a great trip for after work ...

', 'Good woods walk near the city, nice narrow walking trails well marked. Too busy people wise for me but not so bad when you venture farther out,, but i did go on a holiday, so what was i thinking. ', "so beautiful as always, and even with all the thawing it wasn't too muddy, and the few muddy places were easy to get around by going slightly off trail.", 'Amazing', 'Another lovely hike in this area, but the scattered sunlight had made the trodden paths very icy, so grabbing branches and walking on roots and granite were the only ways to stay upright.

Great trail, good condition.', "the trails aren't marked all that well. there are a decent amount of 'you are here signs' but not much for tags along the trails.
cute little spot with a bridge at the end of hobson lake", 'was an awesome hike. lots of everything from easy sections to hard. And beautiful views. But I would recommend using GPS as alot of the trail markers and signs  have been torn down.', 'Not a park, this is a wilderness area. Please wear blaze so hunters can see you!! Enjoy :)', 'Beautiful trail. Really varied in views with the lake and option to head up to the look off (well worth it). Some areas are not well marked. We veered off the path a few times as we were following ribbon marked trees. Had to rely on the app a number of times to right our course. Would come back now that we are more familiar with the trail. Areas closer to the parking lot were busy. Once you get into the deeper sections it was very peaceful. ', 'The trail has lots of up and down and roots/rocks. Really pretty views from a look off, and nice sections along water. The trail isn’t well marked. We saw a few other groups once we got back on trail that had the same issues. All in all it was a nice hike and would go back, I’m just glad we started early enough that we had time to take a wrong turn before losing daylight. ', 'Gorgeous multi-loop hiking trail minutes from Bayers lake. Lots of tree roots and was quite muddy and wet. Recommend wearing waterproof hiking boots. We went on a fall afternoon. ', 'Lots of stumps and rocks on the terrain.  Wear solid footwear.   Nice view of lakes but mostly inland.  Solid walk.  Keep an eye on gps as you can get turned around easily.  We detoured to the look off and it was worth view.  Beautiful right here in the middle of the city.', '
', 'This trail ended up taking us 4 hours and 40 minutes because we lost the trail around Ash Lake and ended up having to back track on the loop. ', 'Loved this trail! Great variety, not busy (only saw 5 people and 2 dogs on a Friday afternoon), Great Lake views. Will return. Would recommend wearing hiking boots and pants. My dog loved it too, especially swimming in the lakes. ', 'Nice trail, dog friendly. The east side around Ash Lake is pretty overgrown so wear long pants and use tick spray. Easy trail but wear good footwear, lots of rocks and such.', 'Super nice trail, a couple nice lookoffs, not super hard to follow, although there is a misleading map sign (marked as 25, actually 15?) pretty sweet overall', 'Did this three times. In the winter it was extremely hard to follow, couldn’t really tell what was a path 
In the spring it was extremely wet.
Did it again a week ago and it was dry, easy to follow because of the foliage. It also has maps along the trail which makes this trail easy to follow', 'Awesome trail, didnt do the whole thing, stopped somewhere along fox lake with a great view and camped a couple nights. Very nice trail! Would go again', 'Great trail with nice lakes for the dog. We encountered very little traffic, a couple others with dogs and a few fishermen. 

The section after you travelled all the way around the lake and reconnect to the previous trail portion is currently very muddy. Recommend going right to the fox trail to return to Collins. It’s fun to go over all the logs through the mud but the dog needed a good swim to get clean. 

Trail conditions were great otherwise.', 'Great day for hiking. The trail was in good condition, a little muddy in spots. There was a nice breeze but if you stopped, the black flies were there in full force! Picked up a few geocaches along the way. ', 'nice spot for an adventure, only downfall the black flies were really bad bring some bug spray!', 'Following the description of the trail it took us 3hrs at a moderate pace. There were times the trail was not well marked and we had to double back a bit. Views of the lake were there but most of the trail is in the woods. Take bug spray!!!! ', "Unfortunately this trail is not marked very well at all! If it wasn't for our GPS we'd still be in there. All it would take is for someone to tie some orange ribbons to mark the way. We won't be doing this one again :(", 'Beautiful trail in fall with autumn colours. Easier to find the trail going in clockwise direction. In lots of places the trail disappears and flagging is needed. AllTrails app and data was essential for staying on track. But lovely trail for a moderately challenging hike. ', 'Completed this last weekend. Great condition, awesome hike!', "I started at the end of Collin rd took the wrong path and instantly was lost luckily I ended up on a scenic route to Charlie's lake which was lovely! Made it back to the fox lake trail and really enjoyed the unique hike to the fox lake look off, which was gorgeous! very rocky, rooty and can be steep. definitly not for small children. ", 'If you start the trail via Fox Lake, becareful at marker 28. There are two paths, and the wrong one is marked with hiking markers. the actual path is not clear.', 'Rocky in some areas, but what NS trails aren’t?! Haha. Great swimming spot in Fox Lake, perfect depth for jumping in. Brought pool noodles and floated around for hours ', 'Absolutely awesome trail with beautiful views of the lakes. Very rugged and rocky at some sections', 'Tried to run it, but rocks & roots made it slow going. The trail is quite overgrown in some places. No mud when I did it.', 'This trail could be tricky. Easy to loose the path as few trails around. Muddy after rain. Liked it but nothing super special. ', 'More of a trail conditions update than a review, only a couple of muddy spots and they’re easily bypassed. Bugs were present but not horrible, probably caught the last of the black fly season.', 'Great hike. Can get busy on weekends. Good place for dogs. can get a bit swampy after rain', 'There was a bit of ice on the trail in the beginning, but overall condition is good with rare muddy places.', 'Tried this for first time - completely hard packed ice.  Not possible without crampoms.', 'I went after a big rain so it was a little soupy close to the lakes but someone had put down logs to walk across in most parts and even made a makeshift bridge out of fallen branches. I recommend going for sure, more of a moderate to easy hike and the trail is well walked on and easy to follow', 'Really enjoyed this trail. Especially the look off.', 'Hiked this trail May 2018 enjoyed it very much.', 'Some newly felled trees across trail on West side of Ash Lake, otherwise in great shape this spring.', "Nice in the fall. Ash Lake is quiet and lovely. It's really good to record and compare with the map as the trails can be a little faint at times. There are tapes and paint at tricky spots though plus some signs. I didn't go the Hobson's Lake route but picked a different way in and back.", 'Favourite', 'I was happy to see tags - its early in the season so parts of the trail were a bit hard to find - overall a great trail! I would certainly do it again :)', "Once you leave the Hobson's Lake Trail, you are more likely to see a canoe or kayak then another hiker.  As a result, the Ash Lake loop offers a great opportunity to empty your mind and just enjoy the day.", "Great backwoods wilderness trail that is relatively close(10-15min) outside of downtown Halifax.  The Ash Lake part of the hike is not as well trodden but is still fairly well marked with ribbons on the trees. Took me about 2:20 to complete. You can also just do the Hobson's Lake Trail which takes about 1:15 for a quick but satisfying one."]

['Great trail, muddy in spots and a little hard to find the entrance but we eventually made it', 'After a couple days of rain, this trail was wet and a bit muddy but well worth every soaked foot we got ! Absolutely stunning scenery and pretty easy going along the rocky and marshy paths. If there was a way to give more than five stars, THIS trail would definitely warrant it !', 'Great trail. Note: covers very rocky beach and requires some up and down over boulders. Should have good technical walking ability and ability to scrabble up and down. Lots of great ocean views!', 'Very nice trail! Great day to do it! A few wet spots but will hike again', 'Rainy day hike and picnic to celebrate our 30th anniversary', 'what a beautiful trail!  the views are stunning. my husband likes to sketch and I hike the trail.  you can see boats and fisherman frequently. it can be muddy at times. ', 'Nice scenic trail. Bit over grown in places. We walked the road a ways to make it a loop. Not sure I’d recommend that. The trail from the road back to the main trail was on private property and petered out at the end and was quite overgrown. But was pretty, just better as an out and back trail or with two vehicles.', 'New favourite!! Beautiful views', 'Beautiful views from the trail. After 1.5km the trail is overgrown so we decided to turn back.', 'Best shore trail yet this year. Moderate rating but not onerous. Seems popular and the scenic views explain that. ', 'dog friendly nice little coastal walk! GPS can take you to wrong location but it’s super close by. Nice ocean views', 'Lovely coastal hike!!! A bit if scrambling over the rocks in places but that was by choice. Some muddy spots but with the planks of wood you can avoid the mud or walk around on the edge of it. Started the trail from Hages Lane and walked down to the other starting point. Lot of beautiful spots for photos. If you love the ocean and costal hiking be sure to include this one on your to-do list.  ', 'great.. bit soggy!', 'Really great trail! For those who might want to pick the length of their hike  walk out to the half way mark and walk back the whole way is gonna be magical', "Wet windy weekday, not another soul. Great trail but dress in waterproof pants or prepare to get thoroughly soaked from the brush. Watch the slick rocks, of course this wouldn't be as much of a problem if it's a drier day!", 'Beautiful trail, not too busy either! Wear shoes you don’t mind getting wet and long pants, the trail is pretty overgrown in some spots. ', 'Beautiful oceanside out and back trial. Pretty easy walking, just a bit muddy in spots.', 'awesome hike. Beautiful coastal scenery', 'Great trail, beautiful coastal scenery, moderate in difficulty, muddy in some parts (hiking shoes help lots vs sneakers). Not too busy on the trail today.', 'Nice trail. Easy walking. But lots of up and downs and great views even in the fog.', 'Awesome trail!', 'Great, but busy day on the trail!', "Very nice views of the ocean, and it's not hard to walk either, just bring boots as parts the trail can get pretty muddy.  ", 'A beautiful trail with rewarding views the entire way. It’s relatively flat too. There’s not many people there but the ones who were had the friendliest dogs. 

About 2/2.5 hours there and back with a snack break. Make sure to put Dr Bill Freedman Nature Reserve into your Google maps to get there', 'Lovely views
', 'Loved this hike!! Incredible views, easy to moderate terrain. A little bit of mud and small area of marshy wet land, but for the most part narrow path and rocks on the beach. Would recommend wearing hiking pants or thick jeans, as there are areas of walking between thorn bushes. Almost the entire hike is coastal, so pack layers as it was chilly when we arrived around 11am but warmed up through the hike. Definitely recommend this one! ', 'Lovely hike', "This was one beautiful moment after another. It was a lovely evening and really lucked out with the weather for mid April. Definitely a few muddy spots but nothing that we couldn't get around.  This trail is not marked at all and there are multiple little paths you could take. I was grateful for the app for the first little bit, not knowing where all the little trails went. It seems that no matter which path you are on, they continue to meet back up so just pick the less muddy route! It was simply beautiful walking the coast the whole trail. ", 'Lovely trail along the hills adjacent to the water near Prospect Village. Watch your footing and dodge some boggy patches but all on all a great walk.', 'Good rugged ramble over the rocks on a breezy spring day', 'High Head trail needs more love. I don’t know how this was my first time hiking it. You’re walking by the water the entire time basically. The views were great and I was accompanied by a sweet girl to top it off. Recommend to all friends', 'I absolutely enjoyed the coastal views here. If you enjoy coastal hiking then this trail is worth exploring. It’s best to go on warm days, anytime from early Spring to early Summer.', 'Great little out and back along the coast! ', 'Really great coastal and grassy paths. Lots to look at and easy to be away from other people. Waterproof hikers a must !', 'The trail is great, very easy to follow and no ice or snow now.  It was a very windy day, but the scenery was fantastic.', 'hiking along the shore on rough well traveled trail with beautiful views both inland and offshore.  hiking boots recommended.

loop back along road or backtrack.', 'Definitely one of my new favourites! Little busy, but beautiful coastal views. Clear path but rocky and a bit icy.', 'Pretty day and the ocean was showing off.', 'Beautiful views, easy trail to follow. 
', 'Trail as advertised, beautiful panoramic views of bay and ocean.', 'Good hike, stayed more to the rocks along the water. Nice views, quite windy! ', 'This hike as some pretty awesome views and some windy shores! The trail is well travelled and the sights are gorgeous! It even leads you to the town! ', 'Gorgeous hike along panoramic coastal views. Saw a seal bobbing along the water close to shore. Had a picnic lunch perched on one of the many beautiful granite boulders. ', 'Absolutely stunning views.  Some high grass areas that the path gets tight to walk through.  ', 'Wow. Stunning. ', 'Nice views. A bit overgrown and uneven. I suggest wearing longer pants and sturdy shoes.
', 'Loved it!  Great sea views without crowds!', 'Did it with my dog on a sunny Tuesday afternoon and only saw 2 other hikers and a few people fishing. Beautiful views. Not marked but easy to follow. Many parts of the trail are overgrown and you’re walking through tall grass, etc so if you’re concerned about ticks I’d wear long pants. Several geocaches out there. ', 'July 2020. Prospect, Nova Scotia. Coastal trail along the shoreline. View of ocean, boats and seabirds. Rocky and dirt paths, some mud, some overgrowth (waist high bushes but path still visible). Mostly low level vegetation, very open, no shade. Busy during sunset near start of trail. ', 'Just a warning that I did this trail last Sunday with my dog and she came home with 10+ porcupine quills in the side of her face.  Also very overgrown and bushy trail - would recommend pants and hiking boots. ', 'Enjoyed a hot sunny day hiking this trail with friends (in our 50s 60s) for about 2 hours.  The views are spectacular and the hike fairly easy for all levels of ability.  There are a few boggy spots but some kind people have placed boards across for easier access.  There are beautiful flowers and what looks to be blue berries and maybe cranberries.   The following is a warning of another hiker with her huge black dog.   The dog was coming towards us and we asked her to call it back.  She didn't.  We asked again.  "please call your dog we're afraid of it".  She got closer and the dog was around us.  I asked could you please get your dog can't you see someone here is terrified.  She then went off saying "the dog's FINE" and now she's angry at us "IT'S AN OFF LEASH PARK".  I said listen we've asked you politely can't you just get your dog?  Then she said "it's got a muzzle"  and she walked off.  The dog didn't do anything to us I need to make that clear.  But as a dog owner when someone is terrified of dogs they don't know and you ask polity for them to call their dog back could you just be kind and considerate... I know most are.  So be warned of the older woman "Karen" (not the dog) ', 'Great trail! I didn’t have the best weather and couldn’t see much because of fog but am definitely planning to return!', 'Easy trail to hike. Beaches are rocky and unstable under foot but you can stay on the paths. Amazing views and lots of vegetation for enthusiasts. Take pole and fish for mackerel or just breath the air and relax along the shore. ', 'Terrific trail. Plenty of rocks to climb, beach to comb, or stick to the trail and enjoy the view. Plan to visit at sunset. Best sunset view in Nova Scotia from the rocks. Amazing! ', 'Awesome hike with beautiful views of the ocean. Easy, well worn path that is flat and very walkable for kids.', 'A fun easy trail .  takes 1.5hrs 1 way at a slow pace, with lots of coastal views. ', 'Great trail. Beautiful scenic view. One of best spot to watch sunset in the city. ', 'Great trail. Wet in places. The wind can be strong off the water. The views are incredible.  Can choose well travelled foot path or rock hop along the shore.', 'Great trail took the dogs out for a few hours. Sunny weather 16 degrees but glad we brought jackets with hoods due to the wind.', 'This is such an amazing trail. It’s very open and you can go off trail to the rocks to look at the ocean. View is amazing.', 'Beautiful brisk day', 'great scenery a lovely hike', 'Perfect hike for a sunny fall day! Lots of rocks and some roots so sturdy shoes are recommended. You are by the ocean most of the way so the views are amazing. Fairly level so a nice level hike. ', 'Hiked this beautiful spot on a Sunday and it was not too busy! Gorgeous rocks and trails to explore. Trail was muddy in places but well worth the trip. ', 'I loved this coastal trail! It was a beautiful view of the Atlantic almost the entire way — and was relatively flat! It’s nice and short too. ', 'Mid to late august has some wild blackberries! Bring pants for high grass.', "Very easy to find, and pictures can't compare to seeing this place in person. It's a little muddy for the first part of the trail if you park at the cul-de-sac (depending on time of year). The views are beautiful and you can see the seals laying on a rock island. ", 'My daughter and I walked this trail this afternoon with our Labrador retriever.  It is a gem. 

It is rough and wet in spots   However we have had a very wet spring so far this year.

It was arguably the nicest day we have had in 2019 thus far and today is a Sunday.  Hardly anyone was there!  

The three of us enjoyed the moderately difficult hike, the lack of flies, the low number of people and the gorgeous views. ', 'A lovely little hike to beautiful Prospect.  But beware if it has rained recently, it is very very boggy on the trail so wear appropriate footwear. Rocky underfoot as well. Alternatively, tide permitting you could walk over the rocks which woukd make easier going if boggy. I parked at Hages Lane turning circle walked to Prospect 4.4km and looped back 4.7km along the road as i was pushed for time and tramping back across the bogs is time consuming watching where you put your feet. It is windy on this coastline when the mist is in so wrap up in layers. Also spotted some birds and ducks along the way. ', 'Beautiful coastal hike. Winds off the ocean keep things cool so dress accordingly. We did not encounter any other hikers this time of year. The exposed trail was wind swept with snow built up in crevices (sometimes knee deep). Exceptional scenery. Be prepared and bring water and food. There was some water we had to navigate as streams were flowing from melt water and rain. We hiked from Prospect Village along the coastal trail and looped back on the road to our truck. Total distance covered was 8.8km.', "I lived in Prospect Village for years and just love the area. It's just beautiful in all seasons. Hiking is especially pleasant in summer. The trail is often cool due to wind off the water and fog. Layers are highly recommended,as well as sunblock and a good tied on hat...wind and sun can be strong. Getting close to the water can be dangerous. Be wary of waves and dark, slippy rocks. The tide can come in quickly. Beautiful spot to visit.", 'Great views. Suggest to take two vehicles and park at each end so you don’t have to double back.', 'Absolutely gorgeous views but you need to watch your feet as the trail can be rocky or soft. Very easy to twist an ankle. And yes sometimes it can be tricky to find the path. This is NOT private land. It’s a conservation area and the trail is maintained. Wonderful rocky points to climb and sit. Saw people fishing off them. Beautiful spots to watch the sunset.  No services and there’s no easy way to return to your car.  So plan to hike back. I went three times during my week in the area. A hidden gem b', 'Great trail for hikers of all levels. The end of the trail is a beautiful lookout and is spectacular to see, especially for somewhere so close to the city. Make sure to keep to the left when you start out on the trail as it can be easy to get off the main trail veering ever so slightly right and you’ll get into some thick brush.', 'Great hike, beautiful views. Recommend good hiking boots if you want to explore too far the terrain is very rocky.', 'the prospect high head trail is  on private property please do not use it and please pass the word to go somewhere else']

['Nice trail good work for trail running. Nice diverse forest on the way up and then more open grassy spots up top. Coastal lookout of shore island and Cabot trail was nice.', 'Très belle randonnée peu fréquenté, vues époustouflantes. Un joyau très bien gardé.', "Great hike and spectacular views! Loved the climb up walking on the brook, definitely bears and moose around, didn't see any but lots of evidence. So worth the trip and highly recommend if the weather is clear", 'great hike and views. watch out for bear poop.', 'There are 2 trails heads by the National Park Information Centre. As soon as you turn on the road to the info centre, if you look left, you’ll see a large sign. If you are behind the info centre by the Adirondack chairs, look across the road and you will see it. 
We took the other one. Park at the top of the parking lot away from the info centre and walk straight past the campground for a few minutes. 
This is a very strenuous hike. I recommend counter clockwise. The first 20 minutes is an unrelenting steep incline, but the other way is even harder. You do get nice views of the mountain range on your right. Once you get up that initial kilometre or so, it’s more sane with a mix of up & down with a lovely, babbling brook beside you. Then the last kilometre or so is up, up and up to the top. You’ll know when you’re at the top when the trees thin out and you see an eagle or two. You come around the turn and start heading along the other side of the trail but it is still a little way before you get to the red Adirondack chair. There’s the chair and a bench to rest and take in the great views. And there’s an even better view when you get back on the main trail. Then a little ways down, they’ve built a deck with some great views. 
The walk down is steep and your thighs will be burning. Bring plenty of water. They sell it at the info centre. ', 'Great hike.  Clockwise had quite the climb but worth it.  3 to 4 km of climbing.  Hiking with 2 dogs so glad we brought a lot of water as no water sources on the way up.  Near the top were wild blueberries so stopped to pick.  The descent was great along the creek and the dogs loved the water.', 'Wide trail. Really rocky. Great views half way through. Lots of jagged and loose rocks on the way down.', 'Great trail. The views from the look out points are worth it!', 'Excellent.', 'Very beautiful and easy going', 'Not an easy hike but had nice views! First few kilometres are the most difficult.', 'The Acadian is steep trail with awesome views and is well worth the struggle', 'Beehives trail is very difficult and danger!', 'Third time here, beautiful as always! A little easier if you go counter clockwise but just as pretty no matter which way you go!', 'We loved this trail! Did last weekend after a lot of rain. The coastal side was pretty clear, not much snow. The interior side along the Brook was quite snowy in parts. Really beautiful views, good incline. Was very windy that day, we did the coastal side first so the wind was at our backs and it was lovely. Lots of downed trees on the coastal side, and LOTS of moose poop, and tracks. Both really fresh. At times we thought for sure we were following him. Didn’t see one unfortunately, but he was definitely around! ', 'Beauty day to be out. Bring snowshoes. Path isn’t marked very well and we had to break trail so the map helped when we were unsure. Follow the river and you should be alright. Stick to the right so you come down with the views. Lots of Moose poop and hair but no Moose sightings! Maybe next time.', 'Really great trail to gain appreciation for the rugged beauty of the Highlands.  I was snowshoeing and the trail was suitable. Less travelled and not many trail markers on the eastern loop (back side) so I did loose the trail for a bit.   Which makes it fun!  I followed a fresh moose track (seriously fresh) through the snow and she seemed to lead me back to the trail. Thanks moose!', 'Beautiful!
', 'Amazing hike.', 'Go left at beginning fork as you will be rewarded with the views. Great and quiet trail. Saw an easy dozen snakes sunning on the way up. Coming down through the brook-side in the Acadian forest is an emerald green mossy change from the sunny uphill hike in through some Boreal. 
', 'Amazing loop, shaded on the way up.. amazing views on the way down. I recommend going up on the right side and looping back to get the views.', 'Great trail with a lot of elevation changes and views. 

Did it clockwise and saw the most beautiful view of Cheticamp and the ocean from the top of the mountain. Coming back you hike along a heavily shaded river.', 'Great trail with two very different forests/fauna that you’ll encounter. Definitely recommend clockwise! I have hiked this trail two other times, both times completing it counter-clockwise, and now that I’ve done it clockwise, I can’t imagine why we ever did it the other way! 
The way up, there are a few steepish hills, but nothing too challenging for someone with average to good cardio fitness (hills aren’t my forte!). Also on the way up, you will encounter SO much moose scat and a few spots of bear scat. I actually did this hike alone this time, and I admit, I was a little nervous. There are many berry patches and open bushy areas on the ascent, that I imagine would be pure heaven for bears. But I didn’t see any think more animated than a squirrel with a leaf in his mouth, peering at me in fascination, from behind a tree trunk. It could be I was the only person he saw, as there was NO ONE else on the trail with me the entire time. It was eerily quiet- other than my loud singing and yogi bear calls, to ward off furry company.
The view was uninspiring, ONLY because it was foggy - not the trail’s fault - my bad for picking a foggy day. Other times that I have done this trail, the views are out of this world - so I do recommend going on a cool, clear day, if you are looking for the best vistas. 
The entire way down, you will feel as if you are stepping through a rain forest but without the humidity, and the stream at your side is so zen-like. Something out of a movie, truly. It looks so different than the trail on the way up - much greener and more lush - like completely different trails that have been merged. A few bridge planks are a bit slippery, so watch your footing, and there’s only one muddy area to traverse. So very easy in that sense.
Great hike, overall! But I highly recommend having a hiking buddy for this one, just for safety sake. Also cell phone service is there almost all the time, but there are a few quick spots where you’ll have no service. Walk a few steps and it will return. Just be aware. 

', 'Absolutely beautiful - including all the lookouts, my Fitbit actually calculated around 11 kms; however, the entire hike only took us about 2.5 hours. Very few breaks - just to catch our breath and keep going! I second the reviews that say to do this in clockwise motion, as you’ll appreciate the shade of the latter half. :) ', 'We saw so many moose droppings we thought we might actually see a moose! Great hike. We went clockwise and would recommend doing it that way. It was hot and buggy going up, though coastal views were beautiful. Coming down along the water was so nice and cool. Fewer bugs and lush, beautiful landscape.', 'This hike is on the difficult side and is hard on your feet. Good, comfortable shoes should be worn. It took about 3.5 hours to complete with all look offs and breaks included.', "Hiked 06/2020. I'd say path conditions were roughly the same as the Franey trail in terms of uphill walking difficulty and the changes from rocky-grass-gravel. Lookouts are gorgeous but some of the signs were down so we just went down the little paths", 'Hiked 11/4/19. Great trail. It provides a variety of terrain and views: birch forests, areas of dense fir trees, tranquil mossy rock stream, followed by wind battered barren trees and grass trail with great overlooks of the gulf, We hiked counterclockwise late in the day, which created wonderful light for the overlook portion. We finished in just over 2 hours, hiking at a rapid pace to beat the dark. We saw woodpeckers and chipmunks, not a single other person at this late point in the season. ', 'One of the better trails in the National Park area of Cape Breton for sure. The west side of the loop is where you’ll see great views of the Cheticamp area and a number of scenic lookouts, while the east side takes you along a gentle brook in a more wooded setting. Pick which order you think you’d like to see it in, or you can do an out and back of the west side if all you want is views. I went with the woods first (counterclockwise) and it seemed like the way up the hill may have been a bit less steep that way, although either way is a gradual climb and isn’t anything super strenuous, and either way the views are worth it.', 'Challenging incline and superb views. We saw 2 moose at the very top - very very worth it. On the way down we followed the river back to the carpark. One of our favourite hikes in Cape Breton. ', 'We loved this hike, we went clockwise although it seemed most people went counter, we enjoyed it very much. The look offs were amazing and the trail that follows the river was challenging and enjoyable. ', 'Very nice hike and quite a good workout. Lots of different sceneries, likes many different hikes all bundled into one.', 'Skill level: Intro/Beginner
Difficulty: 7.6/10
Done in Early July
Enjoyed it thoroughly. We did the hike by going up the mountain (so you get peeks of the glorious view as you climb upwards) and then finished going by the brook. We preferred it that was as it was relaxing coming down. The day we went winds were at least 80km/hr so be weary of that. It was a stunning hike and one of our favs at Cabot Trail', 'The trail is beautiful!  Unfortunately the day we went was very rainy and foggy so the reward at the top was non existent.', "it's a hard hike, but the view is worth it :)", "Nous avons fait la randonnée en sens inverse de ce qui est proposé, c'est à dire en montant du côté où il n'y a pas de points de vues et en redescendant du côté des points de vues. Ce fut vraiment un bon choix à mon avis puisque presque tout le long de la montée, on longe une petite rivière et on marche au son de ses petites cascades. C'était rafraîchissant.", 'Fun little 2 hour hike. Well worth a quick stop if driving by while doing the Cabot Trail.', 'Belle vue à mi-parcour', 'Loved this trail! Hiked it just before sunset. The views were incredible and the terrain was not too challenging. Pretty magical place overall. We went up near the brook and down the other side. The trail is well marked. Hiked this much more quickly than expected but are experienced hikers. There is an outhouse part of the way up which is a bonus. ', 'Beautiful views, pretty low traffic on a Tuesday afternoon. As others have said, the south face (left hand trail) is definitely easier going. We took the south face down and saw a moose antler.  You can get a kids activity guide (similar to the US Jr. Ranger program) at the visitor center.', 'Great trail. Saw a moose. No bears. Diverse views and foliage!', 'This is just an amazing hike! The trail is very pretty and the views are breathtaking! And its not a really hard trail! I’ve worked more for less!', 'Have done this twice and loved it. Not for the inexperienced. Great views at the top, a lovely stream on one side, and nice scenery all along the way. Keep kids and dogs close as some parts are very narrow with a steep and dangerous drop off.', 'This was a beautiful hike with stunning views. All uphill if you keep to the left. If you go right, it’s easier going but you will punish your knees on the decent. If you’re an occasional hiker this trail isn’t for you. 
Again, loved every step. 
Note. Trail ended up at 10.9km all said and done. 
Loved it!', 'A great trail!  We started up on the western trail, which is a little steeper.  But completely doable.  Of course we saw tons of other hikers, but we had a number of nice chats when we stopped to rest, usually at the scenic overlooks.  We were able to see all the destruction caused by the moose, as well as the very different areas of the forrest.  We very much enjoyed the views of the coast, and the stroll along the creek.', 'Did the full loop but AllTrails did not record the path accurately.  Health app recorded 8.7km for this one.', 'Take a left when u ascend. This section of the trail is gravel and dirt with benches along the way and a number of excellent look out points. The last two look outs have the best view of Chéticamp village and the Island. U can choose to go back down the same way or do the loop. If u do the loop, be mindful the conditions of the interior trail is rocky and many sections also muddy because it runs along a brook. U will see a number of small waterfalls. We saw a large black bear on our way up. He was on the trail and we observed him from a distance and waited for him to move out before continued.', 'Gorgeous! Challenging to get up the mountain, but definitely worth the hike!', 'Personally, we loved the variety of this trail.', 'Great views, and a thrilling ascent. I wish I was back there.', 'Amazing view from lookouts']

['Great early fall walk', 'beautiful views!!  you can make the hike longer if you add the side trails. we saw hikers of all levels on this trail however be footing and mud can be tricky at times. go on a weekday or early if on a weekend because parking can get busy ', 'Absolutely stunning views. The trail is not marked well - you can pick your path, which we considered great.', 'interpretive/free form and so pretty! ', 'Radical
', 'excellent trail.
', 'Foggy and windy but still perfect if you love to be near the ocean.
', 'Very scenic and many unmarked paths along the coast, low lying ares are quite wet and muddy. ', "Trail itself was great both trails. Beautiful views.  Alot of dog shit bags along the bath though. Well better in a bad then on your foot I guess. Also first time ever I found tics. But it's the season. ", "This trail was beautiful, well marked, easy to find and had lots of different terrain. whether it's rocky, grassy, bushy, or even more woodsy. lovely views and lots of space to walk around without meeting up with anyone. ", 'Always my favourite and worth the trek—rain or shine, no matter what season. ', 'Great for rock hopping, can get close to the water and get great exercise! Gorgeous all seasons. ', 'Beautiful. Heaven on earth. ', 'The main trail is easy to see, but is quite short. This location is perfect for those who like to get off the beaten path. We roamed around for about 2 hours (4km) on rock, in mud, over limbs and up and down! The views were amazing and we easily could have spent the day there! (It was extremely windy and the waves were huge!) No strollers, would be difficult with a baby/ child carrier on, no small children in my opinion for anything but the main path. Loved it and will be taking family and friends for sure! ', 'Fairly short trail, a little marshy in some areas but overall in good condition. Stunning views!', 'Decent hike - unclear trails and quite a few mushy spots but worth the view if you’re out Peggy’s Cove area', 'Pretty marshy if you’re going after a big rain, but beautiful and engaging.', 'Stunning!', 'Great walk and very much a choose your own adventure! Some great views of the sea all the way round', 'Great hike! Tons of sights to see and paths to explore. There didn’t seem to be one way but instead, many! ', 'One of my favourites. Is a bit of a “choose your own adventure” in terms of navigating the trail, but I like that. Love walking on the big rocks and beautiful views of the ocean. ', 'Cool rocks and beautiful ocean views, but confusing to navigate.', 'Should have picked a less windy day and different shoes - can’t wait to go back!', 'Must visit!', 'First time on the trail and it is a bit confusing, so I wandered around quite a bit but it was all lovely. some fun scrambling if you take side paths. Polly cove and the surrounding tide pools are wonderful at low tide.', 'Perfect destination when you want coastal views and do not have a lot of time. Popular one too!', "Good location for kids, beautifu Peggy's-esque open ocean and granite boulder landscape. High traffic. Can be colder with wind, bring a windbreaker. ", 'It’s a beautiful hike with great scenery but. Little confusing to navigate. No trail markers at all. The path is easy to see most of the time but we did go down a couple of wrong paths and scratched our heads a few times. There are two trailheads off the parking lot. One leads to the long trail and the following the other you can get to the high ground with the picnic table and scenic views in about 15-20 minutes. ', 'Amazing trail! My 5 year old son is on his way to becoming an expert hiker. He was thrilled with this trail, and only needed some assistance. ', 'Awesome trail with fabulous ocean views']

['dead whale. wet trail. 
', 'The first part is a well-traveled private road: walkers welcome, but respect the homeowner’s privacy.

The second part is a very challenging trail through puddles, rocks, roots, and bushes. The ocean view is nice, and the trail does indeed exist, but it’s not accomodating. There’s also a rope closing off the trail where I stopped - whether it’s a warning, a limit, or a prank is outside my knowledge.', 'Started by the beach - great trail. Easy to follow the blue painted dots. It became very hard to follow after about 4-5k. Would have been lost without the app. The last 3-4 k was very muddy in places and very very overgrown. The last photo shows what the trail looked like near the end. Good hike just a little uncertain at times as to where to go.', 'Beautiful, but very outgrown, especially the last 25%.', "first part of the trail was well marked,
 but the back trail, well thank God for All Trails or I wouldn't have found the trail at times.  Very overgrow and quite muddy.", "do the trail counter clockwise so you get the views and the wind at the last half of the hike.   I loved loved this hike. it had everything in it.  my husband said it's a 3 start trail because of the mud and narrow parts on the west part. I thought that was fun.  ", 'Beautiful views, definitely would recommend going out and back starting from the parking lot (trail near the beach/bathrooms) instead of the loop. The last 3-4km coming back down the loop (clockwise) was muddy, overgrown in spots and buggy, mostly in the woods so not much to see anyway. Otherwise a nice not too difficult hike, and great views. Although the description here says there’s a waterfall but I didn’t see one and can’t really imagine where one would be on the trail.', 'muddy and rocky at times. 1st half was well marked and stunning views. 2nd half was rough in parts of the trail on the cliff were slippery and sections eroded with no markers. it was easy to get lost.', 'I love this trail but it is really wet and muddy in a lot of places. If you’re hiking be ready to get wet. Running same thing. Crossing some wet spots what seem to be good foot holds only turn out to be wet shoe traps. Can’t wait for it to dry a bit.', 'The trail was very scenic, took a lot of cool photos of the coastline along the east side. The ground was very wet but I was wearing waterproof hiking shoes which helped a lot. I attempted the west side on the return and ended up turning around and coming back the east side, it was kind of bushy and I wasn’t into it.', 'It had beautiful scenery all along the trail. There was at times were did the trail go due to sections not used so much or I did not see as many markings on the west side. I had clock 12kms back to the parking lot with doing all along the coast trail.', 'Lots of horse flies today on back part of trail', 'Do not recommend anyone taking the spine trail back to the parking lot…. It is extremely wet/soggy at this point in time with potentially 1 ft of water and no alternative areas to use. Stick to the shoreline.', 'Going clockwise from parking lot the first 6.5 km is amazing. Great views and not overly technical. Last 3.5 km is just in tree line along coast and you are fighting mud bogs the whole way which slows you down and is not quite as fun. Overall a great hike.', 'Beautiful trail however be prepared if you do the entire loop that is is muddy and a bit tricky to find the trail when going from coastline into the wooded trail. The second part (when going clockwise) was the muddiest. If you want to avoid big mud puddles, especially with a dog, then simply do this trail out and back from the point as it was in much better shape than the last part on the west side. ', 'Really beautiful trail, the trail markings end about halfway through but it’s fairly easy to navigate.  Extremely muddy in places even on a dry day. ', 'Great trail with fantastic views.
