Very easy to follow. A bit boggy in spots, good shoes recommended', 'Gorgeous views and hike! muddy this time of the year, and have to follow spray painted rocks at some points to stay on trail. Over all loved it! Took us 3 hours to do the whole loop and will definitely do it again! ', "Definitely a relaxing hike for the first half - completing the loop was an accomplishment but I wouldn't do it again, would just stick to the trail from the beach to the Point.", 'Very nice hike fairly easy to navigate although the second half of the loop isn’t blazed. 
', "It took 2.5 hours for thr two of us to walk this trail. We loved the coastal views, variety of ecological conditions and the beauty of being in nature. A fellow hiker pointed out a smooth green snake that was the most exquisite shade of green and apparently quite rare. Sadly I did get a nasty blister but it didn't spoil the hike.", 'One of my favourite trails. Very muddy and messy this time of year. Some parts of the trail are hard to find if you do the whole loop and aren’t using a map. Beautiful trail but so much garbage along the interior and coastal parts of the trail where there isn’t much traffic. If that’s something you care about, I’d recommend bringing in a couple of garbage bags and taking some out with you. Just took out a couple of bags today and will bring more next time.', 'Muddy in spots but great once you get past the beach and away from the crowds.', 'Great hike, Some muddy patches so keep that in mind. Great views and wasn’t packed with people (great with the current covid numbers) ', 'Super muddy on the interior trail sections so wear proper footwear.  Otherwise a great hike', 'Trail is marked pretty clearly with some light blue spray paint on the rocks. A few dead end trails break off the main trail and it became a bit harder to follow just before reaching east pennant. 

Overall a really great trail. Dress for the conditions! ', 'Beautiful ocean views. Big crashing waves. Muddy and fun overall!', 'Front half (coming from Crystal Crescent Provincial Park) is great. There are blue spray paint markings on rocks to follow. The back half is much less marked, so I ended up turning around and backtracking. 

There are some challenging sections where poles would’ve been useful, but I did fine without them. ', 'Fantastic Day!', 'Beautiful but challenging hike. There were tons of boggy spots due to recent rain and snow melt, so good hiking boots are a must. Lots of washed out areas on the west side of the trail so be careful. We did the trail counterclockwise and we’re glad we got the terrible wet boggy areas on the central and western parts of the loop over with early, or else it would have been a yucky way to end the hike. Lots of stunning views - would hike again. If you don’t have all day then stick to the eastern trails, the best views are there.', 'Trail was good, although there were times it was hard to follow. Some beautiful views along the way. Took longer than expected but worth it.', 'great trail, easy to follow with great ocean views. good foot wear is needed. 
', 'Happy we went counter clockwise and that we did it in winter. The small trails would be tight with all the shrubs. Beautiful views !!!', 'A bit of a challenging hike. Took us longer than expected. Some beautiful views along the way and the sound of the waves was soothing. Given the time of year with a lot of snow having melted, it was quite muddy in some spots. Decent hiking boots are important. The app helped keep us on track. Not well marked in some places. Blue dots painted on many rocks along first half of trail (we went counter clockwise). If you’re up for a good (but not easy!) hike and have hours to kill, this is a good one! Note: we parked close to the locked gate, along the road where there are obvious “no parking” signs and we did get a ticket. It’s unfortunate that so many trail parking lots are closed off at this time of year. ', 'Beautiful trail! We loved it. However there are a few sections where we had to figure out where the trail was. We went on February 5 and it was very muddy as we had a lot of rain and a few warm days. ', 'Trail was very difficult to follow as it comes out of the woods on the east side. The snow has blown over the trail and made large snow drifts', 'Wonderful hike. Great views. We did the hike clockwise. Very clearly marked until about 7-8k along. At that point, we could not see how to continue and there were no markers. It was very wet so I guess the trail was covered with water? We backtracked and started to head back the way we came. We ended up doing the trail that is up from the water and it is WET right now.  I definitely recommend this hike but would not do the in-land trail.  Keep ocean side. ', 'I did the trail counter-clockwise Nov 22, 2020. It was a very enjoyable experience at a few degrees above freezing. Quite different temperatures whether in the trees or out on the rocks in the wind. Some very rugged rock hopping and some muddy and boggy areas also. Very enjoyable overall.', 'Beautiful nearly every step of the way. A little tricky when water is on the trail, but nothing strenuous.', 'Same as everyone else has said about conditions!! Amazing views throughout definitely one I will do again', 'Good hike! Will echo a couple of the comments below with the gorgeous views, especially on the east side. The west side of the trail is not as well marked and I did find myself off it a couple of times. Because it’s along the coast it was easy to get back on. Muddy areas so boots are best, and pants for sure, especially for the last stretch across back to the parking lot! Also the gate is now closed for the season so you need to park close to the road and walk in and through the parking lot to access the trail. ', 'Good trail, the west slide of the loop was very muddy and over grown and not well marked. Very beautiful though and the beach is a bonus!!! ', 'Easy hike, gorgeous ocean views. Took me 3 hours including a long lunch stop. Went at 8:30 on a Saturday morning and had the trail to myself. Only one bit of the path was a little washed out but I found the trail again without too much trouble.', 'Nice easy run. Enjoy doing this one when I don’t feel like a long run or after I’ve done the Bluff a couple of days in a row.', 'Beautiful hike! So many spots where it just opens up and the views are amazing. 

Overgrown in a lot of spots. Thank god I was wearing pants or my legs would be pretty torn up. App was needed to navigate some of the trails as they are overgrown and there are some places that look like trail that are not. 

Barely saw any other people. Very cool to stand on the rocks and hear the water and then keep walking to the utter silence of the woods. Well worth the overgrown parts! ', 'Great trail!  Some amazing views!  Definitely needed the app for navigation!', 'Wet in the usual spots after the rain.', 'Great easy run along the coast. Wet in some spots near the end. But not major.', 'I hiked counter clockwise, as a lot of people suggested below. Really enjoyed the first half of the hike, mixture of woods and coastal. Saw very few people on a Friday afternoon, only big crowds once I reached the beach. Trail is overgrown, wet and soggy at some places. ', 'Whoa! I had no idea this great adventure was only mere steps past the nude beach! 

Walked this trail last month and loved it! Beautiful coastal views similar to Taylor Head and Pollys Cove. I found the last half of the trail to be a bit sketchy (I went clockwise) because it’s a bit grown in and not well marked but it was still fun. 

Near the last bit in the open fields I ran into a hawk mama who was not very excited about me being there. She chased and swooped for a little bit- I made sure to face her direction, yell, and put my backpack above my head and it was fine. Thinking she must of had some fresh lil babies! 

Also on the last half my gps kept telling me I was in Lunenburg? If this happens don’t worry, you haven’t mysteriously been transported to Lunenburg... not that I thought that or anything... 


Also! I encourage you to look up the Indigenous histories and presents of the land you’re hiking on. Think about what it means as settlers to use this unceded Mi’kmaq land for pleasure.', 'A great trail. Recommend going anti clockwise so that you go through the ever so slightly overgrown and humid section first, and cool off with the sea breeze and views along the second half. 

Well but subtly marked along the length of the trail. The map on here is reliable too.

Some hopping between rocks is necessary, and a few patches will be quite muddy outside of summer. ', 'Great trail.  Beautiful views of the ocean, large open fields.   Did this mid summer and still muddy spots but manageable.  ', 'Great trail! Single track not too technical for trail running. But you need to pay attention to the trail ... ground trail is easy to follow but quite overgrown with ferns and such at eye level.', 'Unreal trail and views. Probably one of the best coastal trails in HRM. Follow the blue marks on the ground to stay on the trail. Some overgrown and muddy spots. ', 'Started going cross country from beach and hiking counterclockwise. That was a good decision. Some overgrown areas. Wear long pants if hiking the complete loop. Had some technical difficulty with recording but it’s about 10k in total. Still a bit muddy in spots. Is the seal rock just nature’s art?! Amazing! Not many bugs at all and it was a humid drizzly day. A real gem of a trail in NS.', 'Hiked the East Pennant Point trail today. (July 19) 10.5km, 20300 steps in 4 hours. We started at the green dot at the top and took screen shot when 1/2 way (blue dot). Great trail, wet in places, watch the footing and roots, few deer flies other then that no bugs, so this is a good time of year to walk it. Great views. Places to sit and enjoy the views. I would suggest walking the top barren woods across to the bay part first because it may be a hot run and very tiring at the end. 
Expect some nudity in place to in passerby’s as you getting closer to the third beach. ', 'The hike was pretty awesome in the beginning. Got nice views and Fresh ocean breeze. But half of the trail is not well maintained and got really narrow overgrown paths. Remember to take mosquito repellent cream and water', 'Completed this hike today starting from the beach end to the point and up the far side of the point and through the woods/barrens back to the parking lot.

The trail past the beaches and to the point is fairly well marked but it is so open that it is impossible to get lost. Beautiful scenic ocean views along the way. It is fairly busy as the trail to this point is not difficult so it is an attraction for those who are not hardcore hikers. Most of them however, hike to the point and turn around and return the way they came.

Continuing past the point the crowd thins out immensely. About half of the far side is similar to the hike to the point. The trail is not marked as well but it is so open that you cannot get lost. There are several spots where high tide could create an issue with a dry passage. 

The second half of the far side winds into the woods along the shore peaking out once in a while to the ocean shoreline but really never goes far into the woods. This leg of the trail is much more challenging with rocks, roots and mud. The trail is not marked but is very obvious so again getting lost is not a worry. 

The last bit of the backside cuts straight accross the point back to the parking lots. Half of this is through the woods and half of it is through barren plains. Low bushes with spots of pine trees poking up. 

I would recommend sturdy and waterproof boots with ankle support, especially if you plan to complete the loop. The backside is where these are needed in particular. 

Over all its a great hike with beautiful views. I completed it in roughly 2.5 hours and that was with several rest/snack stops. 

', 'Trail was great, especially for this time of year. Definitely some mud to run into that may slow ya down but easy to get around. Great time overall. 

Ps. Be careful with off leash dogs. Was warned of porcupines.', 'Beautiful views! very muddy & wet portions of the trail. Expect to throw sneakers in the wash. ', 'Great trail. Bit muddy. I started counterclockwise which i preferred as first 1k of trail is meh. ', 'Very wet and muddy but not impassible doing the loop, and no flies!', 'Awesome hike around the point then up to army shack', 'One of my most favourite trails. Easily navigated with sweeping ocean views and sounds of waves crashing the entire way. Enjoy some beach time when done!! Highly recommend.', 'Worst trial.', "Gorgeous trail, but as others have said, the last portion of the trail is very challenging in terms of getting lost due to overgrowth, lack of markings and lack of trail maintenance. Best time to hike this one is in the spring before everything blooms and obstructs the view of the trail. First time I did this trail in the summer I had to do a lot of bushwacking. In the spring I didn't get lost at all. Definitely a worthwhile trail with gorgeous views.", 'Great hike! Beautiful colours. A few downed trees in the way and a lot of muck in certain sections. ', 'Trail is hard to follow, must get out by dark', 'Beautiful first half. Back half hard to follow and swampy in places. Lots of wild blueberry.', 'This is a beautiful trail.  However the back half of the trail is muddy and not well maintained.  Recommend turning back at the marsh section.   Back half is poorly marked as well.', 'A bit more challenging then I anticipated. But a fantastic hike.  Trail tough to follow at times. App kept me on route.  A must do again!', 'lovely first half starting from the public beach followed the spray painted blue rocks, got about 6km down and found the rock with a smiley....should have been a sign to turn around! the path pretty much disappears for 2km and I was scambling around on rocks right on the water, pretty dangerous. for sure wear long pants and boots with ankle support.', 'Absolutely Loved this trail! We went August 3rd, 2019 as a family, two boys 7 and 10 and my hubby. Took us about 4 hours stopping for lunch, pictures and a few water breaks. There weren’t  really much muddy spots because of the dry weather a few grown in spots, we all wore shorts and we’re fine. Such a piece of paradise!', "Visited on July 31st 2019. Had no trouble staying on the path until about half way around the loop, couldn't find the trail and doubled back. We went clockwise, starting at the beach and past the nude beach! It was foggy but beautiful scenery and ocean mist/spray along the way. Didnt find it too boggy or wet as it's been very hot with little rain lately. My 6 month old puppy had no trouble on our route. Bring your bathing suit for a swim at Crystal Crescent Beach afterwards!", 'Great trail. Loved every minute of it. Great views. Good photo opportunity. Some parts could be muddy. A must visit when in the area. ', 'Beautiful trail with lots of interesting rock formations and stunning ocean views. Still some mud and bog but drying up a bit with the lovely weather.', 'if you are traveling and do not have access to spare hiking shoes/boots i do not recommend doing the western half of the loop... its too wet and muddy... 
i followed the trail clockwise, going along the eastern shoreline...when i got to the southern most part i thought to myself "maybe i should just double back."   this trail is a spectacular out and back trail... would have been a 5 if id chosen to do that but alas i chose to do the loop...the western half was "meh"... in comparison... ', 'Amazing views along the coast. Trail was very muddy and there was a small stream we had to cross, so be prepared to get your shoes wet. Make sure to keep your dog on a leash; I spotted some porcupines right by the trail.', 'I do not recommend completing the loop unless you’re looking to get wet and muddy. Stay on the ocean side as the in land portion of the trail is extremely muddy at this time. Trail is well marked for the most part ', 'I would recommend this trail to hikers of all ages especially those looking for dog friendly trails. It starts off with a gravel trail that strings along the coastline. The path turns into a semi wooded semi bluff trail around the point. The views are breathtaking and the sound of the ocean brings a rhythmic calm to the hike. It’s a good idea to bring extra socks and shoes for the drive home. There are quite a few spots along the trail that are very wet and muddy. Also along the hike there are thorny bushes, might be a good idea to wear long pants if it isn’t too hot out. I wore capris and I walked away with a dozen scratches on my calves. It was super helpful to have the blue spray painted markers to help keep you on the right path. All in all a beautiful hike, I will definitely visit again! ', 'Loved it, muddy at times bit I picked a rainy day so no complaints. Beautiful views, trail and amazing energy ', 'Nice hike around the point and back on the pennant harbor side. Few bouys washed up on the shore !', 'First half ( beach side) is well marked with blue paint. Transition to the second part of the trail was hard to find. Lots of wet parts on the trail, definitely wear hiking boots, not meant for sneakers. Great view of the ocean and beautiful beaches.', 'Hiked south along the Pennant Harbour side to Pennant Point, returned north across the centre of the peninsula.', 'Awesome hike. Views were spectacular!', 'Really ended hike at start point at 3.5 hours...just forgot to stop recording. ', 'A fun trail with nice views. Keep to the spray painted blue markers to find the trail for most of the way. Be prepared for anything though: mud, rocks, boulders, bogs, overgrown trails...and nudists :/ 
Took me just under 4 hours with a couple stops.', 'Fantastic views on this trail for the most part. It took me 4.5 hours to complete the whole trail. For last 1 hour or so there was a lot of bushwacking involved and there was some mud. Despite that I would definitely recommend checking out this trail.', 'Just walked to the point and back - absolutely spectacular!', 'Kniiy', 'Difficult to find some paths. I made a route of my own along paths. I enjoyed it.', 'Good trail. I’ll be back again.', "Great trail. If you start on the beach someone has spray painted blue squares to help guide you to the point. After the point those squares are gone and it can be hard to find the trail at times and may require some bushwacking. 
Phenomenal coastal views and if you go past the point not many people do so you'll enjoy some solitude. Definitely on the top hikes list.", 'Nice scenery and a great trail.  Only loses a star because the marking of the route is not always clear so someone might get easily lost.  Great fun and definitely recommend!', 'Took about 4 hours to complete 10km hike.  My favorite trial☺️', 'Nice trail along a spectacular seashore. Soggy at times but nothing one cannot navigate around. The part that overlaps with the Crystal Crescent beach trail is easier to follow and equally beautiful. To avoid overgrowth and sogginess go to the tip of the peninsula and back. Amazing views ...highly recommended.', 'Very nice hike though easy to get turned around the trail is not marked in a lot of places.', 'Wish I had read the other reviewers comments prior to leaving on this trip as I struggled to find a route at the tip. 

This trail would be much easier to travel in a counter clockwise direction... the trail markers are sporadic blue dots painted on rocks, but are very difficult to spot travelling clockwise.

All in all was a lovely hike, despite the bog being incredibly wet from the rain. I will be trying this one again in the future!', "Great loop trail with fantastic atlantic coastal scenery. Trail can become a bit absent in a couple parts, one notably by the large salt water pond near the tip, in which you'll pick up the trail again on the other side by either traversing the rocks on the ocean side or thru the tall grass on the other side of the pond, which could be a bit wet depending on the season. Also if you're doing the trail CCW, the trailhead is not marked with anything but a couple rocks just before it so this is where a previous gps track might help."]

['Great stroll, gorgeous view and great for children and elderly! Barely anybody there in September!', 'Absolutely gorgeous! The trails were well maintained, got some amazing pictures, and even saw 2 moose!', "Really easy to do! It's more like a walk. Once you reach the point where it is a loop, the left side brings you faster to the main viewpoint. Once you get there, there's a lot of stairs down to be closer to the main view.", 'More of a long walk rather than a hike. It is a really popular trail so if you are looking for peace and quiet this is not the trail for you. Sad to see lots of people going off the boardwalk when lots of signs saying not to do so. Someone also brought their dog when there are lots of posted signs at the trailhead saying dogs not allowed. Great view at the top but I’m not sure if it’s any different from what I’ve already seen from the lookoffs or from other hikes. Would still recommend.', 'Beauty trail.  Nice easy walk with unbeatable views.  Busy trail but everyone is very respectful.  A must do when visiting Cabot Trail', 'Very well maintained trail. Highly trafficked trail ', 'Great trail, that is relatively flat and shaded in some parts. A few lookouts and then the boardwalk at the end that overlooks the famous Cabot Trail. There were washrooms in the parking lot and half way through the trail. Didn’t see any wildlife and passed probably over 100 people just on my way in and the same going back. There were Parks Canada employees in the parking lot writing tickets for no/expired passes - make sure you have a pass or you will have to go to the kiosk to buy one anyways, or be billed $150 at the end of the season. This is a trail you absolutely must do if you’re on the island. ', 'We did the loop counter clockwise. You aren’t missing much if you do the direct hike, left at the fork, to the view, but we enjoyed the full loop. Perfect for all ages… it’s more of a stroll than a hike.', 'Super easy trail. Very maintained. Do not bring your dog, as pet owners were being turned away. I found it quite busy, but with the views you are faced with, I can see why. I recommend for all ages. "It's a walk in the park". ', 'Great walk/hike to the look off spot. The best views of coastal Cape Breton we saw all trip. Lots of stairs down and up : ) A “must do” trail if you’re in the area. And we saw a moose and it’s baby!', 'Great trail. Easy to walk, little to no bugs. Bathrooms at both ends. Father-in-law is 85 and we did the return trip in 4 hours. ', 'Easy trail. Well maintained, beautiful views along the way. Easy and level terrain. Beautiful view of the ocean at the end. Outhouses along way. We only had time for the short trail so we made it to the viewing point at 45 minutes (1.5 hours round trip). A grumpy bird (possibly a louse?) wouldn’t let us pass the trail assuming it had babies near by …. We had to jump over it and run hahaha made for a good story/memory of the trail. Will definitely be back and do the large trail next time ', 'The skyline is an every-year kind of trail! It’s busy, but easy enough for the whole family so that should be expected! It’s extra beautiful if you go at sunset!', 'Done this hike 2 days ago trail is clear from snow. We walked the groomed trail side so I am unsure what the other path may look like. ', 'Snow can be very deep so best with
 skis or snowshoes.', 'excellent views and a good chance to see a Moose!', 'Fantastic in the winter. Light snow. A little slippery. Only saw 4-5 other people. Gorgeous views. Very peaceful. One of Cape Breton’s great hikes. Very flat, maintained, gravel trail. ', 'Gravel trail that was easy to navigate. The stairs down to the platform and back up are challenging but worth the view. ', 'Well maintained trail, no roots or rocks to avoid. Boardwalk only starts near the end, the rest is tiny gravel. Great hike as expected!', "Don't do it during a windstorm.  ", 'Really good views, but REALLY crowded. More of a gentle walk rather than a hike.

The trail map on this app needs updating to reflect that you can do an 8k loop as well as out and back. ', 'Unfortunately, I picked a terrible day to go. 3 degrees, with excess wind, rain and hail. But I think given better weather, it would be amazing. The trail itself is a bit boring, but the views from the boardwalk are worth it! No moose to be seen today ', 'This trail was an easy and gorgeous trail to complete. Came up from the South Shore to check it out, and the view. It was absolutely stunning. I am so glad we did this. The upkeep was beautiful. There are uphill spots but I feel anyone can complete this. (: ', 'Excellent views. Easy to follow ', 'Great easy hike. Trail is a 10/10 for upkeep and maintenance. I have hiked this trail and the loop maybe ten or so times over the years. Very much a favourite. 

Please stay on the trail once you hit the boardwalk. There is a fragile ecosystem underfoot. We all need to respect our surroundings.

We saw a moose!', 'An easy trail with an epic payoff. ', 'Nothing particularly special about this trail apart from it being featured in the park brochure. ', 'Easy trail, wide and flat with outstanding views at the viewing platforms. Be sure to do the entire loop. ', 'This was a very enjoyable hike. As noted, it is crushed rock and boardwalk so nothing too strenuous but the views at the end of the boardwalk were stunning. And we saw 2 moose! Worth doing the full loop', 'Had the trail all to ourselves at 7:00am on the Monday of August long weekend. Great trail, mostly crushed rock and some boardwalk. No roots or rocks to stumble over. First 70% of the trail is lots of the same dense fauna undergrowth. Beautiful views at the end of the trail of picturesque cliffs and winding hills.', 'Super quick and easy if you just go straight to the boardwalk/skyline and back. Parking is usually pretty full but it is well worth the stop. Low effort for massive payoff with the amazing views!', 'one of the most rewarding views and hikes of my time spent in the highlands.', 'June 2019. Well kept trail, easy terrain with combination of crushed gravel and beaten grass, last portion is wooden boardwalk and many stairs (fragile vegetation signs to stay on boardwalk), leading to scenic views of Cabot Trail and ocean. Popular and crowded spot all times of day. This return trail is shaded, the loop is not. ', 'Rainy day with high winds but still a great hike!', 'Great trail! Easy path and walking and a great view at the end. Bring water and snacks! There are outhouses along the way.', 'Very easy walk along the wide pathways and boardwalks. The coastal view was spectacular and sunset was beautiful.', 'Gentle hike - gorgeous lookout!  ', 'Easy hike. Took the Sunset guided tour. Saw several moose along the way. Beautiful boreal forest. Spectacular view of the sun setting at the boardwalk.', 'I had read that it was a spectacular trail but didn’t really know why. Very easy, mostly level hike through alpine area with occasional short sections of boardwalks. A pleasant walk until you come to the end. But then from a sort of hidden platform the last few hundred meters is a boardwalk open to the sky and the hills and the sea way down there. On our way back late afternoon we came across a mother moose and her two adolescents feeding by the trail and waited very quietly in a little outlook spur until they wandered by and we continued on. Shortly after that we came across a male moose and made a much hastier retreat to that spur while it trotted by. Unforgettable!', 'Beaucoup de monde mais cela vaut quand même le coup !', 'A long walk in the forest in the beginning. But the view in the end is worth it. It’s a great place to watch sunset.', 'Great trail. Gravel path the entire way. Awesome trail for all abilities with a breathtaking view. This trail is best enjoyed at sunset as it looks west over the ocean. ', 'Nice trail - 4.5 stars.  In good condition.  We did the in and out and not the loop.  The view is good along the way but the last board walk section is what made the trail so famous.  This trail ideally should be done first thing in the morning or right before sunset since it is quite exposed.  Avoid doing it midday in sunny days.  

There is a view on the drive near the trail that actually offers a better view.  ', 'Loop is closed, in and out is open. Beautiful views but very very touristy.  The trail itself is very well groomed (with stone and boardwalk), flat and easy. ', 'schöner Trail, wenn auch leider sehr überlaufen. aber dennoch: Es lohnt sich. Teil des Trails ist zurzeit gesperrt.  ', 'Part of the loop is closed right now.', 'Walked this trail late morning and it was so busy! Lots of tourists - not your standard trail interactions (i.e. most people were not very friendly). Nice views. Lots of sun exposure (not a lot of shade). If I were to do it again I would do it in the early morning before the crowds come out or much later in the evening once people have left for the day. Very accessible trail until you reach the end and then there are stairs down. The loop was under construction/maintenance when we were there so it was not possible to walk the loop. ', 'Great short trail suitable for all fitness levels. Gravel slight decline for the majority of the trail until the board walk is reached. Be sure to close the moose gates behind you.

Skippable observation tower about 500 meters away from the boardwalk.

Went on a Tuesday, mid day, peak season and saw just under 100 people. Trail and scenic walk is large enough to accomadate at least triple that.', 'Pleasant, varied trail friendly to most ages and fitness.  Many people but not crowded or shopping mall in-the-ways.', 'Did this trail June 2018, got there for 8am and it was a beautiful, quiet hike.  Got to see a Moose sleeping nearby.  On the way back, which is at a slight incline for most the trail, I was sharing the trail with many, many people headed to the top.  With that said, the view from the top is indescribable and stunning. ', 'I’m a 50+ woman, not totally out of shape.  The trail goes to the boardwalk and back.  The part along the “edge” is closed.  Coming back up the stairs and up the incline almost the entire way back was taxing, but I kept up my pace.  Took me an hour and 40 minutes.', 'Like rush hour in NYC! The loop section and at least one of the overlooks were closed AND it was super crowded! We turned back after the first overlook which was nice but not super.  The trail itself is pleasant but the crowds felt overwhelming. Yesterday we hiked Acadian Trail - harder climb but much less traffic and stellar views.', 'Demi boucle fermée. Sentier touristique en gravier. Touristique. Pour la vue sur l’océan seulement.', "Easy trail with nice views, we did it in late May last year, a section of the trail was closed and the trail was very crowded which isn't our style.", 'longue marche mais pas de grosse pente donc facile a faire.la vue est incroyable rendu au bout', 'WINDY!

The day we went winds clocked 122km/h in town and were estimated at 140-160. 

As a result it was only physically possible to go about 1/3 of the way down the boardwalk. Surprised that the trail was not closed, to be honest.

Incredible views from the point we were able to get to and at the various lookouts along the way.

Partial weight bearing on forearm crutches, this trail  was accessible enough for those with similar mobility: a wide path, no roots or ruts, smooth dirt for the most part and the gentlest of inclines.

We didn’t see moose (though there were lots of tracks), a few garter snakes were basking in the sun on the trail.
', 'Great for a first visit. Have been multiple times; the easy terrain and well maintained trails make it great for any activity level on the loop or the out|back. But after a couple visits you are ready to move on to more exciting hikes, with better views, and less foot traffic. ', 'I liked this trail. It was easy and the views are beautiful. NS has a love hate relationship with moose. They killed them off, brought them back and still want to control where they go. I didn’t see any wildlife, and the walk is easy enough. I don’t think I would do the boardwalk again. It was crowded and can be seen from the top. ', "As the French say, 'Eh!' Not so grand. ", 'Must do trail.. the view of ocean is like a painting on a canvas.', 'The iconic trail of the Cape Breton Highlands National Park, The views are great (but they are beatable) and access is easy, great way to feel hike you are a real hiker without actually doing any real hiking. Tthis has, for many true hikers, ruined the trail.  Dogs are strictly not allowed on this trail, but people still bring them and let them shit everywhere, tourists just drop their garbage trailside and trample delicate foliage just to get a better photo.  The trail is overrun all summer.  Off season is better.', 'The views are unbeatable', 'Easy hike with beautiful sunsets', 'stroller friendly until the very last part which is the stairs leads to the outlook. great walk', 'excellent', 'Nice walk with a bit of wildlife along the way (moose and “hikers” with flip flops). Nice view at the end with a big descending boardwalk. A bit busy for my liking but a fun trip nonetheless.', 'The trail is in amazing shape, beautifully manicured and even has a bathroom in the middle.  We were unlucky and happened to be visiting when smoke from the west coast fires created a TON on haze and the sunset was completely blocked out by the haze.  

But...we did see a moose as we returned to the car.  We saw it  just to be east of the fenced in area (to keep out the moose).  I will post a picture.  The moose came way to close (for my liking), we were about 50 feet away as it galloped by, quite a treat!', 'Der Trail ist einfach zu laufen, nur die letzten Meter über die Stufen sind anstrengend, dafür ist die Aussicht grandios und es sind sehr viele Leute unterwegs', 'Saw a moose 10 feet away from the high traffic trail but the view at the end is absolutely gorgeous!!', 'really windy ! amazing views !! the juice is worth the squeeze.', 'As expected, spectacular views! Trail was an easy stroll. Saw families with strollers and flip flops. Had opportunity to pass through a Moose exclosure...be sure to close the gate behind you. Hiked this trail the day after we hiked the Franey trail. Wanted something easy. It was.', 'Absolutely stunning view! And it’s totally worth it to go off trail near the end to get to the point! Just be careful if it’s windy! Also saw a moose at the beginning of the trail!', 'The views to difficulty ratio on this hike is insane; for the amount of work you do, the views at the end are def worth it. The boardwalk at the end really makes you feel like you are part of the land scape. Would recommended', 'The view is something you cannot explain or understand from the pictures. This was an easy hike and was an amazing find!', 'beautifull view. but easy and sometimes croudy', 'I hiked this trail Saturday February 10, 2018 in the morning. I started around 8 am and it took about an hour to reach the end. There was a bit of snow at the beginning but none at the end. There was a lot of icy areas hidden with a dusting of snow. No animals were sited. I saw a few fresh coyotes and rabbits tracks on the path.', 'I hiked this morning, December 9, 2017. 
It was great.I had the whole Trail to myself.
I heard a Coyote howling from a distance. The Gulf of St. Lawrence was so calm that the Magdelan Islands that belong to Quebec 40+ miles away were visible. 
I was able to take 20 photos of the awesome view of the landscapes and one spruce grouse. 
I did see a rabbit go by but he was too fast for my camera.', "Très bien pour la partie où l'on a vue sur le cap"]

['Well marked and so pretty. Signs at start say the yellow return section is very hard but it isn’t: following the suggested AllTrails route is fine.', 'Beautiful Trail. Well Marked. Perfect spot for a picnic lunch ay the top. 
', 'Had a great family hike today - good for all ages/skill levels.  Be sure to bring water - it was a hot one on a sunny day!', 'Walking along the rails to trails before we got to main path was so beautiful. Its such a scenic walk. And once you get to the top there is such a wonderful view of all of Chester.  Would definitely recommend ', 'Absolutely lovely! Stunning views.
', 'Some reviews have said it is boring. While I agree that the first 3 Kim’s is all that exciting, there are a few bridges, Barry’s Brook, Labrador Lake and a bubbling brook. 
It’s all flat, even crusher dust, old trail bed until you come to the actual Castle Rock loop. Easy to spot where but once you get to the top of Labrador Lake, it’s right there. 
There are 3 trails, but the blue trail is just a shoot off the red trail. Red trail is a much slower, easier hike on an old logging trail. Some short steep parts. Its 1.5 Kms. The yellow trail is much steeper and more like traditional hiking, although it’s only 1.2 kms. We took the red trail up and yellow down. 
The trails are well marked. The marked red trail is off kilter with the app and you’ll get a off trail warning for the last 3rd. But follow the marked trail and not the app. You have to look around for the yellow trail head when you’re on top of the mountain, but it is down to the left. 
The views on a clear day are spectacular. You can see all the way to Smeltzer Brook Bay near where you start. 
Trail head is in a small parking lot. Easy to start in the wrong direction. Go toward the road. ', 'Nice look off.  Great spot to sit and enjoy the view.', 'Easy level and great view at Castle Rock in the end. I should have brought a bike for the connecting trail path. It is a bit boring before reaching the trail head. ', 'Nice trail…could have biked the first part then did the climb (there is a bike rack at the start of the climb) but walked the whole way. Easy to follow, a bit of a climb up the rocks at the end to reach Castle Rock…we took the red trail up and yellow down. Both were fine, yellow had more brush and tree roots vs gravel. Beautiful vista at the top! Happy Canada Day!', 'Nice easy trail.', 'nice trail, lots of roots and rocks on the yellow trail. we’ll marked. beautiful view at the top! would recommend it.', 'Lovely walk along the Rail trail - really interesting with a river/ lakes alongside. The actual Castle Rock hike is about 3 k - very clearly marked off the Rail trail. You can take one of three paths - we did yellow up and red down. Yellow was really nice through the woods - red was pretty boring - more of an access road feel. View from the top is fantastic!', 'We did the trail on a very hot day,no shade until we actually got to the Castle Rock hike.I would recommend a cooler day if you mind the heat.We choose to do the difficult trail to Castle Rock and we made out just fine.It was tricky in spots but so worth it.Once at the top the view was beautiful.Will do this hike again in the Fall.', 'Castle rock itself was great. Most of this is a leisurely walk along the Chester trail and not so much of a hike.', 'If you’re feeling adventurous, this is a great spot! The trail has some brooks, rocks and small bridges. The hike is an 8.3 km loop, and the lookout is definitely worth it!
We spent another 2 km exploring! 
', 'Such a beautiful lookout! Highly recommend.', 'A nice way to spend a day. I did the full loop, and trail was clearly marked. 
Only real views are when you arrive at the peak, but there is still lots to enjoy along the way. I would recommend this trail. ', 'awesome trail', 'Gets muddy in the woods, but the river made a nice place to clean up my very muddy Golden. Quite windy at the top. View was nice.', 'great hike!', 'Easy access. Starts on the Rails to Trails. Parking lot beside the East River wood mill or on the road.  Good markers. At the 3k mark go right to access Castle Rock. Great views. Hiked early March lots of icy patches but great nonetheless!', 'Love this trail but note that most of the trail is on the Rails to Trails. The trail is well marked for three levels of difficulty to scale up to the top of Castle rock. Beautiful views at the top! If you wanted to experience the hiking trail portion faster, you could mountain bike on the rails to trails and lock your bike up at the trail head. Think I will do this the next time! ', 'Great winter hike! When you hook onto the castle rock trail from the rails to trails there are three ways you can take to get to castle rock. Signage and well marked. ', 'Easy hike, short', 'Nice trail but with the ATVs it was really icy. ', 'nice trail .the views are amazing ', 'It was amazing, couldn’t have asked for a better day to hike up Castle Rock.', 'Lovely part of the Rails to trails and wonderful view on Castle Rock. So worth it!', 'Lovely view once you reach castle rock! The majority of the hike is on the rails to trails which is very flat and not very scenic.', ' Not sure if this trail is necessarily easy. The first 30 minutes to an hour are definitely easy, but once you reach the actual Castle Rock trail it can be a bit of a challenge. Majority of it is uphill and the terrain isn’t the flattest. 
Very scenic and quiet once you get uphill, though. However there are a TON of ATVs on this trail, which kind of ruin the peace and quiet of the place. Probably encountered more people on ATVs than people actually walking the trail.
The amount of ATVs also makes this trial difficult if you have dogs with you. A real shame.', 'good walk
', 'Great shape. Pretty dry.', 'I would rate this trail as moderate. Great 3hour hiking trail. The straight path is a good warmup and cool down, the blue path and yellow path forms a nice loop with stunning view on top of the hill. I would come every fall.', 'Lovely trail. Well marked. Sunny and shady spots. The steel parts are steep so not for themselves with knee issues but really lovely! ', 'lovely day. view diminished due to


 fog


', 'Amazing hike! The trail is perfect. Took the yellow trail up and it was difficult but satisfying once you got to the top. Lots of rocks and roots to pay attention to. Beautiful sunny day so the view was amazing! So worth it! ', 'Great trail! Went with a group of friends and we all found it equally challenging and beautiful. Great views from the top!', 'Not very exciting walk along the Rail Trail to the actual trail up (better for biking) but the trail thereafter was fun. As everyone has mentioned, the last bit is a scramble up but the view is lovely. A bit muddy on the yellow route when I went and I would say that some kind of hiking shoe/boot is a necessity. Lots of roots.', 'Muddy on parts of trail 1. We took trail 3 up and came back trail 1. Beautiful hike - but at the top you need to be slightly agile to climb the rocks. Fine for our lot, but could see others having trouble, especially if a bit older in years. The part where you’re walking on the trail is stunning. I live in the take to trails in at Margaret’s bay and couldn’t get over this part of it. Will definitely do it again. ', 'Super messed up my recording for this trail, but took us about 2.5 hours. Great trail. Easy to find, easy to access.', 'Great trail! Have been wanting to do this for awhile. Stunning views, however the bugs at the top were unreal even with a breeze. I feel like I couldn’t fully enjoy. I will definitely return in the fall. ', 'Beautiful views all along!
', 'absolutely beautiful for sunset and an easy walk out in the dark', 'Great walk/hike! Takes 3.2km to get start of castle rock and then another 1.5km up the hills. Labelled well. ', 'First time on this trail easy to find parking. Would advise running sneakers or hiking shoes. The flies were no joke even with spray and a little wind. Lots of ATVs and bikes in trail. ', 'Great hike for the family that offers a bit of a challenge for new hikers at the halfway mark.', 'Take the Chester connection trail till you get to the castle rock sign. Have good foot wear to climb the rock to the top! Beautiful view at the top! I got engaged there. Can’t wait to go back again! ', 'Did the yellow trail on a beautiful March day. Some ice in the shady areas, but easily navigated even with a 18 month old in a child carrier backpack.

Would definately recommend and I will be back in the fall!', 'Was a nice hike, I agree take the yellow trail. We had the summit to ourselves and only came across three other groups.', 'Make sure to take the yellow route one way, so worth it! ', "definitely a fun trail. suitable for beginners and more advanced hikers. just choose the final trail up to the Rock wisely. If you're going to take the yellow trail you're going to need good shoes and have some technical hiking ability, but the red or blue you should be able to walk up and just regular sneakers without any trouble. the 3 km into the actual ascents to the Rock are very easy gravel top and well-maintained. the views from the top or stunning and definitely worth it.", 'We parked near the highway at the start of the Chester connector trail. It is a well maintained gravel (stones) road. It’s not really my preference for hiking, but the scenery on both sides is pretty nice. Great views of the rivers and ponds. Once you reach the Castle Rock trail you can continue on a similar road (red route) or take the yellow route which is mainly in the woods. It is the best part of the hike in my opinion. It’s a lot of uphill, but worth it. The view from the top is pretty impressive.
We continued the hike by following the red route back out to the Chester connector trail. Again it is a loose stone road which is great for 4 wheelers and bikes but kinda boring for a hike. 
All in all, it’s a good hike. There is pretty scenery, and a great view from the top. I’ve done it a couple of times, and would do it again, but I probably won’t do the red route again. 
I think a thank you is in order to the folks who maintain this trail, it is obvious that they work hard to keep this multi use trail in such great shape and so accessible. 
Oh... don’t forget to bring bug spray. ', 'this is a beautiful hike.  the view is breathtaking at the top. We are going back in the fall when the leaves turn.  would recommend this hike.', 'Most of the trail in is well maintained. Once you make it to the loop it’s much rougher. You have three options to hike in; easy, moderate or hard. We took the hard route and I’m glad I had my hiking boots for that section. Absolutely stunning views at the top! Will definitely do it again.', 'Amazing scenery along the trail and from the top!', 'Beautiful Trail...I’d recommend ice cleats now at the end of March. Making the steep hill climb easier on ice. So much beauty for you to see.', 'Beautiful streams and a lake along the way, then a stunning finish.', 'Very nice view at the end. Worth the hike!', 'Fun hike with breathtaking views once you reach the top of the rock.', 'Beautiful view.', 'Great trail. Though there is a long portion along the old railway (Rum Runner trail) to get to the base of Castle Rock Mtn it follows along a picturesque creek, ponds and Labrador Lake. If you cycle the rail trail part there is a bike stand to lock up your bikes before doing the Castle Rock climb.

Note the parking location is not signed on Hwy 329 and access to it is right where the trail crosses 329 and looks like you will drive down the trail on the east side. But if you use this map it will help you locate it.', 'great trail with an amazing view at the end.', 'Nice easy hike but I only gave it 3 stars because 6k of 9k are on the rails to trails. Nice view of Mahone Bay when you get to the top of Castle Rock.', "Castle Rock Trails are accessed from the Chester Connection Trail.  There are currently three trails with varying degrees of difficulty and appropriate uses. Wayfinding posts are now in place and a trailhead kiosk is coming soon. There is parking in East River alongside the rail trail. Up to date information and a trail map is available from www.chester.ca.  This is a new property for the Municipality of Chester.  Your feedback is always welcome.  Enjoy everyone.  It's a lovely hike.", 'Gorgeous trail! Excellent for beginners, no mud at all, nice and flat. Definitely one of my favourites! ', 'The view from Castle Rock makes it all worthwhile. I did not enjoy the long walk along the Road. In the future I would walk in and out along the old rail line.', "Very easy hike - basically just walked back the tracks several kilometres (away from the ocean - closest to exit 7 but on highway 3. After a few kilometres along the flat tracks you see a little road to the right with a castle symbol on a small sign. As you go along, look for the yellow, red, or blue castle signs. Follow whichever one suits your difficulty level. None of them are overly difficult - I might recommend not taking your dog up the hardest/steepest trail and you have to walk up or down some rock face. Parts of the trails very very muddy - mud holes you had to try to get around. You scramble up the final section of castle rock. There's a Canadian flag at the top and the view of the Atlantic Ocean is beautiful. You can see for miles in all directions due to how high you are. This was an enjoyable hike and I would do it again."]

['Well marked and interesting trail, expect mud and challenging roots. Long stretches of beach walking on big loose rocks, ankle support a must.', 'New favourite! What a beautiful hike!', 'lovely. second time doing it. muddy in places. ', "Trail was great for a quick adventure. Be prepared for a little mud en route (leave the sneakers home). I prefer hikers for this trail. A few bugs but not too bad.  Poles aren't a bad idea either. Enjoy! ", 'Beautiful and the perfect cool temperature thanks to the breeze. A bit muddy in spots. We saw two porcupines, with one of them close enough that our dog could have been quilled if she was any more curious...', 'I’m not sure how so many people rated this 4 or 5 stars.  The weather is what gave this review one more star.  Make sure you wear pants or your legs get scratched up due to the “trail” being so overgrown.  There are sporadic markers but several areas where you can’t be sure where you are going.  Bugs weren’t too bad for the most part but bring spray.  Also, I can’t stress enough that you wear good quality hiking boots, preferably with as much ankle support as you can - it is rare to have sure footing.  Tons of muddy areas and washed out paths, even our dogs had some difficulty.  All in all, not worth it.  There are many other trails that give better hikes with better views.', 'awesome trail. Has everything from Sandy beach trail to heavy brush', 'Beautiful hike. Tough hiking though. Lots of mud, roots and rocks, but so very much worth it! ', 'Love this trail! Amazing views, multiple trail options, and lots to see. 

It was VERY wet. You definitely need hikers unless it’s been hot and dry for several days. There were a few sections that were nearly impassable with deep water. 

The signage is also terrible. It doesn’t look like they upkeep the trails much at all, especially the outer trail. 

Otherwise, wonderful experience!', "Amazing hike, great beach. trails are a but muddy, but that's normal for early June.", 'Beautiful day out, not too many people on the trail. Little little buggy and muddy in places but beautiful views of the ocean and great hike. It was slightly challenging and rocky in places￼ but overall not too hard', 'Doing the whole loop is 7.2km not 12km as the signage in the park suggests. Trail was fine, muddy and wet is some areas. Unfortunately trail is becoming wider in spots as people try to go around the muck. Beautiful beach too. ', 'Great trail nice and easy trail. Prob one of my favourite yet. It’s wet in places so good sturdy shoes are best. So nice as the fog rolled in.', "Gorgeous trail! I just did the Spry Bay loop today. The trail is quite muddy in places so wear boots you don't mind mucking up! IMPORTANT: please try to stay on the original trail as much as possible, even if it's muddy. A lot of people are walking around the muddy areas and destroying the flora on the sides of the trail, making it an even bigger, muddier mess. It's a trail, not a road, and let's keep it that way :)! Plus, getting muddy is part of what makes hiking so fun! ", 'This trail is challenging if it’s muddy, which was the day I went. Overall though, the trail is great. A good mix of woods and coastal walking, with great views all around. 

There’s plenty of wildlife to see, with some folks saying they see porcupines (I didn’t see any).

The park has a beautiful beach in addition to this great trail; all worth checking out!', 'Stunningly beautiful - magical forest - perfect day out ', 'I loved this hike. Gorgeous coastal views.  Terrain is really varied, part woods, shore, rocks, brush - really interesting. Lots of tree roots and rocks and small ups and downs. It rained really hard the day before so parts of the trail were quite muddy and soggy. Some of the sections by the shore were insane with seaweed flies but you could pass through pretty quickly. Option to cut the trail in half if you want and only do the red loop. Took us about 2.5 hours with a decent break at the look off at the half way mark on the point. Overall I loved this hike and will definitely go back again. ', 'Did the full loop today and it was beautiful! some parts that were washed out in the spring were much more passable   trail is well marked and was moderately busy.', 'Great hike, but be cautious of the wasps nest right around 44.790031, -62.544333', 'This is a wonderful trail, beautiful scenery. The path is well worn down, with the exception of the south side when the trail is on the rocks. Going clockwise, as suggested by others, is a good idea. ', 'This trail is great. There is an amazing beach and the views and scenery is awesome. ', "beautiful scenery on both sides of each loop! there's an option to do smaller loop, or the larger loop. the beaches are are beautiful & the 2 larger ones are near parking area.", 'I walked this at the beginning of the summer and I think about it all the time. So stunning, special, and super biodiverse. Very wet and boggy like a coastal area should be! There’s definitely a couple of sketchy spots that are not clearly marked, but I found it easy to get back on track when I veered off. Highly recommend going for a dip at the beach when you’re done ;) 


Also! I encourage you to look up the Indigenous histories and presents of the land you’re hiking on. Think about what it means as settlers to use this unceded Mi’kmaq land for pleasure. ', 'Well marked trail. Clearly walked and very popular. Rest area beach’s are rotted, not much of an issue. Scenic. 

Trail is lots of roots and little ups and down. Long stretches of loose beach rock to walk. Little mud but no major water holes. 

TIPS: Take poles! They helped a lot. Go right, end at the beach. Cool water on your bare feet after hiking was relaxing and refreshing. 
Suggest Norse Cove Camping, close by. Lots of amenities and hot showers. 

Happy Hiking!! ', 'Great place to hike with lots of views of the ocean.  Trail has lots of roots and rocks so good footwear will help. Start the hike to the left side of the loop.', 'One of the most beautiful places you can visit on this side of the province... Stunning views and charming trail ways! cannot wait to come back and explore more of Taylor Head!', "I did the Spry Bay loop yesterday which is the first part of this map and cutting across the tail in the middleish of the peninsula there. Such a nice hike even for a foggy day where views weren't much of an option. Seen lots of birds and some beautiful flowers. we stopped by the Beach before leaving too, beautiful beach!

FYI The four trails in the header are 4 separate trails totaling 21 kms, and only 2 are mapped here but the park has maps and is well marked throughout the trails.

", 'Awesome trail. Went on a foggy day in the high teens and it was perfect. Windy at the far point, but great views of the ocean, woods, and fields. Even saw a porcupine! Highly recommend.', 'trail had lots of fantastic views. 

there is brush along the trail so pants is suggested. there are some muddy parts but nothing unmanageable.  

some cool birds - no idea what they were. we did see a porcupine, so if you have a dog just be wary. he was right off the trail - our dog sniffed him out. 

completed the full loop with our 8 and 6 year old, they were able to keep up fine. ', 'One of the best trails in the province. Trail has been well maintained. Knee high brush along the way so pants recommended and some long stretches walking on beach rock. Amazing views the whole way. Relax and have a beach day when done.', 'Trail is well marked, in good shape and very scenic.  There are a few soggy places but nothing over the ankles.  ', 'So far I’ve only done the spry head loop but will definitely be coming back to do the headland trail. One of my favorite trails for scenery and breathtaking moments. ', 'Great trail. Lots of rocky scenic views. Trail goes by the water and its pretty entertaining the whole route. Start to the left.', 'Great, mildly challenging hike. Not very people on the trail, although it was a Tuesday. Nice and scenic. Did the full loop of 7.2km’s wouldn’t recommend to kids under 10. ['Great for a rainy day. Watched the eagle where the interpretation on eagles is. ', 'Great trail !', 'Beautiful trail with a nice wide walkway ', 'Beautiful easy way to get to Lawrencetown Beach!', 'One of the best trails. Very beautiful and highly recommend.', 'Absolutely incredible trail, and we are so lucky to have so many awesome options in NS. 

We started at Lawrencetown Beach - big parking lot and there are washrooms so you can pee before you venture out. We were biking, and we think this is a great way to do the trail, so you can end at the beach and take whatever time you want there and enjoy it.

The trail is nice and flat. There are lots of benches and some picnic tables along the way. There are no ATVs allowed, so the trail is in great shape and you don’t get a mouth full of dust every once in a while. 

The views are just incredible - marshes, water, birds, horses, bridges, dykes, flowers, trees, and more. 

We biked to the Bisset Road trailhead and back and took our time - I had my 2yo son on the bike with me, and we stopped numerous times to explore, hydrate, and have a picnic.

We can’t wait to go back. The route we took was a perfect amount of time and exercise for a late afternoon excursion and supper picnic, and we ended at the beach for some wave watching and smelling the salty air - always good for the soul.', 'Beautiful trail for biking. Highly recommended.', 'Such a great place to ride a bike! It was my first bike ride in YEARS but so beautiful. ", 'this is our favorite trail during the summer months. having water on both sides of the trail allows for a cool breeze during most of the walk. ', 'Once again, the app is stopping.', 'A nice short hike right along the Halifax waterfront - great spot for an afternoon of exploring heritage buildings and Atlantic coastline.', 'Beautiful trails and heritage buildings. Parts of this park are off-leash... some parts are no dogs allowed at all. Some are only on-leash - you have to watch your every move for little signs where the areas change. Are easy to miss. Beautiful views of the ocean/harbour and can even see York Redoubt and Dead Man’s Island from the park.', "Excellent trail system for the whole family in the heart of the city! ['Amazing area !!  Muddy on the upper trail near the old military ruins, and rocky but more spectacular near the shoreline,imo.
