Perfect ocean walk for a hot summer day.', 'Great trail, a bit hard to find the proper route to take once you get to the shore line - thank god for this app(many different trails all leading to roughly the same spot). It was pretty foggy and muddy in spots but me and my pooch made it work. We also didn’t go to the very end as the fog was thick and we were both tired from all the uneven rocks. Will go back(when clear skies). ', 'Nice views. Stopped before the end of the trail because I lost interest. Just because I haved lived here all of my life and "been there, done that"', "This is a top-shelf hike close to Halifax, with many beautiful views.  I've seen seals and dolphins regularly.  It's really a great hike to bring out-of-towers to show the beautiful NS coast. ", 'On this route there are a lot of private property signs.  Park on the one side of Gannet Ln then head down a lane way a few mins (lots of private property signs) in a bit you will see a sign that says trail and it will be on the right. If you continue you will head into a mansion!!  This is a great trail a few place that have deep crevices and bounding boulders and towering cliff side with amazing views. We saw sea lions and a cruse ship. There are 3 bunkers in all, two are set up on the hill. Don’t miss them!. If you stay more on the top side it’s very safe for dogs, however there are a few points that worry me a little but if they are on leash there shouldn’t be any issue. I really like getting into the cracks and crevasse and taking the hard way places however it’s as moderate hike on the trail. Choose your own adventure! ', "super cool. you can take water side for a rocky hike yet amazing view. you can take the side up the hill a bit for a more traditional trail home.  definitely make it to at least one bunker to experience a bit of history.  sturdy shoes recommended, not terrible but wouldn't suggest little kiddos or dogs for water side.", 'so beautiful!', 'great views & even saw grey seals out in the waves.', "Beautiful trail with spectacular views and great photo opportunities. AllTrails has it listed as easy, but I'd say it's moderate. There a lot of elevation changes and narrow, rocky paths that require a bit of climbing. The 1st portion is easy, but getting to the 2 points at Eastern Cove and Gill Cove is where it gets tricky. Wear good shoes!", 'Trail in good condition with some scrambling needed. Worth it for the views!', 'This trail offers spectacular coastal views. We were fortunate to see seals swimming just off the shore. Be aware, this trail is NOT easy even though it may appear so at the beginning with the first part being along a gravel road. Perfectly doable but it involves several significant rocky scrambles and considerable elevation change both up and down. Only a few short muddy/buggy patches left.', 'Beautiful day for this great hike. A favourite that we return to often. Parking can be tricky as is finding the trail head. Also the trail can be muddy as it was today. Well with it for the unparalleled views and proximity to the city', 'I’ve hiked this many times. One of my favourites. The trail can be a little muddy after rain.  Try to go on a clear day (no fog) to fully enjoy the scenery. ', 'Gorgeous! Saw seals, WWII bunker at the end. Beautiful crashing waves.', 'great hike in along the coast the whole way. hot day. b ut the breeze was very nice. trails a bit over grown but overall amazing views! ']

["A little narrow in spots, definitely wouldn't want to be out there in the rain, but the views were incredible", 'Trail was magical. Very difficult with lots of climbing and going back down. first hill is most intense. Definitely takes around 4 hours each way if you are packed to stay the night. Lots of rivers with drinkable clear water too! Kept a distance from the horses', 'Found a Fitbit there on August 29th. Please find me on Facebook and message me if it’s yours. I am happy I to mail it to you :)

Magical experience at Pollett’s Cove!', 'this place is magical would definitely recommend to any outdoors lovers

', 'Challenging hike but it’s totally worth it! What a cool spot. ', 'Easy to follow. Gorgeous views. Challenging terrain with lots of ascents and decents. Good mix of shade and sun. End is a spectacular cove and friendly horses. Reminder to everyone to pack out what you pack in...including toilet paper!', 'Absolutely beautiful hike!!! The views did not disappoint. Horses were friendly and the trail was dry. Beautiful beach to enjoy as well! 
We did the hike in one day with our two dogs. It was challenging with the elevation and we were tired by the end of it but absolutely doable in one day. Took about 2h10min to get there (7.25km) and then 2h20min back. 
', 'Long hike but worth it. The horses can be aggressive! ', 'Very difficult hike, be prepared to ask yourself “are we there yet?” several times  my partner and I are fit and we took much longer than expected to complete the hikes. Stay two nights, not one!!

Sadly, even though the hike is remote, “douche-bros” abound. A crew of dudes made the biggest bon fire they could, with as much of the driftwood as they could collect, and tried to burn beer cans and plastic ￼marijuana containers. I am so disappointed - the world is literally going to places like this to ESCAPE people like you, and lo, here you are, trashing this paradisiacal beach of biblical caliber. 

Makes me seethe that POSs are ruining every beautiful place in Nova Scotia.  That’s why I put 4 stars instead of 5. The destination is 5-stars, without question.', 'Amazing hike! So beautiful! It seems most people stay the night and I was worried about whether a day trip was possible. My partner and I decided to try it out and a day trip is totally doable. We left early in the morning and we were able to hangout with the horses/at the beach for 2.5 hours. Amazing views and warmer water for swimming. The hike would definitely be tough in wet conditions. We didn’t have much gear with us, just small day backpacks. The hike in took us 2 hours 10 mins, and we hiked back in 1 hour 45 mins. Back in Pleasant Bay by 2pm. My partner and I are quite active and intermediate hikers. ', 'One of the most beautiful hikes I have done. The first hill is long and tough but well worth it, the scenery is amazing, the horses are very tame and are a little aggressive when looking for food, a couple campers where woke by the horses as they tried to get into their tent for food early in the morning. I don’t think people on  this site need to be reminded to respect nature and pick up after themselves, but some people leave a lot behind.', 'horses are not wild btw! (but will eat your stuff hahah)

Trail can be very slippery when wet.

cove itself was decently full of campers our second day - around 12 other sites', 'Sublime montée de 471 marches. La vue au sommet est à couper le souffle. Au sommet, il y a encore des sentiers qui continuent sur les crêtes. Pas vue de baleine, mais si vous êtes dans la saison, super point d’observation. Un coup de cœur cette balade!', 'Humbling', "Echoing other comments, the first hill is absolute murder, especially with a full pack, but it's also truly the hardest part of the hike. Past that it's a very scenic trail with a descent into two valleys and constant views of the ocean - not easy, but it rewards you for your trouble.

The cove is incredible, lots of areas to explore and shelter for setting up camp - we left during rough weather (rain + 80km winds) and the hike back required lots of focus to not slip down steep inclines, be very careful when it's wet. Overall, the trail and location at the end makes this one of the best hikes I've ever done, can't reccomend enough.", 'Paulettes cove was amazing 
Me and my friend hiked it last Saturday we started at 610 in the morning and got there around 10. We took little breaks along the way.
We stayed Saturday night didn’t see the horses until Sunday morning 
It was amazing 
It reminded me of the movie “the beach” except everyone knew about this it was just Absolutely amazing￼ 109% I’ll do it again 
I wanna try and do it by myself for a few nights ', 'Narrow and bushy by parts, but passible ', 'Be prepared ', 'Lots of up and down steep hills and some walking through brush, but overall not too bad! There were a couple mucky spots and a river that we had to take our shoes off to cross, and some spots on the mountains that were narrow and rocky, but we took our dog with no problem! ', 'Absolutely amazing. The hike is hard but worth it.', 'Murder Hills but was awesome ', 'hi had an amazing exeperience last august nature at its pure form but had a very bad experience when we were camping at the base somebody
dumped 2 bag loads of garbage behind our tent while we were sleeping and had to burn them all as it was impossible to bring them back as already our backpacks where heavy.. please anyone heading out there please bring your garbage back...leave no plastics abd metals...respect nature', 'Four stars due to the insane increase in group campers. Seeing groups of 100+ travelling together to this secluded area, which is on private property, disheartens me greatly. 

Hype will be the death of many amazing things, unfortunately. 

The vast amount of trash left behind by hikers and campers is very disrespectful to the land, the animals the owners and to others who pack out everything they pack in, as all good hikers/campers know to be a written rule of the outdoors. I, and others for sure, am/are sick of seeing tissue and drink containers strewn throughout trees, grass, shrubs, the beach, the river and anywhere else. This goes for tents and camping gear as well. If your items fails you while there, take it with you rather than being lazy and leaving it behind. If you must use th washroom, dig a cat-hole and burry your waste. Have a garbage bag for tissues. Tie and take it with you when you leave. Many people assume tissue to be biodegradable but it does not dissolve in hours. It will hang around for long enough that it will be in the way of others. The animals should not have the chance to eat this and people should not have to avoid areas where hundreds of people have thrown used tissue. 

The scenery is amazing and the hike is great but the disrespect is unbelievable. PLEASE pllleassse be a respectful visitor before this land becomes inaccessible to everyone. ', 'Believe the hype. This place is absolutely breathtaking and worth every second of pain to get there. We are moderately experienced and average fitness, and this was a real challenge. It took 2.5 hours in, and 3 hours out. The terrain/elevation graph on here is well worth examining so you can get a sense of what lies ahead; there are many stretches that are unrelentingly steep with loose and uneven footing so knowing just how much longer you have to go on any particular stretch was a sanity-saver for me. Be aware that the trail is also one-person wide pretty much all the way, with steep hillside on one side. Tread carefully! On the outward journey, halfway in you descend into a river valley and this is a good place to rest, and refill water if you have filtration.  Things to take: hiking poles (or a good stick) are essential - trust me, you will need them. And take more water than you ever think you’ll need; my three-litre camel pack ran dry with about 40 mins return to go. And food, whether a packed lunch or a bunch of energy snacks, is a good idea. 

As for the Cove itself - absolutely STUNNING. Meadowlands, hillside, beach, forest, rocky headlands, with a river estuary splitting the beach in two. We spent 2 hours here and easily could’ve spent six more. Next time, we will definitely pack (lightly!) for an overnight. It would be magical!

The horses were the highlight. Friendly and inquisitive, we spent some time saying hi. A little later when we settled in for lunch the whole herd came running over in the hopes of food - not aggressive, at all, but a group of 1000 KG+ curious horses can be pretty intimidating! We had to move aside and watch as they trampled our stuff and ate what they could; at one point, I had to wrestle my day-pack from one of them who had it in its mouth! Fun, but be ready for them. 

The return is a killer, no bones about it. The descents on the outward route become the ascents of your return, and they can be brutal. By far the hardest part is the final return peak; that river valley I mentioned earlier? Yeah, you gotta climb out of that on your way back. It’s the last 90 minutes and after that climb the trail undulates steeply until the final descent to the trailhead. I imagine most people will be pushed hard by this part; us included!

Pack well, allow plenty of time if you think you need to take it slowly/take multiple rest breaks, and you will be rewarded with one of the best hikes in Cape Breton', 'awsome 
', "Hiked this trail today - loved it! Challenging, the views are spectacular, no concerns with losing the trail. The horses were not here for us to see but that didn't spoil the hike at all. Walking poles are a must. Didn't camp overnight; hiking in and out was very doable.", 'Just completed this trail last week.  Absolutely loved it for numerous reasons. Challenge, beauty, length all 5 stars.  It could be cleaned up a little but the destination is most certainly worth everything this trail throws at you.  BRING WALKING POLLS or find a good stick BEFORE you leave.  There are some that previous hikers leave but I would never take the chance again.  We left ours in the truck and decided to walk without.  BAD CHOICE!  The horses make it all perfect.  ', 'awesome challenging trail. its actually 18km in and back ', "Narrow, treacherous in spots,lots of up and down . Needs some grooming and hikers need to help keep trail cleaner. Moved to many ankle breakers and trip hazards going in and out .Don't walk over it ,move it if it looks sketchy . If you go down it's gonna be bad getting out.  Great hike ,not for the faint of heart. Pollets is a treasure.  ", 'I was a little worried about this trail since reviews really said how challenging it was. However, I found it much easier than they said. Took less than 5 hours round trip to do. We camped up in the trees as the wind was insane that night. No horses either :( ', 'Challenging hike but worth every minute. Unreal views, wildlife and camping area.  My favorite hike to date in NS. Some tricky footing, have good footwear. Water available at several points along the trail.', 'We hiked Polletts in July (in and out the same day), took us just over 6 hours.. 
Fell in love with this place, I have been on a lot of hikes, and this by far is my favorite... We loved it so much we went back this week , and stayed over night..It was awesome.
The hike is definitely challenging at times, but totally worth it.', 'Was there two weeks ago for the first time and went back a week later. Absolutely magical place. Definitely a bit challenging at times but worth it at the end. Great camping and hiking. Will be back for a third time and probably more', 'Great hike with lots of up and down hill and some water crossings. Private property so it is disheartening to see dozens of selfish hikers/campers leaving trash behind.', 'Loved this hike! Pollett’s Cove is paradise. I can’t wait to go back again and stay two nights instead of one.  The hike can be tricky at times with very steep drops. Having a walking stick really helped with the inclines and declines. I would not suggest doing this if it has rained or is calling for rain because it would be treacherous. ', 'Hot day being 33+ drank a lot of water out of the river', 'Awesome hike, one of the best I have experienced in NS to date. Going into the hike, my wife and I underestimated the amount of up and down hill. If you are planning to stay overnight - pack light! Also found that the distance is more like 7.5 to 8.0 km each way from the parking lot to the beach. Trail is narrow and rocky in places, but easily passable. Some areas overgrown, but only in a few spots. The majority of the hike is through wooded areas and relatively clear trails. The views and beach at the end were spectacular. Horses make it a pretty unique spot!', "Definitely will be staying multiple nights next time. By far the most challenging and rewarding hike I've done yet. Steep climbs and beautiful views. Seals and horses in the cove. A lot busier than expected, we stayed on a Monday night and there were four other groups. My girlfriend and I just got engaged on this hike so it will always be something special for us. Lots of water at the first river and the river in the cove to filter and drink, it's been very dry and they both were flowing well.", 'Stunning hike! ', 'A fantastic hike along the edge of land where the Cape Breton Highlands meets the Gulf of St Lawerence. Beautiful scenery and a very tough hike. Lots of vertical hiking keeps your heart rate high for sure. Beware of cow parsnip as it can give you severe burns. Wear long pants as there are raspberry and other bushes to hike through. There is a small river crossing at the halfway point. Easy to cross during the dry season, but a springtime crossing would be interesting. At the end when clear of the bush and walk out onto the elevated meadow heading down to the cove, a breath taking view. The beach, the meadow, the river and the horses!  ', 'An amazing hike and the cove itself is stunning with some great spots to camp. I went for the first time a few days back and spent Friday and Saturday night. During the day Saturday we went on a day hike, and returned to find that my new MEC tent had been completely trampled by the herd of wild horses. Poles were snapped, my fly was shredded, and the screening was ripped in several spots. DO NOT LEAVE YOUR TENT UNATTENDED. I wish someone had told me before hand. There was no food in the tent, it was stored elsewhere in a bear barrel. The horses are very de-sensitized and will bite out pieces of your tent so be prepared to set it up in one of the wooden enclosures and not leave it for long periods of time. ', 'Challanging hike with stuff for a 2 day stay but well worth it.
Such a peaceful and really magical place.
Beautiful horses but can be a little aggressive,  stomping tents, most campers built barriers with driftwood and rope which worked out fine.

', 'Great trail with lots of ups and downs. Muddy in some spots and slick, but not too bad. Someone had just gone through with a chainsaw so the blowdown has been cleared out quite a bit. Incredible views, both of the cliffs and the forest. ', "Very incredible view there. It's quite overgrown in some places and there are spiky bushes, so wear pants. The begining of the trail is the steepest climb you'll get on that trail. Horses are there at the end. Took 5 hours in and out. Good for a day hike. ", "An amazing experience I would totally be up to doing again! Hike is not for the faint of heart, and would recommend staying the evening in the cove. We did in|out same day - doable - but would have liked to enjoy more time. The brooks along the way are great for a refreshing splash and a drink. Tasty fresh raspberries too. Horses are beautiful and very friendly. Made it with our cat! (First feline to Pollett's - loved it!). ", 'great trail. some thick bushes to go through at certain points. lots of rocks and stumps on the paths which are quite narrow. lots of Hill lots of decline.', 'My wife and I hiked in on July 18, excellent day for hiking 18 degrees and overcast. We stayed for lunch about an hour and then hiked out in the afternoon. 3 hours 20 minutes in and 3 hours 40 out, rose bushes in full bloom! Lovely walk! ', 'This was an amazing trail. It’s challenging, with lots of uphills and downhills, beautiful coastal views, and lots of creeks (7!). It took us 2h20min one way and we did the out and back in one day. We spent just over an hour in the cove. By the time we got back to our car we were tired but it was doable. The views all along the way are amazing and Pollet’s cove is magical. Well worth it. I recommend long pants due to the overgrown bushes and have a hat handy as there are exposed stretches and it gets hot. We heard a coyote and were told there was a bear with two cubs closer to the cove so definitely pack up gear in case you encounter wildlife. ', 'Beautiful hike and incredible place to do an overnight trip. A few parts of the trail were quite overgrown so definitely wear pants. There’s a muddy patch just up from the river that was pretty unavoidable so keep that in mind. Wish I had stayed more than one night and will definitely be back!', 'Simply amazing. A trail that has some steep climbs heading in but it is all well worth it. I will defiantly will be returning for the fall colors of 2020.  polletts cove', 'What I love about this hike is you can make it a camping excursion or hike to the river for a half day hike. Both are amazing and I would say fairly challenging. It was hot today; 32C so the incline near start was very noticeable! Walking sticks are good to take, good hiking boots and I didn’t but should have worn pants! I miss the cows. They had the trail well eaten and beaten and now it’s a bit thorny and alders are growing up. There’s a couple of easy streams to cross before the river valley. It’s not quite as “open” as I recalled but still stunning views; you see the Bay St Lawrence the whole hike; even in the trees.  Lots of birds - warblers galore, and gannets. And we saw whales. Paradise. ', 'The most incredible hike I’ve ever been on! The hike is challenging at times - however the view takes your breath away more than the hike. There is a river to cross, and right now there is a small muddy patch to walk through (not sure if that’s always there), as well as some fallen down trees you have to go around near the end. It was my first time and definitely won’t be my last ', 'Mountain biked the trail, wouldn’t ever do it again but don’t regret it at the same time also my recording didn’t start from the parking lot, I forgot to start until about 20min into the hike and then shut it off after about 20 min after leaving pollets cove', 'Beautiful. A great NS trail. ', "My wife, my son and I are Adirondack 46ers and have hiked a lot over the years. This was one of the best and most beautiful we have done. It helps that today's weather was perfect - low 20s (Celsius), clear sky and modest humidity  - but it is more than that.  We were able to get to Pollett's Cove in 2.5 hours and it took the same time to return. We had been warned that this is an over-nighter, and it would be great to camp and explore the environs. That said, it is a wonderful and very realistic day hike for those with a bit of experience and hike with some speed. There are plenty of things to see - mountain meadows, deep gorges cut by streams and spectacular ocean vistas.  The trees, flowers and grasses are wonderful and conspire to create dramatic views to surprise at almost every turn. Then there is the wildlife. We did not see the mythic wild horses - maybe next time. We did see an abundance of pilot whales and bald eagles.  At one cove, far below us, we saw a coyote fighting with 4 bald eagles and a number of ravens over the carcass of a recently beached pilot whale. This hike has a grandeur about it and a remarkable feeling of remoteness combined with an excellent footpath. With all this said, anyone trying this hike should be prepared to work hard, exercise appropriate safety, be respectful of the environment and be properly equipped. There are very steep parts that can get slick, as well as steep drops. Beginners and many intermediate hikers will find much more accessible and appropriate trails in the Cape Breton National Park. ", 'with em', 'Incomplete. This ungrateful beautiful peace of yum yum beats you black and blue but serves up scandalous views. The calming chaos will rip your smokers cough into a frenzy. Your knees are so raw, I’ve got to let you know. Stay away if you’re out of shape or in need of proving something but stay for the Halifax aging hipsters and aggressive ponies.
Latinos are welcome. 
No walls allowed. 

Update: Completed September 2nd 2020
', "Absolutely Beautiful Place! I have hiked this trail many times and will continue to revisit! Besides what has already been written about the trail's condition, I would add. . . . I have noticed that over the last couple of years Hogweed has started to grow along the side of the trail in a few different locations. Hogweed can cause painful blistering to the skin if one comes in contact with the sap. So (as always) be mindful while trekking along the trail. Also over the years I have noticed various amounts of garbage and trash being left around the Cove. Just a friendly reminder to everyone to do their part to clean up after themselves (leave no trace) and maybe even take it a step further and clean up other waste that you find. (This land is privately owned, and fortunately for all of us, they permit access.) Let's respect this place and keep this place beautiful and wild!!!", 'Amazing up and down 9km hike to the most beautiful scenery and horses you could imagine! Camp the night there you’ll regret it if you don’t like we do! ', 'Une bonne randonnée qui en vaut le coup! L’anse est accueillante avec ses chevaux sauvages, sa rivière fraîche et sa plage à couper le souffle. S’il ne fait pas trop chaud, pensez à mettre des vêtements longs, parce qu’à ce temps-ci de l’année, les arbustes (rosiers sauvages, petits sapins, framboisiers) poussent dans les sentiers et égratignent pas mal. Quelques endroits boueux, sentiers assez minces et à flanc de montagne. Le pire de la montée se fait au début du trajet, après le premier ruisseau. Il nous a fallu enlever nos souliers pour traverser la rivière située à mi-chemin ! N’oubliez pas la crème solaire, une partie du trajet se fait sans le couvert des arbres.', 'Très belle rando. À  mi-chemin nous avons une vue fantastique de la côte escarpée et du Golfe. Nous avons dû enlever nos bottines pour traverser la rivière en contre-bas', 'A little bit of everything on this hike. View and horses were the reward. 3 hours in and 2.5 out on the same day. Best hike in Cape Breton so far. ', 'We loved this trail but had quite an adventure. We would definitely rate this as one of our top five hikes! It’s not that difficult from an ascent standpoint as I expected but there are several challenges along the way; a very muddy bog section, a wide brook to cross as well as several other minor to a little larger water crossings (and remember that you’ll have to repeat all of this on your way back) and very narrow and overgrown shrubs- some were face height but I’m just 5’3”. What I did not expect was the most beautiful view after coming down the first mountain- totally jaw dropping beautiful; a combination of “the hills are alive with the sound of music” with ocean views. The horses were further back towards the river so we did not see much of them but the views made this hike totally worthwhile for us. I also don’t think that there is a need to spend the night in order to accomplish this hike. For a reference point, my husband and I are both 62 but have done several more difficult hikes in the past. ', "Awesome hike! We did an east coast trip this summer and hiked lots of trails and this one was definitely one of our favourites. It can get a bit slippery and steep at times but the views and good vibes are worth it! The campsites looked like people haven't been cleaning up after themselves very well. (Please tidy up after yourselves as it would be a shame to degrade and/or loose access to this special place!). We hiked in and out in an afternoon but there are places to camp - we'll definitely stay over next time!", 'This hike was a rollercoaster ride (literally). Plenty of very long climbs and long drops. There is a beautiful brook midway to have a nice break at but coming back and climbing that midway hill was a challenge. This hike was like walking into a storybook world. The cove is absolutely
Breathtaking. But so is the hike itself. A challenging one but most definitely worth it. One word of advice, the horses are VERY curious so be careful. We set up our tent and went down to walk the beach quickly and came back to 9 horses eating all our food and beating down our tent. Had to make- shift back together but even through all of that this hike is 100% worth it! And left us with great stories to tell. Would recommend for sure, just make sure you are ready for a challenge in climbs and some very friendly horses. ', 'Other than a few light stream crossings and some exposed drops, this is a fairly moderate trail. The wild horses are gorgeous and extremely well accustomed to people. We saw a baby horse as well as a very pregnant mom as well!

Proposed to my girlfriend here - a special place for a special time :) ', 'Beautiful hidden gem in the Cape Breton Highlands!', 'Best place on earth', 'Beautiful, I would definately do it again. The horses at the end of it make it all worthwhile. If you are choosing to share food with them, be prepared to be surrounded  by them all lol.... we went in and out in one day, 3 hours in and about 2.5 back....', 'Note, this is the return hike only, with the end point being the trail head. See also my "Hike In" for the trek to Polletts Cove..............

On Thursday and Friday we hiked Pollett’s Cove, which is in NW Cape Breton in the Aspy Fault Wilderness. The only access to the cove is via boat or the narrow trail we travelled on. It is owned by a local lottery winner who generously makes it available for public use. The hike starts near Gampo Abbey, a Buddist monastery in Pleasant Bay. The trail mostly follows the coast line and is 8km in each direstion. It starts with a very nasty climb until you reach a stretch that is briefly flat along a cliff edge. It is followed by 3 knolls and then a steep decline into the cove valley. The trail is narrow throughout, and often traverses near vertical slopes and cliffs, often rough with loose rocks. The weather was hot and muggy. I would not want to travel these sections in wet weather as it would be very treacherous. The latter part of the hike had a couple of stretches through deep wild roses and other 6 ft tall vegetation. As we were staying overnight, we carried heavy packs with our necessary gear. In total the track had 2800 ft of elevation change. Easily the most difficult we have completed so far. The cove was outstanding consisting of a valley with a mountain stream draining to the ocean and populated by at least 11 wild horses who are very tame and curious about campsites. The night we were there there were about 12 fellow hikers staying overnight, all half our age. It was fun watching the horses visiting the campsites in hopes of food rewards. Among the horses was a foal who was still nursing. While in our tent reading, some visited us as well. A beautiful place truly in the wilderness. This was our first overnight tenting hike and we had a sleepless night which made the trek out exhausting. We were awakened by coy-wolves howling on the nearby hillside. On the trail, some of our fellow hikers came across a bear cub.
We will visit here again though we will be more economical with our packs which were too heavy.', 'Aug 2nd hike on a warm humid day. This recording is the hike to the cove as we stayed overnight. The early portion of the hike was a long and steep climb on a narrow trail. Most of the remainder was up and down good sized knolls also on a narrow trail. Overall a difficult track but very worth while once the cove was reached. We swam in the stream that drains into the ocean and camped in the valley. Currently 10 wild horses live in the valley and we found them very tame.']

There is not a trail marker for when you vere  to right to head into falls. It’s after a few hundred metres on logging road.  Cell reception is good so helps to check on map provided here. You can walk to lake: about 500 m beyond the falls. A beautiful fall hike! ', 'The fall colours were nice.', 'Awesome hike', 'Can be a little confusing getting on the right path. Keep an eye out for trail markers along the way. Beautiful fall colors are starting to appear along the trail.  ', 'Very nice easy walk with family. Waterfall was very nice', 'This trail is all about the destination which is beautiful . You can hike further along and end up at Soldier lake for a swim which is nice. Liike others have said over 1/2 is old logging road/ATV trail and 90% is through recently clear cut scrub so not very scenic. Nice falls tho’ ', 'Great trail but definitely confusing forks. Wouldn’t have made it to the falls without the app. First fork - right. Second fork - right. Third fork - LEFT. Gorgeous falls and worth the hike!', 'Great short trail. Easily manageable for most abilities. Thankful for the advice in previous reviews on direction as it is not marked. The first and second fork go right and the third fork go left . Beautiful falls is the reward. ', 'good trail. easy to finish for all skill levels. there is a fork in the road about 500 m in but if you stick to the right you should be fine. pretty cool waterfall at the end as well', "fabulous. loved it all. stick right at the start of the forks in the 'road' section ", 'easy to walk, well marked and water was refreshing ', "ATV trails have a lot of garbage, was pretty disappointing to see. Lots of Forks in the road and way to the falls is not well marked, without the all trails map I wouldn't have found the falls. ", 'Full of garbage. Atv trail', 'Great little trail, super hot out there today. There is zero shade. The waterfall was wonderful and very refreshing for a dip before heading back. Followed the previous reviewers directions at the forks, luckily, we didnt find it to be well marked.', 'Really enjoyed this trail! Although we may have gone down a wrong trail without a map and the Great advice from the previous review to follow the markers on the trees. Without that knowledge we may not have found it as there are 2 separate forks in the road. The marked trail will lead you right to the falls!
After the 4 wheel trail turns into a walking trail it becomes a bit overgrown with blueberry bushes but nothing extreme. My 8 year old hiked it with ease. Well worth the hike to get to the waterfall! 
It had just down poured the last 2 days so there’s some big puddles to maneuver around but the falls were roaring!! Spectacular!
Lots of horse flies! Bring bug spray and a hat', 'Giving 4 stars based on the type of trail - gravel roadway giving way to a woodsy trail that ends at a very pretty waterfall. This was an easy walk in, pleasant on a cooler day as there is little shade. As everyone has mentioned - garbage - but it is only in a few spots. The horseflies were terrible so we were glad to have worn long sleeves and pants. Also glad to have downloaded the map as recommended - there are quite a few different trails but the one marked takes you right to the falls. We couldn’t figure out the loop around the falls, crossed the river and followed the tape for a bit but when we lost that trail we went back the way we came. Some nice wildflowers, lots of birds and chipmunks', 'Bring sunscreen and bug spray.', 'decent trail leads to some beautiful scenic areas. actual foot path portion of the trail is a little over grown but easy to follow. 

as noted previously, the trail starts as an access road, moves onto a fairly wide atv trail, followed by a single file path through the bush.   

lots of horseflys about and buzzing our heads and arms. they were very annoying. 

to note: a number of random places along the atv trails where inconsiderate people have dumped garbage.', 'Loved it. Over half is on a service/ATV road, then through a path in the woods, overgrown but still can see where it goes. I recommend downloading the map to have for back up as I took a quick wrong turn once or twice as its not marked. 

60 minutes in and out. Spent about 20 minutes outside of that just at the falls letting my dog swim.', 'It was kind of dried out when I went (despite it raining for a few days). The path is full of frogs, and some small snakes. Overgrown and slightly thorny, you’re going to need pants. Probably more worth it in the fall', 'Trail was not bad. Starts off as a service road for the natural gas pipeline, turns off on to an ATV trail. Multiple forks, all seem to still eventually lead to the waterfall. Waterfall is great.   A lot of garbage in a couple spots on the trail. Wish I had an effective means to remove it.', 'Gorgeous waterfall and a fairly quick hike. The trail isn’t super well marked - for the forks, we went 1) right 2) straight/left 3) straight/left. A previous commenter said to stay right until the end but when we went right at the second fork, we were headed way off course. There is a lot of household garbage dumped at the beginning of the trail - it’s honestly a bit shocking to see big pieces of furniture, old paint cans, etc.... It took us about 25 mins each way, with a dog and a child. It was very buggy at the waterfall.', 'It definitely was a super hot day to attempt this trail.

But I did it. I do suggest using the map to follow the trail. It makes it really easy to navigate to the fall.

It took me about 25 mins to walk to the falls, and about 25 mins around the falls for pictures and 25 back out!

a lot of the trail is open to the sun, with a few areas that are shaded.', 'good trail for ATV not so much for walking ', 'Not great, multiple trails not super clear paths. Lots of garbage on the trail. Nice waterfall', 'My favourite trail by far! Certainly capable of any skill level until you reach the actual falls, then it’s quite a steep climb down. We followed advice from previous reviews to keep the app out so we could track our whereabouts - the trail is not marked at all and you will come to several forks in the road. We got lucky and found the falls our first time! It’s a gorgeous spot with flat land and shallow water access for camping or picnics. Our dogs loved it! There is a large gravel opening half way through the trail where there is lots of garbage from other campers, which was disappointing to see. Horseflies and ticks were HORRIBLE, but the waterfall was worth it! About 40 mins both ways. Beautiful views but some muddy spots after it rained day before. Bring sunscreen as most of the trail is in open sun. Watch your step for fallen logs and vines. All I can say for directions is stay far right at every fork except when you come to a grassy hill incline, stay straight -but you’ll hear the water by then! Loved it here.', 'I would suggest using the app to find your way since there are a lot of side trails. A fair amount of it is just gravel road but the further you get it turned in the more single track. Very scenic when you get to the waterfall I highly suggest this hike', '4.5 stars. Only missing a half star because of the garbage and spilled oil everywhere at the first half of the trail. Second half is fantastic, not many bugs, the waterfall is great. It should be noted that the trail does continue after its marked on alltrails, it will lead you down to soldier lake which is a nice spot for a picnic. Would recommend!', 'Like others have said I started down the wrong trail to start but used the map, double backed and found the right one. Once in the trail it was easy to follow!
Lots of garbage around which is a shame.
Nice waterfall at the end!', 'If you’re going to do this hike, make sure that your phone has data so you can follow this map. There’s a lot of forks in the road so it’s good to have the map on so you know which way to go. I’d say it took about 30 minutes to get to the falls and about 20 minutes to get pack to the car...After you do it once, you may not need the map but it definitely saved my life. Beautiful waterfall!! ', 'easy to moderate hike, follow the red markers, not hard to follow. beautiful falls at the end', 'Awesome trail. I took advice of other reviews and found it easy to navigate with the map. Great spot!', 'Nice hike , definitely tricky to navigate if you aren’t following the map because there’s lots of forks . We made it to the falls, was a nice reward', 'bit tricky to navigate through all the twists and turns of the dirt bike tracks so just keep an eye on the map. Saw a pheasant but otherwise not a lot of wildlife spotting. as others have said unfortunately people have dumped household garbage around the trails. Waterfall is really beautiful though :) ', 'A lot of garbage and waterfall isn’t easy to access', 'great hike! ended with some very muddy shoes. unfortunately a lot of garbage 
', 'The trail is meh right now since the greenery hasn’t come in yet, but the waterfall at the end is very nice. The first bit of the trail is a road, then it turns into an ATV route. I will mirror the comment below, at one point the ATV route goes right and you need to continue straight to hit the waterfall so keep an eye on your maps!', "The trail forked and we wound up taking the wrong path so we didn't make it to the falls but it did lead us to a beautiful lake. early season so it was very muddy and lots of ATVs out digging trenches into the path. we're definitely going to go back and hike on the right trail though. ", 'Full train information can be found in Benoit Lalonde's book "Waterfalls of Nova Scotia"

First quarter of the trial is on a dirt road. Unfortunately people have elected to use the road as a place to dump household items in a few locations. The remainder or the trail is through a clear cut, that was likely cut more than a dozen years ago. The trail through the clear cut follows the rough roads used for logging machinery. I notice red flagging tape through the clear cut portion of the train. The scenery is unremarkable and the waterfall is not a scenic as others in the book.']

['A wonderful easy walk!! Parking limited before where gravel road starts. It would be great if the path could be marked, because right now people have formed dozens of paths, trampling vegetation as they go.', 'STUNNING. Even on a cloudy day!', 'Excellent view. Best spot so far I’ve seen on the trail.', 'Aug 2021, beautiful afternoon hike. We went counter clockwise around the loop which offered amazing cliff side views and large waves crashing against rock on the way to the point. This left the way back to be much less dramatic. The hike was pretty easy. Not much elevation. It was perfect for our second hike of the day. The views and atmosphere are definitely worth the visit. ', "This place is Incredible!! I highly recommend coming here when it's windy if you wanna see some monster waves! and also follow the coastline trail for few kilometers. Enjoy..", 'My favorite trail in Nova Scotia. Outside the Cabot Trail but very scenic ride to get there. Easy walk up to the top with nice lookout at the end. Can’t get any better than that. You can see seals from there. As what everyone else said, park on the street just before the gravel path.', 'We hit this trail on a spectacular sunny and hot day. Park at the end of the paved road and don’t try to drive up the dirt road unless you have a Jeep as it is rutted and rocky and you can get stuck up there unable to turn around if too many people go there to park. This is a delightful coastal trail with so many paths to follow. Magnificent views of the coastline in both directions. Small pioneer graveyard and a cross to the Unknown Sailor. Nice walk to do with younger children too. Easy walk. ', 'Amazing, short, easy, beautiful! Favourite hike in Cape Breton so far!', 'Amazing views, great hike for little ones and a very different trail as it’s all open.', 'First time for us on this trail. Parked just where the paved road ends. You can drive another 100m or so but it’s a bit rocky and not a lot of parking there. Views are spectacular to say the least! We climbed down the rocks on the very end of the peninsula, dipped our toes in the water and listened to the surf.  Well worth it!!', "This was one of my favourite points on Cape Breton Island. Short and easy stroll/hike to various coastal cliff views and you can scramble to get a little closer to the water. Every turn felt like a new surprise. I've never been to Scotland, but I'd imagine this is what it might look like.", 'Great coastal views; would definitely visit again. Troves of crowberries, and lowbush blueberries. Really interesting cemetary with plaque for the Unknown Sailor. ', 'Nice walk out to the point with 5/5 views. Great on a sunny day.', 'this trail never disappoints.
today was very very windy but amazing as always. ', 'Your skill level will dictate whether you view this as a hike or not but in any case, it’s an easy and well-worth-it side jaunt if you are in the area. Easy footing (rocky but flat and wide), minimal elevation gain and absolutely spectacular views. Awesome rock formations, wild untamed ocean vistas and an incredible view of the northern mountain range. This would be a great spot to pack a gourmet picnic, perhaps even make a proposal  Recommended ', 'So beautiful, highly recommend if you are looking for some views!', 'very nice coastal walk, some uphill and lots of seabirds ! ', 'You will be happy you made the effort to find this point! The geology and coastline is quite stunning; wide open views of north mountain range. We were there in relative calm but I’m betting the waves and wind kick up there. We saw many seals, shore birds. There is the walk to the point; but we found a trail to the south east and continued a bit longer. Trail starts at the end of paved white point road; a gravel road between two homes. ', 'Lovely look off. Very rugged. Easy walk. ', "Short but very beautiful. Saw an Eagle soaring over one of the coves. Definitely keep dogs on leash, some steep drop offs  and eroded edges. Looks like you're walking down someone's driveway at the start, if that's what you're thinking, you're in the right place!", 'We accidentally stumbled upon this, what a stunning surprise. It was sunset & it took my breath away! ', 'Easy short trail with wonderful views. Lots of birds at the end!', 'We watched birds and saw minke whales and seals from the shore. Gorgeous spot.', 'short but awesome views. 

on our way back down, we saw a pod we believe pilot whales in the cove. 

definitely worth the drive to the trail. it is the perfect hike to finish off the day. ', 'One of the most beautiful spots in Cape Breton. Its kid friendly but there are cliffs so keep them close. Be very careful on the rocks. My husband and I were climbing around and a boulder was loose and crushed his hand. He ended up losing a finger. ', 'a must see if your around, feels like the edge of the earth', 'Awesome place that needs to be on the itinerary of every visitor to the area. It’s a beautiful, serene and easy place to explore, with an edge-of-the-earth type of feel.', 'love picking blueberries here 
', 'The view is gorgeous! Highly recommended!', 'Beautiful!!!!', 'Amazing views. Rocky terrain. Very windy. Recommend not driving up the dirt path, lots of pot holes. Park at the bottom of harbour. ', 'Our favourite for ‘hanging out’ and exploring. Beautiful area, easy walk, very open.  

High traffic area out to and at the point, but we enjoy continuing further on the trail along the coastline-in doing so, we’ve been able to watch seals playing!  Please stay on trail though- Fragile vegetation! 

Parking not so great !  ', 'the view is breathtaking, eagles soaring around you and the ocean crashing into the cliffs. very accessible so anyone can do it. less traffic that skyline trail I highly recommend this!', 'Very nice trail and views! Parking a bit tricky but worth it!', 'I got engaged here, so I’m biased. But totally worth seeing if you have some time. Easy walk and cool things to see', 'You won’t regret this wrong turn on your way to the (insert New England accent here) CHOWDER HOUSE! 

The Scottish highlands dressed in drag with a coke problem - this highly unseen pastor of couples in love and screaming birds, ready to rip the Venus from your heart.

Dressed as a young schoolboy I stayed close to the edge of the cliff while fighting the urge to jump into the water and join the unidentified squawking birds. Tourists: we hate them as much as we need them. Praise the unidentified sailor buried there.', 'Randonnée facile, mais spectaculaire! Excellent endroit où aller voir le coucher du soleil. ', 'impressionnant !', 'The best trail we did in Cape Breton.  Very short but very grand looking.  You can see many birds.  Highly recommend. ', 'Very easy hike with spectacular views. So in easy in fact you could pack a gourmet lunch and hike to a spot and then eat while enjoying some of the best views in Cape Breton. Drive up the hill to the right of house number 2119 and you will find a wide area off to the right where you can park and start your hike.', 'Really just walking around a lookout. Unknown grave marker near the end.', 'Beautiful trail to go on at sunset. We were there by ourselves most of the time.', 'Really great views... can watch ships on horizont and birds on small island near by! ', 'adorer! sentier facile pour les debutants comme moi et le decor et vraiment beau! c’est un décor différent du reste de la cabot trail mais en voyant toujours les montagnes au loin! on a aperçu des baleines non loin des berges! ', 'Concur with all the 5 star reviews here. Be prepared for strong winds.', 'A nice walk out on a point - very peaceful! It smells amazing too, there must be some herbs growing. We saw lots of whales from the point too! ', 'Must see. Park by the harbour at the bottom. We walked to the end and back to our car within an hour.

Probably the most unique trail on the Cabot trail ', 'Just a must do! Amazing trail with awsome view! Very windy! Give it an hour or so to take in the beauty and to explore the little trails! Go also right, nice beach! I recommend parking at the little harbour.', 'We walked this trail Thursday and it was beautiful! A must see short hike along the Cabot trail. The view is spectacular! Great for kids as well.', 'This is an easy trail on a treeless point so there is almost 360 degree view of ocean and rocky cliffs. One could just spend the day there and just take in the views. It is simplest to park in the town Harbour and walk the dirt road for 50 yards to start the trail which is never in the woods. Bring your lunch and find a large rock otherwise head back into the Harbour and there is a picnic table. If you are on the Cabot Trail don’t miss this beautiful easy hike.', 'Fantastic trail do not miss it. A short walk to see a great view. I mountain biked it and had a great time. Some great cliffs & rock formations.', 'Absolutely amazing views! Some of the best on the Cabot trail! A must see!', 'Gorgeous lookouts, you can do it as a loop, peer down into the little coves to see large groups of purple jellyfish, lovely sound of shorebirds at the end', 'Favorite place!', 'Great trail that leads to a breathtaking view of the Atlantic and the Grave of the Unknown Sailor.']

['Great!', 'Great trail. Lots of spots to stop near the water. Can get quite muddy. Most parts of the trail have a ton of roots - watch your step!', 'Water was warm! Great place to go for a dip.', "Trails are beautiful through trees and lake views. Waterfall is gorgeous. Although it is an easy trail, be warned that it's not suitable for a stroller as the ground is not flat. Some tree hiking is required which we love, but I realize it's not for everyone. ", 'Beautiful trail. Serene views of the lake. Tracker was helpful at parts. Worth wearing hiking boots, it was muddy in places.', 'beautiful, muddy!', 'Romantic hike, on the easier side of moderate. Not heavily traveled.  Many muddy spots but you can usually skirt around or use stepping stones (roots, logs). Many warblers. Many spots on the lake and ravine to sit and have a snack or sit and dream.', 'What a beautiful hike! Not very busy at 9:00 AM on a sunny Saturday. Little muddy especially on the keg through the woods. We did that leg first. When you get to the River, take a left before crossing the River. About 10 minutes down is a bridge, waterfall and bench. You walk along the River until you get to Long Lake and then you walk along the west shore. Path is fairly easy to follow for the most part. The app was helpful when finding the turns.', 'was a bit muddy. Not alot of people there, well marked path.
', "I thoroughly enjoyed this hike. We started off on the regular Long Lake trail but there were quite a few people out that day so we decided to veer off onto this trail, which had less people to pass. I didn't realize at the time of the trail name. We hiked along what looked like a creek bed and came to the most beautiful little stream/river, where we stopped for a snack. I had my two young boys and my parent with me - it was great for all ages! We followed the river back, saw the water falls and then followed the lake edge back the rest of the way. Just a perfect day and a lovely trail. ", 'Great trail, much. Iced views than I expected.

Very muddy. ', 'I absolutely loved this trail ... walking along the river was just beautiful ', 'Pretty wet and muddy this time of year. Still a little bit of ice too.', 'Drove past many times but never checked this trail out till today.  Snowy and icy but warm sunny day make it just soft enough to provide very good footing.  On the way out it was starting to get muddy.  Very nice old growth woods, following the stream and lake gave some really nice views.  Will be have to check it out in the summer and fall. ', 'beautiful but rocky, wet, and slippy. glad I had my GPS going on my phone. trail was a bit hard to follow at points.', 'Great trail, a bit icy in spots but such a nice hike', 'Icy! Even with ice grippers, tricky.', 'Awesome little hike. A bit of everything and a nice waterfall surprise', 'Beautiful trail, not marked but not difficult to follow. Used Crampons which were very useful due the amount of fresh ice under the new snow cover. Must return in the spring.', 'Nice trail. I needed the map the whole time but if you just follow the river up the hill and around you shouldn’t need it. Lots of flooded places, waterproof shoes are a must. I had to carry my 8 pound dog over lots of flooded areas but once you get to the top and start descending down the right side it’s so beautiful ', 'Slippery, muddy, icy, puddles, but a beauty of a hike!', 'Such a nice trail! Easy to get lost in all the side trails out there especially as someone knew to the area. Kinda boggy and the path is full of roots and rocks which is fun and not boring! You follow the lake edge and then follow a small stream to a waterfall that’s way prettier in real life. Lots of moss and beautiful colours. Lots of dogs as well, I brought mine and they loved it. Will be going back!', 'Great trail! Be prepared for wet trail conditions.', 'I really enjoyed this loop, but it’s not well marked at all. I had to keep checking this app. I was also there after a rainy week, so the path was really muddy and flooded in several spots. The brook was also really high making passing tricky. Really fun! Challenging and beautiful. Love the trails at Long Lake, you could spend days there! ', 'Great and so awesome but wet!', 'A fantastic little hike to a little waterfall.  A bit muddy but well worth it.', 'Well travelled but not well marked. Easy to get off the “path”. Grateful for this app!!', 'Good variation of things to see, and can’t complain about the location. This trail tends to be damp most of the year and today was no exception. There are plenty of paths to take around the wet parts.', 'fun trail but zero markers. You really need to know the path or use this app.
', 'Beautiful lake and river views, also good for swimming. Quiet. Very difficult to follow the trail path and lots of roots and rocks to watch out for.', 'More challenging than I expected ! Pretty much all roots and rock most of the way.  Beautiful rock formations and lake views as you get past half way point ! ', "It was fun. good to go when the is a bit of a drought to have less mud. figuring out the pathways and going little ways on the extra paths is interesting. ĺots of rocks and roots and weaving though.  I was very scared after being alone and in quiet so long, to have a dog near the last 20 min. of the walk land beside me from a full run. it startled me beyond words, started barking, growling, then jumped and hit me backwards into a tree. very aggressively continuing to bark and growl at me. a large tan boxer. I love dogs  's but I was genuinely scared. no owner in site. he bit my backpack with his mouth when he jumped the first time but let it go, didn't rip it. I couldn't see an owner. he jumped again barking loudly, pushing me back. I was frozen is spot, arms up. then i heard someone say coming and could see a person running through trees. she was far from the dog when this happened, a young woman, blonde ponytail and cap. I started loudly explaining as she was getting closer, i was scared, her dog was growling, bit at my pack and barking and knocking me over. when she got to me, she shooed the dog forward, quipped a little sorry without looking at me and ran off. I was shaken up pretty bad. I love dogs, owned many, but this was terrifying. I've never been faced with a dog that aggressive before. had to drop and regulate a bit but shaken for the rest of the walk. if you have a dog with this potential keep them attached to you! this was a dogs on leash trail. I had no wits about me to worry about how to get information on them. Having sprained my ankle a few weeks before hiking, I was very aware to watch the ground as well. so trail lovely, but beware this woman and dog. my guess is  they know the trail well. ", 'The park of the loop inland is so muddy and not a nice enough hike to really warrant trying to go through it. Just use the water side of the trail there and back for a more enjoyable experience.', 'Good trail, easy to follow. Gets muddy in places but there’s lots of ways to avoid the mud', 'Some off trail hiking. Muddy. Adventurous. Fun. Baby waterfall at the end. More exploring to do upstream!', 'With a light layer of snow down went off the trail a couple of times.', "Lovely trail with the pup today. have walked it before and would say it's not a great trail in the spring melt, as part of the loop is essentially a creek bed. It's easier to navigate in dry weather, and easiest if your shoes can withstand some mud.

Surprised no one has mentioned: you do NOT have to cross the river. I made that mistake at the turnaround point and it didn't go well! ", 'Should have read the reviews of this trail beforehand. We both had sneakers and our dog. Took some work to navigate the water and mud. Had to use the GPS a few times as a back up but would have figured it out. Overall a good challenging trail with some nice scenery.  ', 'good stuff', "Was a lot of rocks and stumps. Hard to navigate as it's definitely off the beaten path. Wear boots after a rain. Had great scenery following the river after losing the trail. Suggest GPS as a back up (just in case). Loved it!
", 'trails not clearly marked. ', 'No one mentioned the rocky trail and root cover paths.  .The loop may be a bit longer than stated and with lots of black muddy spots going in you are walking in a creek bed and dogging roots coming back along the lake. Be prepared with water (a must always).  Trekking poles or a good hiking stick is a huge help. It was a fun hike and certainly not boring. ', 'Was quite wet when we went, most of the first half was piping from rock to rock to fallen branch but it was fun. Came to a small falls, and then found a bigger one on the back half. Awesome cascades and waterfall sounds along the way cable.', 'Beautiful but still very icy in some parts this time of year!', 'Great spot to get a hike in when pressed for time. The dogs love it and it is ready for use year round.']

['Great trail that starts out quite groomed then splits off to lakeside woods trail that is somewhat rugged. Peaceful and relaxing. ', 'such a blessing to have this so close to the city.', 'Only about 1/3 of the hike is actually in the woods. The rest is on nice, level, wide, crush dust trail. Only the west side of the loop along Long Lake is in the woods. 
Trail is easy to follow. Although the app was very helpful in finding the trail head, keeping you in the trail at a couple of forks (or deciding when to get off the trail) and navigating through the maze of crusher dust trail. 
There is a big parking lot just off the North West Arm Dr. (Although I think it is all Dunbrack now) with bathroom. Trail starts at either end of the parking lot. The crusher dust part of the trail is busy but we only saw one set of people on the wooded part.', 'Great day !', 'Great!', 'Way too dry for this time of year. Should be mucky. ', 'This is a very special trail for us for many reasons...not least of which being we got engaged on it ', "definitely not an easy trail! very quiet and only saw one other person. secluded and beautiful in the snow. ', 'Great day. Trail is still pretty dry. Perfect temperature. ', 'Good condition. Good mix of groomed trail then woods trail. Just perfect for our 12 year old dog. ', 'Great series of trails at Long Lake Provincial Park. Looking forward to some winter treks on the lake !!!', 'Nice easy path and trail mix. Not to challenging. Good for when you want a trail run but don’t have much time.', 'If you go today I can ensure all cob webs are clear as I believe I have about 150 on me right now. Beautiful and quite trail. So happy I love so close. A little muddy but easy to avoid.', 'can I use this trail during COVID-19 ', " I took my 1 y/o dog on this trail and it was beautiful (I went when the sun was setting). You almost forget you are in the city...however, as much as I love this trail there is so much dog pop :( so be careful where u walk. Also  there were a few times where people had their dogs off leash however the dogs were great and wasn't a negative experience, just something to look out for if you have young kids or have a dog who won't be comfortable around other dogs or people. There isn't much shade on a sunny day as it is a wide trail though. It can get quite muddy after a wet day. Overall I think it is a good trail :)", 'Wind chill -22C but a beautiful sunny day around Long Lake. Some snow but still easily hiked.', 'Take the paved well maintained road is better than the red line trail. ', 'love this trail winter and summer.. beautiful views... fairly easy.. winter you need cleats for the ice cover but so beautiful.  waterfall located on hike...water is a Beauty here. ', 'really enjoyed hiking along the lake shore', 'Really enjoyed this hike. Very easy terrain & pet friendly. ', 'Really enjoyed coming here with my dog and partners! ', 'Pretty nice trail for running but expect to use a gps/phone to guide you. Very easy to use the wrong trail. Not my go-to but definitely a nice trail if you get used to the directions.', 'Really great trail. Did the loop in about an hour. Best to go clockwise around the loop as it’s easy to miss the turn off the other way. ', 'Parkland Trail excellent, wilderness trail slightly muddy.', 'A beautiful place to hike within the city limits. Many spots to jump off trail and hang out on the lake. Proceed wth caution in the winter season as the trails are not serviced and be ice becomes quite bad. Great for the whole family, very easy terrain!', 'Late winter hike. Very icy sections along the way. A lot of water flowing in the creeks to the point we had to divert our hike. 

This trail would get a higher star rating during warmer spring, summer and fall weather or in the middle of winter when everything is frozen.', "Enjoyed this hike. The only part of the trail that's groomed with crusher dust is the Lakeview Trail section. The part next to Long Lake is thru the woods over rock and root and in places hard to track. None of it has any winter maintenance. ", 'Nicely groomed cycle trails combined with woods lot foot trails, easy parking, public washrooms, and plenty of great spots to swim.', "Very user friendly for all ages. Dogs allowed on leash. Tracks water's edge.", "You wrote a review for Long Lake Provincial Park	9 minutes ago
4.0 star rating 4/24/2018
Hi everyone, 

Before I get to the review, I just wanted to direct you to my YouTube video of my experience here at Long Lake Provincial Park. Simply go to youtu.be/PxGNBHnov-I

It was a fun day, and it would be great to share my experience with you!

Long Lake Provincial Park is a short 10-15 minute drive from the city. Located near a subdivision, this is a popular spot to visit. Since this place is close to the city, they did make sure to ensure ample parking. 

There are several trails from the parking lot (one goes right, and one goes left). We ended up going left during our trip. The paths are well maintained and follow the lake. I found as though the trail intersections could have been better labelled, as we had a bit of an issue finding the correct one back to the car. 

You can access the lake in several different spots where you can swim if you'd like. The only ones in the lake when I was there were a couple of doggie friends! 

There is no admission, and as far as I'm aware, no services - including no washrooms. 

Trails are easy

Hope this was helpful, and I hope you check out the video to get a better sense of this park!", 'This Trail is part of the Long Lake Provincial Park, it is an upgraded trail for all users. As it is a provincial park dogs must be on leash and owners must cleanup after their dogs.', 'Snow packed today which made it a bit more difficult. Will definitely try again in better walking conditions', 'Nice trail system and that has crushed gravel, good for running with several small hills. Close to the road so you hear a lot of traffic, also a lot of dog droppings..', 'Great walk with the dogs :)', 'Good park. We liked that there was a mixture of hills and flat grounds. Good for a challenge. We loved the tall trees and cute little flowers. The Lake was very calm and peaceful. Easy to get to as well. However, the bathroom was horrifying.', 'Nice walk through the woods and near the lake but way too many dogs and their "droppings". Not all owners pick up after their dog and ruins it for everyone else. Won't walk that trail with my kids again! :(', 'Probably the most popular spot in the city to walk the dog, but a great place for anyone to go on a small adventure. ']

['So we’ll maintained and left a little natural with ups and downs. Just a fantastic trail.', 'beautiful trail nicely .marked  
', 'Loved it! So quite and peaceful, marked really well. Did some geocaching which was really cool to find in the middle of literally no where. Loved the wooden benches throughout. Very well maintained.', "This is a great day hiking trail to get your legs under you. It doesn't promise mind blowing views, but it does have some unique and nice ones. It doesn't claim to be life changing, but it certainly offers a nice steady woodland trail that is very well maintained with a nice variety of ecosystems and scenery. It is being expanded in the coming years too!

This is where I learned about hiking, and trained for other trails. 

Kudos to the Nine mile river trails association for taking good care of it. ", 'Nice little easy to follow trail. Saw ~10 people even on a cool overcast day.   Very well marked and peaceful.', 'Excellent trail. Not technically tough but nice 10k. First half Is smooth trail and some crusher dust suitable for sneakers. The comeau lake loop has roots and rocks and some muddy spots and more suitable to boots. Kudos to the volunteers maintains this jewel of a trail. Lots of mosquitos on the loop around the lake !', 'Was challenging and a good 10k trail', 'Great trail, a few bugs and a lot of Roots in spots. Enjoyed and will be back.', 'Great trail, well taken care of. Lots of beautiful wild flowers were blooming today!
Lots of good sniffs for puppy to be had. 
Look forward to when they open new loops to explore!', 'Beautiful spot, easy to follow trail. Bring bug spray. ', 'Great day for a walk!! A bit wet in spots but all around good trail.', 'It was great to get out but it was pretty wet and slippery in places', 'Beautiful well groomed trail. A little wet from the rain but easy enough to get around any laying water on the trail!!', 'Trail was very well maintained and wasn’t too difficult of terrain to navigate. went on a Saturday and only met 5 people on the trail throughout all 9 km. Lots of geocaches scattered around as well that added some thrill! ', 'Great trail. Well groomed. My dog loved the cathedral trail where there was no people so she could run off leash for a bit and enjoy her run. Will be back!', 'Over all a well marked trail. Hikers may get turned around by the new trails under construction, as they are not signed as do not enter, or under construction.  Take a photo of the map before you head in.  
', 'Well maintained trail. Some mud but nothing bad.', "Did all 3 trails (pitcher plant, Comeau lake and hemlock cathedral).
Pitcher plant is very easy and crushed gravel. Comeau dirt yet still well maintained. Hemlock is more of a back country trail and there are signs posted saying no/little maintenence of said trail.
Overall a solid 5/5.  All 3 trails are marked very well (basically impossible to get off track) and well maintained. 
Huge shout out to the volunteers who are putting in the time and effort to keep these trails in such great condition. It's much appreciated 
Excellent relatively easy afternoon hike. Will definetly be adding this to my rotation of go to hikes.", 'Great trail lots to see! Wide and perfect for bikes. Little muddy in spots.', 'It was very icy so crampons a must. otherwise   love this trail.
', 'Very icy. Crampons required.', 'Awesome trail. Well marked and a little bit of everything for everyone', 'Great trail. Clearly marked. There’s been a lot of traffic on the trail system so the trail is clear. You will need grip-ons - about 90% of the trail is ice and pretty slippery without them. Quite a few bikers making use of the trail too but they’re very respectful of sharing the trail.', 'Great hike!  Although the trails were snow covered, they were easy to hike. They were well travelled with the exception of the side trail on the loop heading towards the camp. Nobody has travelled that in a while. I made it about half way up and the trail was completely submerged. Aside from that portion, the trail was in great shape. The Cathedral Trail is not as well travelled as the rest, but in just as good shape. All in all, it was a great hike and took me about 2 1/2 hours. ', 'Fun trail', 'Very well marked, gravel & dirt paths. Snow was packed down and slippery, but otherwise an easy walk. Not a particularly beautiful trail or area in the winter, but I’m sure the hemlock portion would be quite pretty in warmer months. There were many well-behaved, off-leash dogs on the trail, with owners who checked with us, or have us lots of clearance to pass without having to ask.', "Great trail. I didn't do the last loop though. Very nice walk or light hiking.", 'Nice trail, very well marked. Trails maps are available at the trailhead. ', 'Great trail!', "really nice trail, there's some pretty lookoffs and the forest is beautiful. downside is it was pretty muddy (but nothing deep so with the right footwear you'll be fine) and also the trail itself is not very challenging but its still a great hike! ", 'Varied forests throughout, ', 'Nice trail. Very muddy in parts but still nice !', "Pitcher Plant is in good shape but, given all the rain lately, Lake Comeau is a MESS. About 1/3 of the way through it starts getting wet and muddy, then after the bridge it's really bad. I wanted to get back to the lake today but I gave up before I slipped in all the mud.", "Fantastic trail!  It wasn't a challenging trail but was long enough to make it a great hike.  The entire trail was very well maintained and well-marked, even the back loop!

I've seen some reviews here that say the back loop is difficult to navigate but as of oct 30 2020, there has been substantial work done to the trail and its in great shape  ", 'The trail was beautiful and well marked ', 'a beautiful spot to see the fall colors the last loop is not accessible it is very flooded with lots of trees down ', 'I’ve trail but muddy in the middle out and back section. Can really appreciate the fall colours now.', 'cool. nice woods. wish I had time for the whole thing. definitely a fun trail bike run. even running it was fun in spots with dips and such. ', 'A very well maintained trail. We did the whole thing but most people would enjoy and be able to complete the first loop easily if they wanted a more leisurely walk. Even farther back is very well marked.', 'Great and well marked trail. Not very hard except for the distance. Only saw 4 groups and that’s because I went clockwise instead of counterclockwise ', 'Loved it! Well marked. Lots of maintenance being done. Thank you! Look forward to the trail extensions.', 'Opening loop is short, flat, and easy with boardwalks and crusher dust. Second trail starts the same way and transitions to dirt with some roots and puddles. No big hills—great signage. We didn’t try the yellow trail as the kids were tired, so we paused at the lake (more a glorified pond, not really good for taking a dip) and made our way back (took about two hours). No garbage, different terrains/forest growth throughout—very happy with our walk.', 'A beautiful and easy walk! The trail is nice and wide which is great for going with a friend. Lots of options for different distances and very well signed which made it easy to navigate! The bugs in the more forested part were really bad but not during the whole hike. ', 'This trail is amazing! We hike here all the time, can be a little muddy after rain but they have renovated it and replaced mini bridges that needed it. They are also planning to add onto it and make more trails in the future. ', 'Really good trail for Running... well maintained... all small climbs and descends but nothing steep! i never met a person on my run! Definitely one to do again', 'Great trail. Some parts not maintained (signage indicates those areas). Dog friendly!', 'Very nice trail enjoyed a snack at the lake and took the “unmaintained” they have marked some of the bridges were broken but useable very peaceful only saw 3 people the whole trip', 'Well-maintained trail - some stretches of boardwalk added in spring 2020. The front loop would be perfect for a quick walk or for those with younger children. The back loop is a bit more rugged. Both loops, plus the stretch in between them, take about two and a half to three hours. Best not to do after a heavy rain as there are several marshy bits. No stunning views but the entire trail is very bucolic and peaceful.', 'Well maintained trail. Very wet and flooded in certain areas but that was expected since I chose to visit on a rainy day. Very well marked with detailed signage and garbage disposal at the entrance. No garbage or dog poop left behind by other users. ', 'This was a great trail. Had the pleasure of enjoying the trail to the lake in Febuary. well maintained, with garbage disposal et entry, bridges, trail was for ped only, no trucks or 4 wheelers. Lots of signage and trail markers. Had to pick up garbage we found and bring out with us from other trail users but amazing and beautiful experience. 

we heard coyote yips and calls for an extended period. dog walkers should have leashes. 

fyi, be nice if people picked up after their dogs also. we leave no trace. ', 'Beautiful quiet trail that is perfect if you like total immersion in the forest. Was snowy and icy today but still fairly easy. Took 1 & 3/4 hours to go about 5.8 kms in. Trail is well marked ', 'Extensive boardwalks and bridges get you over the rough spots.  Trails are well marked.  This time of year leaf litter can hide the trail.  Tree markers help lead the way.  The boardwalks on Hemlock Cathedral Trail are under repair.  Use that trail at your own risk.  The tall stands of hemlock trees very scenic.  Definitely muddy sections to work around.', 'Well marked and maintained trail for a beautiful 10K fall hike. Gently winding, easily navigated footpaths through the forest with some gravel sections. Only a few muddy spots with several little bridges and  walkways over boggy areas.', 'Great hike with maybe the best marked trails I’ve been on ? It was just me and my little dog and I felt very safe. A bit wet in places but it’s been a wet spring, very quiet and fun.', 'Great trail for a spring hike! Few muddy spots but it is to be expected at this time of year. It was our first time doing it. We will be back! Trail marking is outstanding. Note that there are no outhouse at the trailhead or on the trail. Happy Sunday!', 'Great trail with spots that are thinly treed. Trail is muddy in spots but easily bypassed. I went later in the evening and only went half way to Comeau Lake. Looking forward to going again and completing the loop.', 'This trail takes me a few hours to hike . The board walks need some work . Muddy in a few spots and one spot is washed out with high water . There are trees and logs thrown down so you can step on those to cross but it is tricky . Have good boots and you should be fine . I’ve snow showed the whole trail and that took me almost six hours .', 'Nice trail hike. Well marked. Snow covered, used trail cramp ons and poles for balance. Allow at least a couple hours for this hike....beautiful.', 'Easy, flat, and well maintained. Moderate amount of people on the trails. Some mud puddles along the way, but lots of boardwalk going over wet areas. Very pretty and diverse landscapes!']

the lake is absolutely breathtaking. 
it's very easy to get lost here.

["hike isn't much. lake is pretty ", 'The hike itself is lack lustre but if you want to the top and overlook the lake it’s worth it', 'Very cool spot!￼', 'Great little walk in to the small lake. ", 'Beautiful, easy, wide, very worth final destination. Jade colored water looked like another version of Lake Louise but on the East side. Totally blown away. ', 'Easy walk to the lake. ['Rough finish not marked very well!!!', 'There’s a part of it that the map is wrong and gets you losts in the woods. Luckily it’s the part closets to the rails to trails so you can figure it out. There is a Road not on the map that doesn’t get you lost. ', 'Glad to have the app...many trails that lead off.  A bit Marshy', 'Marshy in spots, but some great views and nice forest', 'The first part was good. Though wet in some spots it was no problem navigating.
